name: 2019-08-09 23.41.51 2106729189952863780_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Saw the Kyoto show at @the_met_museum_of_art again. I highly recommend it. Felt a profound sense of kinship with the work, some of it is just instinctual, as if I've held the paintings from the past edo period and more in my heart, in my senses.. the diaphanous worlds unfolding, the ground and sky as one...the vessels and bodies of water and wind, ornamental and simple... wonderful to feel my new work of innerscape paintings having connective tissue with the 17th century works and still being wholly contemporary engagements.

name: 2019-08-09 23.58.16 2106737450725521873_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Spent a weekend in NYC celebrating Lexie’s high school graduation with a trip to Hadestown. But first, brunch at The Plaza’s Palm Court. So wonderful to be there again, 28 years later, after first experiencing it with my dear friend with whom Lexie shares a name. ❤️ And then the Met, gelato and macchiatos at E.A.T., and Central Park. Lexie named the six turtles we saw in the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir after Henry the VIII’s wives because of course she did. (“Six” is headed to Broadway, btw!)...#palmcourt #plazahotel #shakshuka #islands #sappho #metropolitanmuseumofart #Wheatstacks #dogsalwaysdogs

name: 2019-08-10 00.12.30 2106744610999907934_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Here is the companion Francois de Troy to the one I posted yesterday.  In this one the amorous advance is gently resisted.  These pictures are now seen through the lens of gender politics so that it is perhaps more difficult than at any previous time to appreciate the language of manners and intimated sexual intrigue they were meant to convey.  Paintings of astonishing delicacy and brilliance.  #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #amourous #languageoflove

name: 2019-08-10 01.22.06 2106779647824863667_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Please vote for me.I entered a contest at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The contest is almost over, it will be closed for voting on August 12th.  The way the contest works is that the artwork with the most votes goes to a jury.  If  the jury selections your artwork it will be made into a piece of artwork to be sold in the metropolitan museums store.  I really hope that I get a chance to be judged.  So please vote for me the link is in my bio.  You will get a confirmation from the Metropolitan Museum of art,once you get the confirmation you have to answer it, or the vote won’t count.  So  please vote for me the link is in my bio.  #art #artistoninstagram #artist #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #nyc #nycskyline #nycskyscrapers #hudson #hudsonriver #womenartists #womanart #womanartist #fauvist #colorful #landscape #artcontest #metstore #femaleartist #femaleartists#artforeveryone

name: 2019-08-10 01.33.54 2106785582679410695_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This crowded, swirling composition fully embodies the dark magic and power of a Witches’ Sabbath and pulls us, the viewers, into this hellish scene. The witches on the ground are preparing a potion or ointment for flying, while some of their sisters are already airborne, mounted on fabulous creatures, broomsticks or what appears to be a ram. The witches are accompanied by their familiars – cats, snakes, and dragons – and surrounded by bones and odd body parts. Quite bewitching! 🧙‍♀️⠀⠀Andries Stock (Netherlandish, 1572/82–after 1648) after Jacques de Gheyn II (Netherlandish, 1565–1629), Witches Preparing for Sabbath, ca. 1610, engraving [2001.648]⠀⠀#metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #onview #witches #bewitching #witchessabbath #degheyn #engraving

name: 2019-08-10 02.34.00 2106815829862890819_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: WinterJean Antoine Houdon (French, Versailles 1741–1828 Paris) A frileuse is a woman subject to cold. A marble version (Musée Fabre, Montpellier), dated 1783, was originally intended as an allegory of Winter. For the Museum's bronze, cast by Houdon himself and coming from the collection of the duc d'Orléans, Houdon stripped the spiraling columnar composition to its bare essentials. The girl's tremulous flesh is offset by her tightly drawn shawl, elegant but hardly adequate.Accession Number: 62.55#winter  #jeanantoinehoudon #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #metnyc #marble #sculpture  #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #metnyc #marble #sculpture #museums #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #metnyc #sculpture #sculptures #artsculptures #marblesculptures #sculptures #museos #museums #artmuseums #museumstagram #nycmuseums #girlsinmuseums #peopleinmuseums #museumspaces #museumspass #museumoftheworld #museumstag #museumspassambassador #museumholic #museumholics

name: 2019-08-10 02.51.57 2106824863334715627_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 👇👇👇..💥 چقدر با این جمله موافقین؟..💥به نظر من اگر یک طراح  همچین نگاهی داشته باشه، می تونه از نهایت خلاقیتش استفاده کنه، چون دیگه ذهنش محدودیتی براش ایجاد نمیکنه، دیگه براش ترسی از خلق چیزی که متفاوته وجود نداره ،  ذهنش در مورد چیزی ایراد نمیگیره و قضاوتش نمی کنه.یک طراح خیلی خوش شانسه اگر بتونه در همه چیز زیبایی ببینه.💥الکساندر مک کویین طراح بریتانیایی که پیش از اینکه لاین لباس خودش را در سال دوهزار و چهار پایه گذاری کند، سرپرست بخش طراحیِ قسمت مد برندهایی مثل  ژیوانشی بود.او عقیده داشت فعالیت در این مجموعه ها خلاقیت او را محدود میکند. در سال دوهزار و ده، مدت زمان کمی بعد از درگذشت مادرش دست به خودکشی زد.آثار مک کویین در سال دوهزار و یازده در یک بزرگداشت در موزه متروپولیتن نیویورک ارائه و به نمایش گذاشته شد.مک کویین از طبقه فقیر جامعه برخواست و به یک طراح بین المللی تبدیل شد. طراحی های خارق العاده  و پر از خلاقیت او دنیای مد را شگفت زده کرد و افسانه آثارش تا به امروز ادامه دارد.در حال حاضر Sara  Burton برند مک کویین را اداره می کند.او هیچ وقت به استایل های رسمی علاقه ای نداشت و بیشتر اوقات با شلوار جین و پیراهن چهارخانه دگمه دار دیده می شد.مک کویین در سن شانزده سالگی از مدرسه اخراج و در یک خیاط خانه مردانه‌مشغول به کار شد و در‌همان دوره به این‌نتیجه‌رسید که‌آینده اش در طراحی لباس است. بعد از گذراندن دورانی به عنوان دستیار طراحان لباس در میلان به لندن بازگشت و در مدسه طراحی معروف سنت مارتینز مشغول به تحصیل شد و مدرک فوق لیسانس خود را در رشته طراحی مد دریافت‌کرد.او بعد از طراحی شلوار های bumster  موفقیت زیادی در عرصه مد کسب کرد .بعد از گذشت چهار سال از فارق التحصیل شدن ، به عنوان سرپرست طراحی ژیوانشی شروع به فعالیت کرد.در سال دوهزار و چهار  Gucci پنجاه و یک درصد از سهام کمپانی خصوصی مک کویین را خریداری کرد و با اینکار کمک بزرگی به پیشرفت کسب و کار این طراح شد.......#الکساندر_مک_کوئین#فشن#فشن_دیزاینر#فشن_شو#دوخت#طراحی_لباس#طراح_لباس#alexandermacqueen#saraburton #fashiondesigner#design#savagebeauty#style#styleoftheday#quotes#quote#metropolitanmuseumofart

text: Jacob Lawrence. The Photographer. 1942. Watercolor, gouache, and graphite on paper. 22 1/8in x 30 1/2in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. ---"The Human subject is the most important thing. My work is abstract in the sense of having been designed and composed, but it is not abstract in the sense of having no human content I want to communicate. I want the idea to strike right away." -- Jacob Lawrence.#JacobLawrence #BlackandBlueChip

text: Living in a host country requires many many struggles, challenges as well as adaption. One the most crucial adaptation is to adapt your hobbies and pastime to the entertaining culture of country of destination. Walking and cycling are the most popular hobbies here, which must be taken it into account while thinking about weekends plans. Walking in such a pleasant weather with a mild fresh wind that is gently touching your face is something you’ve never experienced it in the most part of Asia in middle of summer time. ..📸Photo by: @ferya_photos #photo #photos #photography #photographer #photograph #photooftheday #naturephotography #netherlands #holland #rotterdam #bridge #seaview #sailing #erasmus #metropolitanmuseumofart #europe #travelgram #photogram #dutch #harbour #port #dutchlife #ferya_photos #erasmusburg #nederland #rottergram

name: 2019-08-10 08.27.45 2106993882773190372_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Insomniac III” (1997) by #JacobKainen (American, 1909-2001). Monotype in color. Signed and dated by the artist....Jacob Kainen was a painter, printmaker, journalist, scholar, collector, and curator. Kainen was born in Waterbury, Connecticut in 1909. He studied at the Art Students League and Pratt Institute. Shortly after, the artist joined the John Reed Club and met Diego Rivera, Henry Glintenkamp, George Ault, and Stuart Davis. In 1940, Kainen had his first solo exhibition mounted at the A.C.A. Gallery. In 1944, he was appointed curator of the Division of Graphic Arts at the National Museum of American History in Washington, D.C. Kainen also worked as a curator of prints and drawings for 6 years at the National Collection or Fine Arts (now the Smithsonian American Art Museum). He retired from that position in 1970. In 1976, a retrospective of Kainen’s work was mounted at the National Collection of Fine Arts. Jacob Kainen died March 19, 2001 in Chevy Chase, Maryland at the age of 92. His work can be found in numerous collections and major museums worldwide.

name: 2019-08-10 08.50.25 2107005285431541251_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: "Mourning Victory" by Daniel Chester French. Commission for the Melvin Memorial. The piece was commission by James C. Melvin to honor his three brothers who died fighting for the Union in the Civil War. The sculpture depicts an angel coming out from under the ravages of war. She is shrouded with an American flag and if you look close you can see the stars of the flag above her head. In the second photo you can see the feathers of the angel's wing revealed on the side. Such a beautiful and powerful image to honor those who fought for the freedom of ALL men and women and defeated the evil institution of legalized slavery. (1912-1915)#met #metropolitanmuseumofart #sculpture #marble #civilwar #union #jamescmelvin #danielchesterfrench #carving #angel #flag #star #memorial #mourningvictory #history #museum #victorian #nouveau #wing #peace

name: 2019-08-10 20.14.22 2107349533418722292_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 70°F (20°C) with 50° humidity is the ideal temperature to store archival #fashion, though it can vary for specific artifacts. 📋 ..Re-reading this insightful article for this morning's light read. ☕️🗞💕."In the brightness of the studio’s main office, the Lucky dress from John #Galliano Fall 2005 Couture collection for Christian #Dior is laid out on a table like a body waiting to be examined—only you absolutely cannot touch it, even with the appropriate gloves," writes @steffyotka in "Writing Fashion History at the Met, One Dress at a Time" for @voguerunway. 🏷. 📷: by @HunterAbrams.Image 1: Creation, House of @Dior (French, founded 1947), @jgalliano (British, born Gibraltar, 1960), Fall 2005–6; Purchase, the Dorothy Strelsin Foundation Inc. Gift, 2006 (2006.22a–e)..Image 2: Evening dress, Gianni #Versace (Italian, 1946–1997), Gianni @Versace (Italian, founded 1978), 1996; Gift of Donatella Versace, 1999 (1999.328.3)..Image 3: From left: Ball Gown, #CharlesJames (American, born Great Britain, 1906-1978), 1949-50; Gift of Arturo and Paul Peralta-Ramos, 1954 (2009.300.2786). ..Ball Gown, Charles James (American, born Great Britain, 1906-1978), 1949; Gift of Eleanor Lambert, 1957 (C.I.57.31.1). ..Ball Gown, Charles James (American, born Great Britain, 1906-1978), 1949-50; Brooklyn Museum Costume Collection at the #MetropolitanMuseumofArt, Gift of the #BrooklynMuseum, 2009; Gift of Erik Lee Preminger in memory of his mother, Gypsy Rose Lee, 1993 (2009.300.585a–d). ..Ball Gown, Charles James (American, born Great Britain, 1906-1978), 1953; @BrooklynMuseum Costume Collection at the @MetMuseum, Gift of the Brooklyn Museum, 2009; Gift of Baroness W. von Langendorff, 1953 (2009.300.3507). ..Muslin, Charles James (American, born Great Britain, 1906-1978), 1953; #BrooklynMuseumCostumeCollection at the #Met, Gift of the Brooklyn Museum, 2009; Gift of Baroness W. von Langendorff, 1953 (2009.300.781).

text: Radcliffe Bailey. Untitled. 2005. Mixed media on wood. 49in x 61in x 5 1/2in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. ---“I started out painting but was more a sculpture major. It was easier to move painting than sculpture, and my work has always fallen between the two. Some people see me as a painter, but I don’t see myself as a painter or a sculptor, just an artist.” -- Radcliffe Bailey.#RadcliffeBailey #BlackandBlueChip

Entitled, “Camp, Notes on Fashion” this popular show showcases more than 250 objects, dating from the 17th century to the present. Here is a small sampling of what is in store for you. On view until September 8th, this exhibit is a fun afternoon at one of the greatest museums of the world. .x.The Metropolitan Museum of Art is located in Central Park. Our guided walking tour [more information at our website] of the Park goes as far as The Met. What is the oldest man-made object in the Park opposite to The Met. name: 2019-08-10 22.28.16 2107416926951002775_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A primeira vez que conheci o MET foi em 2007 numa viagem solo que fiz à NYC e fiquei maravilhada com tudo.Nunca tinha visto nada igual.O museu é impressionante, não só pelas obras, mas pelos incríveis detalhes da arquitetura e das alas.Sem dúvida vale cada visita.❤️Mas dessa vez foi especialmente emocionante por estar acompanhada dos meus amores e por poder ver o Lucas se apaixonar pelo espaço. 🥰#ficaadica para quem for conhecer: use o mapa e marque cada  sala visitada. São tantas que a gente se perde se não acompanhar direitinho. E tem espaços incríveis a cada nova sala, vale a pena o cuidado para não perder nada!#familia #family #familytrip #amomuitotudoisso #amor #familytime #familia💕 #amoviajar #viagemdossonhos #viagememfamilia #trip #viagem #viagemperfeita #viageminternacional #nyc #newyork #newyorkcity #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #museum

name: 2019-08-10 22.34.28 2107420043554245390_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Jimmy Page’s “Number One” 1959-1960 Gibson Les Paul Standard. | Played through every @ledzeppelin recording and performance from 1969 to 2007, the sunburst slab remains Page’s main guitar. Note the cigarette burn on the cutaway and iconic Zoso cabinet..Jimmy Page was a long-time idol of mine: wild arpeggio-filled solos, dark dabbling in the occult, treks through Morocco, dragon suits and the world’s greatest rock and roll mixed with mystery and mysticism. Surreal to see this guitar, pored over for years in Guitar Player mag and more, in NYC.

name: 2019-08-10 23.06.34 2107436199172990827_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: CAMP en el Metropolitan Museum of Art, Nueva York. Muestra con alrededor de 250 objetos que datan desde el siglo XVII hasta el presente relacionados con esta estética que por mucho tiempo fue considerado como de “mal gusto”. El eje es el ensayo de 1964 “Camp: Notes on Fashion”, de la intelectual estadounidense Susan Sontag.// CAMP, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. Sample with about 250 objects dating from the seventeenth century to the present related to this aesthetic that for a long time was considered as "bad taste." The axis is the 1964 essay "Camp: Notes on Fashion" by the American intellectual Susan Sontag. #nuevayork #nuevayork🗽 #nuevayorkcity #newy #newyork #newyorkcity #newyorkfashion #met #metgala2019 #metropolitanmuseumofart #summercamp2019 #camp #camp2019 #metcamp #susansontag

text: Coney Island yesterday was an incredible time! Building community  and inspiring curiosity. Nothing feels better than coming together for something greater than yourself. Great work to post soon! Hope to see you at the Met !If you are at the Met today you will find power and purpose. If you are elsewhere we send power your way. We seek, we gain.Today is a marvelous day. Today is another day with infinite possibilities. That alone is inspiring. Every day is unpredictable. It can be unpredictable for the greatest of reasons. Today we can become millionaires. Today we can change the world. Today we can revolutionize art. Today we can make someone feel significant. All of these outcomes are unpredictable and infinite. Let possiblity guide you through this day. We hope to see you and where ever you find yourself all power is with you. 🙌..#AOTM #aotmatconey #artistsofthemet #artcollective #coneyisland #boardwalksketch #metmuseum #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #collectivepower #unify #forart #nycollective

name: 2019-08-11 00.35.51 2107481139808403481_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: @olkagurniak :New York Він може бути зовсім різним - хтось бачить натовпи людей, сміття і щурів на вулицях, бездомних, постійне будівництво, затори, дороге життя, швидкий ритм, за яким інколи встигнути важко і ще багато всього, що має місто, в якому проживає понад 8 млн осіб. - в той час інші помічають лише посмішки перехожих, надзвичайні краєвиди, різноманітність культур і людей навколо, чудові парки і музеї, від яких перехоплює подих, ритм і музику міста, з якою ти зливаєшся, величезні можливості, які спонукають щораз ставати кращим... Ти сам обираєш, що бачити, але байдужим до Нью Йорку бути не можна. I love you NYC#nyc #nycgo #view #nycview #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #UkrainiansInUSA #travel #travelblogger #блогукраїнською #блогпроподорожі #тревелблог #тревелблогер #тревел #seeyourcity

name: 2019-08-11 00.39.58 2107483217918182620_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: @olkagurniak :DateЯк часто ви ходите на побачення, будучи вже одруженим? Як часто ви робите собі приємні моменти і підкидаєте жару в вогонь?На годиннику було 16.33, до закриття музею залишалось менше півгодини, ти схопив мене за руку і ми побігли... мені перехоплювало подих і думками я була з синочком який мирно спав в Central Park під опікою бабусі і дідуся.  Ми оминали натовпи людей і граційно  бігли між залами, я схаменулась вже на даху в теплих обіймах з чудовим виглядом на улюблений New York. Ми сміялись, жартували і були як діти. Музей закривався, ми одні з останніх проходили пустими залами, я тримала тебе за руку і відчувала твоє серце. Ти мій Всесвіт! Все було як вперше... #love #nyc #nycgo #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #family #date #wearetravelgirls #ukrnewyork #travel #travelblog #olkagurniak #newyork #блогукраїнською #подорожі #українцівсша

name: 2019-08-11 06.53.34 2107671255520709684_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: You may notice that many of Lorica's designs are based on later armors from the 16th and 17th century. The reason I'm drawn to these pieces is for details like these (from a Dutch cuirassier armor at @metarmsandarmor). 😍 By this time armor was at its height as an art form and fashion, even as it waned on the battlefield. When I'm choosing pieces to adapt I try to look for designs that are recognizably distinct from one another. No offense to my 14th and 15th century afficionados out there, but once you've seen one white armor or German Gothic harness you've sort of seen them all. 🤷 I love those periods and styles to death, but the individuality and variety in later pieces is just exquisite! ❤️_____#armsandarmor #armor #armour #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #metarmsandarmor #16thcentury #17thcentury #historicalfashion #historynerd #historygeek #historyjunkie #historymuseum #knight #armorer #medievalhistory #renaissancestyle #medievalfashion #renaissancefashion

name: 2019-08-11 09.16.37 2107743251745525581_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Apollo’s Muse: The Moon in the Age of Photography, exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Worth checking out if a bit Western Euro/U.S.-centric and lacking in coherence. Still, had some beautiful examples of 19th century ground-based photography and sketches. The popular culture was well done but lacked engagement with Russian ephemera. Here you can see pics of 1/ preparatory drawings (recreated in 1930) of Georges Melies’ A Trip to the Moon (1902); 2/ a beautiful Chesley Bonestell painting (“study for lunar landscape”) in 1949 for the makers of the movie Destination Moon (1950) 3/ two pictures of Soviet space dogs, the top one of Laika, the bottom one of Belka and Strelka. Nothing to do with the moon but iconic pics, the top one actually a still from a film. #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #apollosmuse #georgesmelies #atriptothemoon #chesleybonestell #destinationmoon #sovietspacedogs #laika #belkaandstrelka #strelkaandbelka #spacerace #apollo #moon #moonrace #photography #historyofphotograpy

name: 2019-08-11 11.41.42 2107816274141826614_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Mäda Primavesi (Gustav Klimt 1912)﻿﻿ニューヨークに来ました。﻿今日は、念願のメトロポリタン美術館に行きました💖﻿この絵はクリムト後期の傑作です。﻿ウイーン工房の融資者、オットー・プリマヴェージの９歳の娘さんの肖像画らしいです。﻿﻿クリムトの絵はゴールドが多い印象だったので、この絵を見て驚きました。﻿少女も、背景の色も、服についているお花も全て可愛い✨✨﻿語彙が乏しくてすみません😅﻿今まで見たクリムトの絵で、いちばん好きです💕﻿﻿I'm in NY 🇱🇷﻿Today I went to metropolitan museum of art.﻿This is Klimt's masterpiece.﻿I love it very much 😍﻿﻿﻿﻿#クリムト#メトロポリタン美術館#ニューヨーク観光#美術館好きな人と繋がりたい﻿#klimt#gustavklimt#metropolitanmuseumofart#newyork

name: 2019-08-11 12.33.59 2107842581177690340_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: There's definitely no shortage of great museums in #newyork. The #metropolitanmuseumofart, often shortened to just 'the Met', is another example of this. It currently hosts an exhibition featuring the instruments of many famous #rocknroll musicians (such as Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis, Prince, Eric Clapton and Jimmy Page), but its permanent collection is nothing to scoff at, either.Another exhibition is dedicated to the concept of 'campy' culture and its influence on modern #fashion. In fact, there's so much to see at the Met we only managed to scratch the surface of everything it has to offer. Luckily, our entry tickets are valid for several days, so we plan to go back tomorrow. 😉 #manhattan #unitedstates #nofilter

name: 2019-08-11 12.37.18 2107844257833690703_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The MET believes in displaying art under natural sunlight whenever possible because they were created by the masters in that environment, and that was how they were initially meant to be enjoyed.....#art #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #newyork #travel #travelphoto #travelgram

name: 2019-08-11 12.48.16 2107849776071741931_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Finally, I got to see Leonardo da Vinci’s  Saint Jerome in the wilderness at #metropolitanmuseumofart today. The moment that I set my eyes on it, the agonizing figure immediately influenced me. The muscles in the face and neck are almost anatomical, and it conveys strong emotions. Second is by Rembrandt#rembrandt , a Dutch school master #dutchschool . It shows Rembrandt’s meditation on the meaning of fame by depicting a scene that Aristotle put his hand on a bust sculpture of Alexander the Great. Who is immortal? .Third, another Rembrandt with his signature dark palette portrait painting.#artlover #artysciencee #artcollection #artcollector #saintjerome #leonardodavinci #awesomeart #oilpainting #artist #artistsoninstagram #artistsoninstagram #artappreciation #arthistory

name: 2019-08-11 13.43.20 2107872443205706012_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Mommy took me to the MET today! At first, I really didn't like it. Art is boring sometimes. But then we saw some really cool things and I started having more fun. It was terrifying a bit because I felt like there were so many eyes starring at me. I saw armor, mummies, old furniture, paintings, and so much more. It was huge!!! I almost got lost! I wish I could be a superhero with my superhero suit too! There were also so many cool instruments! I am exhausted now! #met #camp #metropolitanmuseumofart #metrokids #kidsofig #kidsofinstagram #instakid #instatoddlers #instatoddler #instakids #nyfamily #nyfamilies #tourists #tourist #kids #kid #nykids #family #nyc

name: 2019-08-11 19.47.33 2108060811353100265_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🏺“The Winged Bull and Lion, are but two of the sculptures showcased from the Assyrian capital city of Nimrud (ancient Kalhu) in a space designed to evoke their original palace setting.🏺 The ancient state of Assyria lay in what is now northern Iraq. 🏺The sculptures in the gallery all date to the reign of Ashurnasirpal II (r. 883–859 B.C.), a king whose military expeditions to the west reached the shores of the Mediterranean Sea, and helped lay the foundations for an empire that would eventually encompass the entire Near East.🏺 These colossal winged bull and lions, were two of many that stood as guardians in the ancient Near Eastern palace. 🏺They confronted visitors and helped to ward off evil spirits and demons. 🏺The Metropolitan Museum’s bull and lion originally formed part of two gateways in a courtyard. In antiquity, each gateway was guarded by a matching pair, either two bulls or two lions.”~ excerpts from the MET 🏺🏺🏺 “Winged Bull and Lion” 883–859 B.C, in the Assyrian Sculpture Court-Department of Ancient Near Eastern Art, 🏺 @metmuseum 🏺🏺🏺 #wingedbullandlion #artoftheday #artoflooking #assyriansculpture #assyriansculpturecourt #metropolitanmuseumofart #myphotography #myphoto #antiquity 🏺🏺🏺

name: 2019-08-11 21.12.57 2108103793085529672_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I'M A NEW YORKER"Ich bin ein Berliner "(" I am Berliner "), is a famous phrase pronounced by the president of the United States John F. Kennedy on June 26, 1963 in West Berlin on the balcony of the building of the 'Rathaus Schöneberg', then the town hall from West Berlin, when Willy Brandt was their mayor.  Yesterday, Saturday, August 10, 2019, I repeated: "I'm a New Yorker." The previous Thursday I had received the New York City Identification Card in the mail. This card is a valid identification document for the New York police. It also allows you to enter the best museums in the city for free, get discounts on medications and many more advantages.  I spent the day at the Metropolitan Museum, which is open from 10 in the morning until 9 at night. Before, as an active New Yorker, among trees and meadows, I traveled, from north to south, in Central Park, about 3 miles, greeting the morning sun.  I will not talk about the Metropolitan Museum (MET). I will only mention Luisa Ignacia Roldán Villavicencio (Seville, September 8, 1652 [baptism date] - Madrid, January 10, 1706), La Roldana. She is a great figure of baroque sculpture. Of her three terracotta of small dimensions are exhibited. Three exceptional jewels. I illustrate them with mobile photos of the pile, which give what they can of it.  This morning the blackbird's trill woke me up, which has landed on the window sill. La vita è bella. Life is Beautiful........ .......#newyork #newyorkcity #newyork_world#newyorkgram #newyorklovers #newyorklike #newyorker #newyorkers#newyorkerstyle #met #metropolitan #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumsculpture #centralpark #centralpark5 #baroc #barocco #barocostyle #sculpture #sculptures #themet #museum #museo #metropolitanmuseumofart  #newyorkcity #manhattan #paintings #painting #instagood #themetropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-11 22.05.00 2108129991901232658_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 16th century Persian rug, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New YorkThis prayer rug or sajjadah, identified by its central niche design, the Qur’anic inscriptions in its border, and the names of God in its spandrels, is consistent with a group of carpets thought to have been a diplomatic gift from the Safavid Shah ‘Abbas I to the Ottoman sultan Murad III (r. 1574-95). Because some of the verses promote a Shiite perspective by referring to the intercession of Shiite imams with God, the group was apparently never used by the Sunni Ottomans. This carpet feature warps in two colors-one of a natural, undyed fiber and the other of a rarely seen intense red-that are arranged in an irregular pattern. Microscopic investigation has revealed remnants of the original selvage, or the woven edge, which is similar to some of those found on the masterpiece Safavid Carpets from the early sixteenth century.Silk (warp and weft), wool (pile), metal wrapped thread; asymmetricaly knotted thread, brocaded.Dimensions:Rug: L. 63 1/2 in. (161.3 cm)W. 43 1/4 in. (109.9 cm)

name: 2019-08-12 00.21.50 2108198863444688291_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ✨”Indeed, the essence of Camp is its love of the unnatural: of artifice and exaggeration.” - Susan Sontag, 1964✨...What a fantastic, whimsical, fabulous & vibrant exhibit CAMP is. Oh how I enjoyed taking a look at fashion throughout our history but through unsettlement of ones on mind. The ability to go beyond what is normalized. Camp does not poke fun at the state of world it MAKES FUN out of them. What visionary and outlandish pieces. A feast for my eyes. (Located at @metmuseum)...We then went to “Play It Loud: Instruments of Rock & Roll” 🎵 and what a journey that was for my eyes and ears. Getting to see the instruments of some of the most famous people in the world. Some of which came from private and personal collections!🎶 (located at @metmuseum)...We journeyed across town to go to the Museum of Natural History and had a ball looking at all the dioramas and remembering old childhood trips. 🐗 🐳 🦁 (@amnh)...#NewYorkStyle 💕Top: @oldnavyPants: @gapShoes: #oldnavyBag: @marcjacobsShades: #thrifted...It was quite the day. Swipe through to see a bit of it. Let’s see where the next adventure takes us!✌️...#amnh #museumofnaturalhistory #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #museummile #nyc #nycadventures #music #rockandroll #playitloud #camp #campatthemet

name: 2019-08-12 06.00.30 2108369321789897339_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Beautiful gardens. We are drawn to nature. It is calming and fills us with delight. But when we have a piece of nature in our backyard, we resort to creating an elaborate look that varies from geometric to wild. But it does not look like nature or is it nature as we would like. When we recreate our view of nature an amazing other look is the outcome. Humans love to change their surroundings, not always to the better.  #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #canon #wander #vacations #travellife #travelpics #lonelyplanet #travelphoto #adventuretime #getaway #travelstoke #exploreeverything #InstaPhoto #PicOfTheDay #PhotoOfTheDay #visualsoflife #worldtravelbook #instatravel #travelgram #tourism #passportready #LPPhotochallengekaleidoscope #yourshotphotographer #nomadict #wander #travellife #travelpics #lonelyplanet⁠

text: Coleccion ... falling in love"Otoño invierno 2020Enamorarse es el estadio mágico donde la realidad descubre  sensaciones, emociones y deseos, es vestir el alma y dibujarla con la ilusión permanente de un amor recóndito e inesperado, tan real que puede parecer un sueño y tan puro que es dificil de ocultar, pues lo que es bello de corazón no se esconde.... Brocados de sedas metalizados le dan forma corporea a esta coleccion, romántica y bañada de una estela de elegancia sin pretenciones extravagantes, una propuesta de lujo donde los cortes impecables seducen la silueta femenina vinculando el neoclásisismo romantico con la poesia contemporanea de Falling in love.... #fallinginlovecolection  #rdfw2019  #hautecouture2019  #tendenciasdemoda  #dressoftheday  #dresses_gowns_fashion  #dresses👗  #brocados  #designerdresses  #fashiontrends  #designersoftheyear  #HOLLYWOODGLAM #hollywooddreams  #losangelescalifornia🇺🇸 #metropolitanmuseumofart  #metropolitanfashionweek  #nycityworld  #CelebrityDesigner  #designersvenezuelan  #GALERIADEMODADOUGLASTAPIA

name: 2019-08-12 08.04.43 2108431842236794108_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: We are lovers, curators, and educators of sneakers, fashion, art, and culture. Every week we feature a staff pick of something we love outside of our normal stream of commerce.⁣⁠⁠One of our Rule of Next Staff members recently attended the Asian Lantern Festival, a visual spectacle of culture, lights, and art. An event for all ages to enjoy, this years festival will be held at the Cleveland Metroparks  Zoo, and will include various Chinese tradition based performances, such as acrobatic arts, martial arts, juggling and balancing acts. "This year’s festival also features more than 40 all-new, large-scaled illuminated displays featuring hundreds of individual and interactive lanterns. These include a walk-through 100 foot long shark tunnel, 30 foot tall giant panda and an expansive display of Chinese pagodas". (Cleveland Metroparks)⁠⁠⁠The festival will be available August 15-18. For more information please visit:⁠⁠We hope you are having a great weekend!⁠⁠Rule of Next Staff⁠

name: 2019-08-12 09.34.11 2108476868744699224_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ¿Qué es Camp? 💭 .“Camp” es verbo, sustantivo y adjetivo. 🌈Camp lo definió Susan Sontag con su poema del mismo nombre en 1964 y fue la base del tema de la exhibición de este año en el Museum of Art’s Costume Institute del Museo Metropolitano de la ciudad de Nueva York. 🗽.La exhibición tiene como centro el poema de Sontag y piezas de diseñadores y casas de alta costura como @Moschino, @off____white , @ysl y demás. ✨ Realmente un espectáculo visitar y ver como el concepto de Camp da riendas libres con sus frases expuestas en cada recuadro con piezas que lo complementan como:.-“Gender without Genitals”-“A second Childhood”🦄-“Cultural Slumming”-“Camp sees everything in quotations”-“Camp is Failed Seriousness”-“The hallmark of Camp is the spirit of extravagance. Camp is a woman walking around in a dress made of three million feathers.”💐-“Camp is productively anachronistic and critically renders specific historical norms obsolete.”.Les dejo en mis stories más fotos del libro 📖 y de la misma exhibición para que conozcan las dualidades que Camp nos muestra, las extravagancias, las cosas del pueblo y de las masas, los lujos y la elusiva realeza del mundo de la moda que según Sontag- solo ellos entenderán qué realmente es Camp.

text: Quem me conhece deve imaginar a minha emoção em ficar pertinho de uma obra tão importante como esta. Van Gogh foi a inspiração para o meu trabalho final da faculdade e simplesmente admiro demais a arte dele. Nem preciso dizer que o meu coração disparou e que realmente me emocionei. Que momento! 🤩#vangogh #vicentevangogh #autoretrato #art #arte #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #gabix #gabixinteriores #designdeinteriores #designerdeinteriores #interiordesign #interiordesigner #abdoficial #instadecor #instadesign #decor #decoration #decoracao #interiores #design #house #home #world  #homedecor #interiorplataform #project #anp19

name: 2019-08-12 10.09.35 2108494690676084925_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 12|08|2019#pitturamoderna Titolo: Ragazza con blusa da marinaio Autore: Amedeo Modigliani Anno: 1918Ubicazione: Metropolitan Museum of Art..Inutile nasconderlo, la mia passione per Modigliani è sconfinata ed il ritratto proposto rappresenta, sempre a mio parere, in maniera egregia le vette di pura ed eterna bellezza raggiunte dal pittore livornese. La protagonista del dipinto è una ragazza semplice, come si suole dire, del popolo, che si presenta con una blusa da marinaio e ci guarda dritto negli occhi. Modigliani la inserisce in un interno dalle pareti solo apparentemente anonime. Nulla è lasciato al caso in queste opere della maturità estrema del pittore, la pittura, l’arte della pittura, trabocca ad ogni angolo tra pennellate che si coagulano a grumi e rimandi cromatici. In tanta sostanza pittorica vibra poi la linea, l’insuperabile e divina linea modiglianesca che definisce i tratti della donna fino a trasfigurarla in un eterno  modello di bellezza e profondissima dolcezza femminile. Entrati in questa dinamica, diventa impossibile non perdersi e abbandonarsi alla pura contemplazione del quadro. Grazie Modi’, gigante della nostra pittura. #amedeomodigliani #modigliani #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #portrait#art #arte#paint #canvas #ognimeseunesperienza #agosto

name: 2019-08-12 21.56.48 2108850640043554593_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: At last. Went to see the "Camp" show at the Met. in the company of a Canadian family that included an 11-year-old boy, who asked open-minded, curious questions about Oscar Wilde and sequined sailor pants. “They've never known oppression," said his mother of the kid's generation. This was my favorite photo from the exhibit, which was just as scattershot and inconclusive in its attempts to define camp as everyone has said. I only just realized that my second-favorite photo (swipe to see) captures a riff on the Shining twins. Which photo do you like best? Let me know below...#campmet #metcamp2019 #campy #kitschy #metcamp #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumofartnewyork #metropolitanmuseumofartnyc #metropolitanmuseumofartcostumeinstitute #susansontag #susansontagnotesoncamp #fashionexhibit #fashionexhibitions #artfashion #artandfashion #fashionandart #fashionisart #artoffashion #fashionmeetsart #artmeetsfashion #wsjoffduty #fashionhistory #fashionhistory101 #historyfashion #historyoffashion #thehistoryoffashion

name: 2019-08-12 23.13.10 2108889075604202520_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A circa 1923 jade, onyx, diamond, enamel, and platinum dress ornament by Georges Fouquet (French, 1862–1957). The piece measures a mammoth 9 x 3 3/4 x 1/2 inches!.In 1895 Georges Fouquet took over the the Paris jewelry firm that was established by his father in 1860. He moved the firm's styles towards something more modern continuing to supply his fashionable clientele with exquisite jewels in the latest styles through the 1930s. Fouquet, like many artists during the French Art Deco era, was influenced by the exoticism of the Far East. This particular dress ornament typifies the theatrical nature of the style. The large scale and weight of the ornament suggests that it was probably intended to be an exhibition piece rather than one to be worn regularly.....#georgefouquet #artdeco #artdecojewelry #french #france #diamond #diamondjewelry #chinese #jade #theatrical #jewelryhistory #jewelrydesigner #jewelryart #jewelryartist #couturejewelry #museum #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #NewYork #gemstone #gemstonejewelry #fashion #luxury #luxuryjewelry #jewelry #jewelrygram #instajewelry #vintage #jewelryaddict #ilovejewelry

name: 2019-08-12 23.52.34 2108908911850452564_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Day 12 of the August #writetogether challenge asks:What’s a book or story that has influenced you?So, so many, but “From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiller” by E. L. Konigsburg was one of the first. It was an early, early seed that grew into my desire to be a writer; I didn’t even realize it at the time.I read it several times and adored how it combined art with mystery. Now, books that do the same (for adults or for children) continue to be my very favorite. They are also the types of books I endeavor to write..📸 by @robjbye via @unsplash .....#authorsofinstagram #writersofinstagram #writermom #expatwriter #authorslife #authorsofig #writerslife #lifeofawriter #amdrafting #amwriting #amwritingYA #amwritinghistoricalfiction #writersfollowwriters #writerscommunity #writingcommunity #savingcaravaggio #WIP #workinprogress #historicalfictionwriter #igwriters #writersofig #instawriters #writingprocess #YAhistoricalfiction #writersofinsta #writingchallenge #metropolitanmuseumofart #mixedupfiles #writinginspo

text: Seven hours remaining! -- please VOTE for DOEprojekt’s “BACKBONE” in the MET MUSEUM’s 150 ART & DESIGN CONTEST. Click on the LINK (top of our Instagram page). “BACKBONE” is influenced by two works in the MET’s collection, the Masquerade Vest (Kanaga) 20th c. and a bone necklace, dated 1786-1482 BC.  We have shown BACKBONE at community art centers, galleries, and other venues where anyone can be strengthened by putting on BACKBONE. Contact us for upcoming venues where you too can put on BACKBONE! name: 2019-08-13 08.49.16 2109179039407958514_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A vase of flowersMargareta Haverman (Dutch, Breda 1693 - 1722)A vase of flowers stands on a stone, it’s contents spilling forth from the surrounding alcove.Visible on the heavily shadowed vase, perhaps made of terracotta or gilt bronze, are vegetable ornamentation, and a grotesque face.The bouquet, belonging to no particular season, ranges from roses and hydrangeas to lilies and an opium poppy.A white and maroon variegated tulip crowns the arrangement, its surface dotted with dewdrops.Special details, a butterfly perches on one petal and a housefly on another. Flies, a snail and swarming ants animate the still life.Cluster of green and red grapes, along with a peach, rest against the vase, obscuring its foot.Hints of decay, in form of discoloration, mark the leaves.#haverman #vaseofflowers #roses #lilies #tulip #butterfly #snail #womanpainter #dutchpainter #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-13 19.54.35 2109513896508337856_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Fra Carnevale, The Birth of the Virgin (detail), 1467, tempera and oil on wood, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York...“Breaking with convention, the artist shows the Madonna’s birth in contemporary terms. In the background the newborn baby is bathed by midwives while in the foreground women greet each other. The imposing palace, patterned on the Ducal Palace of Urbino, is decorated with reliefs derived from Roman sculpture. The picture is from an altarpiece commissioned in 1467 for Santa Maria della Bella in Urbino (a companion panel is in the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston). In Florence, Fra Carnevale worked with Filippo Lippi; he also knew the paintings of Piero della Francesca and probably met the architect-theorist Leon Battista Alberti.”....#FraCarnevale#BartolomeodiGiovanni#TheBirthoftheVirgin#MetropolitanMuseumofArt#RenaissanceArt#ItalianPaintings#palazzoducaleurbino #Urbino#Painting#Arthistory #Art#Arte #pittura#historicalcostume

text: ALTURAS • El rooftop del @metmuseum tiene unas vistas únicas de los rascacielos y el Central Park. Fui con una señora tan #newyorker que me supo explicar el significado de cada edificio frente nuestro. Las vistas desde arriba de la ciudad son algo inexplicable, que más de una vez me han dejado sin aire, experiencias únicas que hay que vivirlas y sentirlas. Aunque más de una vez me ha dado vértigo, soy una fanática de las alturas, de ver las cosas desde arriba y con otra perspectiva. Por eso también amo volar y los aviones y por eso de chiquita quería ser #astronauta (jajaj si) y ver el planeta desde afuera. name: 2019-08-13 22.44.53 2109599617017429111_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: My first opportunity to see Emanuel Leutze’s 1851 painting of “Washington Crossing  the Delaware” was back in 2007. Staff at my school site had been sent to Brooklyn for a conference on school improvement, but I spent a chunk of my time escaping from sessions and going on walkabout over to Manhattan, despite it being January, with temperatures near freezing. One of my first stops was the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where I stumbled upon the American Wing of the Museum. Still teaching fifth grade at the time, I was immediately convinced that the wing was what History Teacher Heaven had to look like: Paul Revere, John Adams, Alexander Hamilton, among others…and then this painting covering one wall. Wow. Just wow. The sheer size of it.The next time I returned to New York City, two years later, the American Wing was closed for refurbishment, so when the chance arose to go back to New York City this summer, I made damn sure I had a chance to see it again. Partly it was because I wanted to see where the Met had moved the piece, and partly because my original photograph, which I often shared with my students in class, elicited giggles, simply because in my quest to show the painting’s size, there was a nude statue randomly placed fairly close to the painting. Measuring 12.5 feet x 21.25 feet, the size of the painting still astonishes me, 12 years after seeing it the first time. But what’s even more amazing to me now, is that in my desire to take yet another, better, photo to show my students the painting’s relative size—there’s that blasted nude statue.#hehheh #AmericanWing #EmanuelLeutze #1851 #WashingtonCrossingtheDelaware #washingtononyourside #AmericanHistory #HistoryTeacher #metropolitanmuseumofart #TheMet #themetfifthavenue #CentralPark #Manhattan #MidtownManhattan #etsicvadit

name: 2019-08-14 00.14.23 2109644665477472011_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: THANK YOU to family, friends, colleagues, and friends of friends that voted for our "BACKBONE" art work, part of the MET Museum's 150th Anniversary Celebration. It appears that we are included in the top 10 entries, but we will wait to hear from the MET before we celebrate.“BACKBONE” is influenced by (at least) two works in the MET’s collection, the Masquerade Vest (Kanaga) 20th c. and a bone necklace, dated 1786-1482 BC.  We have shown BACKBONE at community art centers, galleries, and other venues where anyone can be strengthened by putting on BACKBONE. Contact us for upcoming venues where you too can put on BACKBONE! Again, thank you to all of you who supported our work with your votes during these past weeks. #met150 #metropolitanmuseumofart #wearableart #beadart #vertebrae #bonebeads #collaborativeart #kanaga #masquerade #participate #vote #contest #themetstore #voteexchange #voting #participate #artdesign #bonenecklace #fashionart #fineartprints #harlemnyc

name: 2019-08-14 01.09.27 2109672375021836810_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🐍...This sculpture is the marble version of Perseus with the Head of Medusa that Canova carved for Countess Valeria Tarnowska. He wrote that he was also shipping a plaster of the Medusa head, lest the marble one add too much weight to the statue's outstretched arm. The countess could attach the lighter plaster to the arm instead, and, placing a lit candle inside the marble one, which is hollow, she could watch the eerie light effects. Like many other Neoclassical Medusa heads, Canova's is based on the ancient marble mask the Rondanini Medusa at the Glyptothek of Munich..The motif of the severed head of Medusa teeming with snakes became one of the most characteristic subjects for cameos. The image of the head perfectly suits the round field of a tondo. Artists were challenged to capture in the motif a perfect stasis between the macabre and the sublime. Generations versed in the classics knew that Perseus presented the head to the goddess Minerva and that it thenceforth embellished her breastplate. By implication, it served the wearer as a protective talisman, tacitly announcing the triumph of good over evil..@metmuseum...Head of Medusa, Studio of Antonio Canova (1757-1822), 1806-1807, Plaster cast, with modern metal rod, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum.Tête de Méduse, Atelier d’Antonino Canova (1757-1822), 1806-1807, Fonte de plâtre, avec tige en métal moderne, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum...🗓 224th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Sculpture of Medusa (1730-1930)

name: 2019-08-14 02.09.26 2109702569965449321_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Happy birthday to James Gillray, born on this day in 1756! Gillray was well-known for his political and social satires, including this etching of Napoleon perching on the hand of his enemy, King George III. At first glance, this seems a supremely confident image: the huge figure of King George can barely see his tiny enemy. But Napoleon’s swagger and unsheathed saber hint at danger.⠀⠀James Gillray (British, 1756–1815), The King of Brobdingnag and Gulliver.–Vide. Swift's Gulliver: Voyage to Brobdingnag, June 26, 1803, hand-colored etching and aquatint [17.3.888-313]⠀⠀#metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #jamesgillray #napoleon #etching #aquatint

name: 2019-08-14 03.14.16 2109735200695438753_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Picasso’s “Portrait of Angel Fernandez de Soto,” 1903, in the home of Donald and Jean Stralem. Mrs. Stralem was the granddaughter of Phillip Lehman (Lehman Bros.), who started the collection inherited and expanded by his son Robert now housed at the Met Museum.  The Stralem collection, which featured works by Pablo Picasso, Henri Matisse, Edgar Degas, and Pierre-Auguste Renoir, was exhibited in the Met’s Kevin Roche-designed Lehman Wing before it was auctioned @sothebys in 1994 following their deaths. This work was purchased at that sale by Lord Andrew Lloyd Weber. His foundation sold the work at @christiesinc in 2010 to an anonymous buyer. #livingwithart #artinthehome #collectorshome #robertlehmancollection #pablopicasso #picasso #picassoblueperiod #picassobleuetrose #sothebysimpmod #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: Emphasis on think! We are not just what we think, fortunately. And, our bodies are wearing our thoughts and feelings like reflections - we wear thoughts and emotions on our face, they are reflected in our posture, we hear them in our our voices and it’s apparent often in our breath. So, wear it proudly, with heart and lot’s of inner dignity!  From the Camp exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art #metropolitanmuseumofart #campexhibit #wearyourfeelings#showyourgoodness #aliveandawake

name: 2019-08-14 09.05.11 2109911829295007417_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This is one of multiple works we have in our home by Leonard Lehrer. As an RN, my wife used to help care for a young girl, Anna Katrina Lehrer, when we first met in Arizona.  Anna was born with cerebral palsy and Jamie helped Anna’s parents, Marilyn and Leonard, with her care. I had just started painting in college and Jamie said I should meet Mr. Lehrer. At the time, Leonard was the Chair of ASU’s art department and the Founding Director of the School of Art. I recall the first visit to their house – original art by known artists from around the world filled every inch of every wall. As blown away as I was with this, I was equally impressed with their kindness and guidance that followed. Shortly after the initial meetings, Leonard took a position as Chair of the Department of Art & Art Professions at NYU. It was there I had the pleasure of staying with Leonard and his family in their downtown residence. He was my personal tour guide through NYC -  the Met, MoMA, Whitney and other art museums. He took me to visit numerous galleries, treated me to amazing restaurants, took me grocery shopping for what would become one of Marilyn’s gourmet meals and most importantly, shared his views and understanding of art with me. As temporary as it was, I was under his wing. Years have passed since our last communication…they were in Texas. It was based on art and ended with “one of these days we’d love to see you guys again”. Today, while searching for his contact information, I found out he had passed over a year ago. To say I’m saddened is an understatement but I’m grateful of my time with him and the advice, experience, and guidance he provided. I’ve seen a part of him everyday for years but tonight his work will be even more special and my brushstrokes will be for him. Do yourself a favor and go visit - leonardlehrer.com#leonardlehrer#lithograph#lithography#printmaking#metropolitanmuseumofart

text: 첫 사진은 멋진 울엄마로💜 박물관이나 미술관을 너무 좋아하는 엄마를 위해서 이번 여행에서 뉴욕에서 유명한 미술관은 다 갔었다. 그 중에서 메트로폴리탄 미술관은 꼭 가고싶었던 것 중에 하나였다. 여기는 자세히 하나하나 감상하려면 3일이 걸릴 정도로 어마어마하게 크지만 그래도 6시간 동안 계속 돌아다니며 대부분 다 보고 나왔다. 고흐, 모네, 마네, 피카소 등등 다양한 작품이 있었지만 개인적으로 르누아르 작품 볼 때 행복했다ㅎㅎ 엄마도 너무 좋아했으니 만족! 뉴욕거주자는 기부입장이므로 나중에 시간나면 또 가야징 #metropolitanmuseumofart #메트로폴리탄뮤지엄

name: 2019-08-14 21.40.41 2110292073218710595_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Я, однозначно, не работник года, но уж точно главный работник последних месяцев. Мой босс должен повесить мою фотографию при входе. При этом я не работаю с понедельника по пятницу как все простые смертные, нет у меня ни понедельника, ни пятницы. Это музей. Рабочая неделя началась в воскресенье и не заканчивается до сих пор. Так вот, когда вы все успеваете жить?😹И это, принимая во внимание факт, что я работаю в лучшем музее Америки и во втором в мире. Я прихожу в музей до открытия, у меня есть уникальная возможность разглядывать неповторимые шедевры Леонардо да Винчи, Ван Гога, Боттичелли в абсолютно свободных от туристов и ценителей искусства галереях, допивать остывший чай, сидя напротив одной из 11 египетских мумий, проходить мимо пианино Леди Гаги и гитар Курта Кобейна, Джимми Хендрикса, представляя их силуэты, создающие музыку.Это место - рай на земле. Всё самое прекрасное, созданное руками человечества находится здесь, у меня на работе. А если работать в офисе, это же что-то невероятно, совершенно. Даже не прилечь в зале импрессионистов, всматриваясь в волшебные мазки Моне, не пообедать в залах Древнего Рима и Греции, между скульптурами молодого Геракла и Афродиты.Но это лишь риторический вопрос по пути в музей. Они без меня не справятся ❤️

name: 2019-08-15 02.36.22 2110440906923560630_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹. Когда мы говорим об искусстве средних веков во Фландрии, то вспоминаем сразу Яна Ван Эйка, Хуго Ван Дер Гус, Ханса Мемлинга, Петруса Кристуса... Родом и Нидерландов, Петрус основался в Брюгге. Он приехал в Брюгге после смерти Ван Эйка и не был его учеником. Но видел его картины и посещал его ателье, которым руководила жена Яна Ван Эйка Маргарита. Работы Петруса Кристуса очень эмоциональные. И он известен своими портретами.В 15ом веке в Брюгге было очень развито ювелирное мастерство, обрабатывали алмазы. Эта картина, возможно, была заказана богатыми горожанами, которые пришли к ювелиру купить обручальные кольца. А ювелир – сам святой Элигий, который был личным ювелиром Хлотаря II. Это первая версия. Или же вторая. Ювелир – это Виллем ван Влутен, который работал на Филиппа Доброго.Кристус изобразил пару в ювелирной мастерской. Одеты согласно Бургундской моде, дама в платье из Венецианской парчи. Головной убор – раздвоенный атур, покрытый тканью. Мужчина в тунике, обделанной беличьим мехом, на голове – модный головной убор шаперон, с брошкой. Ювелир взвешивает кольцо. Очень интересна утварь, что стоит на полках. Очень много символики. Колечки с камнями и без камней. Все предметы прописаны детально, что типично для примитивистов. В окне мы видим еще одну пару, что идут к ювелиру.. Гильдия ювелиров Брюгге имела отличную репутацию и привлекала покупателей со всего мира. Ювелиры находились в домах с открытыми дверями и окнами, чтобы каждый мог свободно их видеть. Петрус Кристус (1415?-1476) - фламандский художник, был членом двух братств, имел свое ателье,  писал портреты. .🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹🔹.#bruges#belgium#europa_vacation#europetrip#europe_greatshots#путешествие2019#travelawesome#century21 #beautifulplace #withlove#мойлюбимыйгород#europe_tourist#oldtown#middleage#belgium#жизньвевропе #жизнь_прекрасна#artgallery#metropolitanmuseumofart#живопись#краскижизни#museum#искусство#newyork

text: Today on New Telegraph: "Obi Nwaegbe’s palette easily locates him in expressionism, a style which sees his canvases, peopled by human forms, projecting a stark sense of community to the viewers. Among his works at the exhibition are his recent book-themed works characterized by human forms engaged in reading, against well-stocked shelves in the backgrounds. The paintings have texts on them, but on closer observation, one deciphers that such writings are also messages that betray the artist’s cultural activism." -Agwu Enekwachi, writer, art historian, writes on the "Faces & Forms" exhibition that took place at the Exhibition Pavilion in Abuja recentlyhttps://www.newtelegraphng.com/2019/08/engaging-culture-through-faces-and-forms#smithsonianmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #haus_der_kunst

name: 2019-08-15 04.24.50 2110495495521330855_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This morning in the Drawings and Prints study room we had the pleasure of focusing on the botanical studies and book cover designs of American artist Margaret Neilson Armstrong (1867-1944). Alongside Sarah Whyman Whitman (1842-1904) and Alice C. Morse (1863-1961) she was one of the trailblazing female book artists of her day. After a career of over 20 years she turned from designing book covers to the careful study of all the wild flowers native to the United States, resulting in her publication Western Wild Flowers of 1915. The Met is fortunate to have two albums filled with her preparatory studies as well as many of her beautiful bindings and publications #bookart #artofthebook #bookcoverdesign #judgeabookbyitscover #california #margaretarmstrong #femaleartist #americanartists #botanicalstudies #westernwildflowers #pocketbook #watercolors #flowers #trailblazer #studyroom #printsanddrawings #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metcollection #metcurator #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-15 05.03.01 2110514717377295560_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: When I was able to steal a few hours wandering through the Met last week I was struck by these carnelian, faience, and other stone inlays from the now disintegrated inner coffin of Senebtisi of the late 12th Dynasty. Her burial was found undisturbed and included weapons, jewelry, and an offering table. Who was she? sA-Hjpw, “daughter of Apis,” she was interred in the funerary complex of vizier Senusret, but she left no biography and was the only individual named in her burial. #senebtisi #metropolitanmuseumofart #middlekingdom #egyptology #ancientegypt #ancient #egypt #womenofegypt #jewelry #inlays #carnelian #مصر #مجوهرات #tomesandtombs

name: 2019-08-15 10.26.03 2110677306167884771_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Edward Hopper. American, 1882-1967.From Williamsburg Bridge, 1928Oil on canvas.In From Williamsburg Bridge, Hopper depicts the austere facades of four apartment buildings and reduces the steel suspension bridge that gives the painting its name to the margins. Completed in 1903 and connecting Brooklyn with Manhattan, the structure is indicated only by the unobtrusive railing rising at a slight diagonal along the bottom of the canvas. As opposed to focusing on the bridge that facilitates movement in and out of the city, Hopper creates an image absent of noise or motion. He emphasizes the alienation and anonymity of urban life by including a single figure: a woman sitting alone in a top-story window...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #edwardhopper #fromwilliamsburgbridge #williamsburgbridge #americana

name: 2019-08-15 15.59.55 2110845344523684510_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Marble statue of a wounded AmazonRoman, imperial period, 1st-2nd century A.D.Copy of a Greek bronze statue of ca. 450-425 B.C.Lower legs and feet have been restored with casts taken from copies in Berlin and Copenhagen. Most of right arm, lower part of pillar, and plinth are eighteenth-century marble restorations..In Greek art, the Amazons, a mythical race of warrior women from Asia Minor, were often depicted battling such heroes as Herakles, Achilles, and Theseus. This statue represents a refugee from battle who has lost her weapons and bleeds from a wound under her right breast. Her chiton is unfastened at one shoulder and belted at the waist with a makeshift bit of bridle from her horse. Despite her plight, her face shows no sign of pain or fatigue. She leans lightly on a pillar at her left and rests her right arm gracefully on her head in a gesture often used to denote sleep or death. Such emotional restraint was characteristic of classical art of the second half of the fifth century B.C..The original statue probably stood in the precinct of the great temple of Artemis at Ephesos, on the coast of Asia Minor, where the Amazons had legendary and cultic connections with the goddess. The Roman writer Pliny the Elder described a competition held in the mid-fifth century B.C. between five famous sculptors, including Phidias, Polykleitos, and Kresilas, who were to make a statue of an Amazon for the temple. This type of statue is generally associated with that contest...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #sculpture #amazon #roman #romanmythology #greek #greekmythology #mythology #pagan #heathen #lateantiquity

name: 2019-08-15 16.00.25 2110845597272431559_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Marble head of a womanRoman, Imperial period, 1st century A.D.Copy of a Hellenistic statue of the 3rd or 2nd century B.C..Coiffures with corkscrew curls were fashionable in Egypt and Cyrene during the Ptolemaic period. This head must have represented an important person, as several other copies are known today. This copy was once part of the collection of antiquities formed in Rome during the early seventeenth century by the Marchese Vincenzo Giustiniani...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #sculpture #roman #greek #lateantiquity

text: The Met exhibition ‘Play It Loud’ was pretty cool, but woefully light on synthesizers (mostly it was rare electric guitars by seminal rock artists). Funny, because one key thread in the show was intentional sound manipulation (via guitar modification, mostly). Isn’t that nearly the essence of a synthesizer?  This is #depechemode ‘s “3 midi’ed 2600’s in a box,” which sat next to #rickwakeman ‘s #moog modular.  #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #playitloud

name: 2019-08-15 16.31.49 2110861399109915906_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: #throwbackthursdayIt’s not me, but I’m throwing back to 1829 - 1833. I want to share with everyone a masterpiece of art. This is called “The Great Wave off Kanagawa”(神奈川沖浪裏 or Kanagawa-oki Nami Ura). It is not a painting, but a woodblock print. This is from my native Japan, and was created by ukiyo-e artist Katsushika Hokusai. Hokusai created a series called “Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji.” This was the first in the series, and his most famous work. Mount Fuji is the tallest mountain and most sacred symbol of Japan. The fierce blue wave complements the humble, yet grand, Mount Fuji. 🇯🇵🗾🌊🗻 日本 神奈川沖浪裏 富士山#hokusai #katsushikahokusai #ukiyoe #japaneseart #japaneseartist #kanagawa #japan #mountfuji #wave #ocean #woodblockprint #art #metropolitanmuseumofart #losangelescountymuseumofart #artinstituteofchicago #britishmuseum #nationalgalleryofvictoria #claudemonethouse #edo #fisherman #japanese #bluewave #tbt

name: 2019-08-15 19.40.07 2110956173562704747_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Treasure: 👉 Evening by the Lake - 1906Artist: 🇩🇪 Max Nonnenbruch Where:📍Private Collection Photo: 📸 @europe_treasures Tag: 🔑#europe_treasures Family:👉 @tesori_italiani👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @archaeology_treasures 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 Max Nonnenbruch (1857-1922) was a German painter born in 1857 in Viersen. A painter of genre scenes in his early days, Max Nonnenbruch was then influenced by neoclassical and symbolist aesthetics as well as by pre-Raphaelite painters. His works represented young women, dancers and odalisques with oriental dresses. Many references to Greek and Roman antiquity can be seen: Greek vases, jewellery, hairstyles, columns and mosaic decorations. The pure and idyllic scenes of Max Nonnenbruch were particularly visible in his works depicting young women dressed in antique at the seaside. The vibrating touch highlights the effects of the lights. Through his work and his involvement in the artistic events of his time, Max Nonnenbruch acquired an important reputation. 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀🏛 Share our Wonderful Heritage 🏛🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹#art #europeanart #artists #artwork🎨 #german #germany #durer #germanart #deutsch #musee #artiste #masterpiece #kunst #deutschland #germania #allemagne #alemania #museum #alemanha #maxnonnenbruch #metropolitanmuseumofart #dürer #kunstwerke #renaissance #munich #sunset #gaertner

name: 2019-08-15 19.40.33 2110956387639885888_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. Ah the Met gallery, home of lots of art stuff and the Met gala - the most amazing party I’ll never be invited to. The chance to watch celebrities dry hump in front of Van Gogh water colours is just too much to bear. Instead, I dressed up like a working accordion and went to CAMP! an insanely colourful, interesting collection of rainbow fashion and weirdness. The Met itself is huge so make sure to take a flask of milo and a map, unless you want to be lost, hungry and crying in the Iranian pottery wing while Anna Wintour pokes you with a 17th century French wig.... #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkcity #nyc #camp #usa #color #colour #manhattan #travelphotography #themet

name: 2019-08-15 20.44.58 2110988814114513735_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Marble head of a Greek generalRoman, Imperial period, 1st-2nd century A.D.Copy of a Greek bronze statue of the mid-4th century B.C..This powerful portrayal of a man of action belongs to a type popular in Roman times. One suggestion for his identity is the strategos (general) Phokion, pupil of Plato and one of the foremost Athenian statesmen of the fourth century B.C., but there is little evidence to support that theory. We do not know if the original statue was a contemporary portrait, like the famous fifth-century portrait of the Athenian statesman and general Perikles, or a posthumous work. It could even be a representation of a hero from the mythic past. He wears a Corinthian helmet pushed up and resting on the back of his head. The helmet is elaborately decorated in relief with griffins on the bowl and rams' heads on the cheek pieces and is similar to a type worn by the goddess Athena. His eyes would have been inlaid in another material. The head has been worked for insertion into a statue...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #scuplture #romanempire #roman #greek #athens #phokion #plato #lateantiquity

name: 2019-08-15 20.46.45 2110989707778058997_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Helmet (Spangenhelm)Iron, copper alloy, goldByzantine or Germanic, 6th-7th centuryThis is one of the best preserved examples of a rare group of closely related Spangenhelme (strap helmets) dating from the sixth or seventh century. The sites where they have been found are widely scattered, ranging from Sweden to Germany, the Balkans, and Libya. The quality of the helmets and their diverse locations lead to the theory that they were made as diplomatic gifts to foreign rulers, perhaps sent from the Byzantine court or from the Ostrogothic kingdom in Italy. Originally, all the helmets had a pair of metal cheek pieces and a mail neck defense, and often, an integral nasal. Of these features, only the cheek pieces remain on a few examples. This particular helmet is very unusual for its elaborate large-scale figures engraved on the plates between the straps. These include men, birds, fish, and animals. Featured is a cross above the brow, indicating that the owner was probably a Christian...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #archaeology #byzantine #francia #frankish #carolingian #migrationera #migrationperiod #viking #vikings #vikingage #earlymedieval

name: 2019-08-15 20.47.24 2110990037744003676_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Swords in Early JapanThe great burial mounds (kofun) of the Kofun period (from about the late third to the late seventh century A.D.) have yielded a wealth of richly decorated swords. The earliest of these probably imported from China, have straight, single-edged iron blades; hilts with ring pommels and rudimentary guards, and scabbards with mounts that allowed the weapon to hang from the belt at an angle. Obtaining iron from Korea, Japanese swordsmiths at first imitated these weapons so closely that it is extremely difficult to distinguish between the foreign originals and Japanese copies. In the fifth or sixth century, however, new indigenous hilt types developed, including one with a very large, globular pommel..Straight-bladed jokotō (ancient swords) are thought to have been used mainly for thrusting. The curved blade that characterizes later swords (Nippon-tō), which were ideal for cutting, seems to have developed in the late tenth century...Top to bottom:Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt copper, silverProbably Japanese, Kofun period, 6th century.Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt copper, woodKofun period, 6th century.Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt copperKofun period, 6th-7th century.Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt bronze, gilt copper, silverKofun period, 6th century.Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt bronze, silver, woodChinese, Sui Dynasty (598-618), about 600.Sword with Scabbard MountsIron, gilt bronze, silver, woodChinese, Sui Dynasty (598-618), about 600..Displayed at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #sword #jokoto #nipponto #tachi #katana #japan #kofun #kofunperiod #asukaperiod #yamatoperiod #migrationera #migrationperiod #vikingage #earlymedieval

name: 2019-08-16 00.56.17 2111115310009675491_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Однажды в детстве я попала на экскурсию в Одесский археологический музей.Будучи ребенком я была под глубочайшим впечатлением от экспонатов и захотела даже стать по профессии археологом🤓.Но судьба моя распорядилась иначе,хотя я до сих пор люблю археологические музеи и в #metropolitanmuseumofart мы бываем несколько раз в год.Он конечно же огромнейших размеров и за день не обойдешь плюс каждый год,а то и раньше новые exhibitions.  Так как я решила воплотить в реальность,свою навязчивую идею рубрику мировых и международных событий по четвергам.Сегодня #google  выдал такую инфо #throwbackthursday  Несмотря на то, что история Дня археолога не связана с какими-либо событиями и открытиями, и сам праздник не является ни государственным, ни национальным, археологи России, Белоруссии, Казахстана и Украины отмечают свой профессиональный праздник 15 августа. Кстати, на Украине он получил статус государственного в 2008 году, согласно указу президента страны №694/2008В Одессе музей находиться прямо в сердце Южной столицы,который основан с 1825 года.  Старейший на Украине Археологический музей, входящий в состав Южного научного центра НАН Украины и МОН Украины.  Летом многие кто хочет побывать или уже был в Одессе наслышан про #ibizanightclub  и стремиться туда попасть, но не забывайте что днем можно и окультуриться  перед выходом в ночную жизнь😉 В целом в Одессе масса всего интересного-ведь это «не город,а невеста» и конечно же «жемчужина у моря». ———————————————————————- На фото: Victoria 2018 т е год назад #nyc #nyclife #nycmom #nyckids #momlife #momoftwo #momofirishtwins #momblog #cuties #cutebabies #instamom #instakids #instadaily #kids #kidsfashion #kidscasting #kidsmodel #kidsmood #мамаблог #мамапогодок #дваждымама

text: Nova Iorque sempre é uma boa pedida né!? Você visita e volta para casa, com a sensação de que não viu tudo. E é assim mesmo, NY é daquelas cidades que você precisa voltar sempre, pois cada visita, é completamente diferente da outra. Hoje eu trago a dica do roof top do The MET, ótima vista do Central Park, principalmente se acompanhado de uma taça de vinho 🙃. Tire uma hora para descansar e ficar apreciando as belezas da cidade que nunca para(observe a quantidade de viola e helicópteros 🚁) #voudeduotravel #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-16 05.58.40 2111267495096049961_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I enjoy featuring artists whom I admire, of which #aligolkar is one of my all time favorites. I have enjoyed both collecting his art and knowing him for nearly 25 years. I have spent nearly a lifetime studying art, having traveled too numerous galleries around the world.....pausing in front of paintings, sculptures and architecture, and simply admiring the artists wonderful use of color, medium, or subject matter. At times I have even been angered viewing the grotesque, fallen human condition as it screams out at the viewer from the canvas. Why, for example, do we require a painting of John the Baptist's head on a platter as can be viewed at the Getty Musuem in Malibu, California? As a sidenote: These days there is a good bit of discussion about a recession. As a disclaimer, I am not a financial adviser. That being said, I believe there are a few exceptional living artists who are highly collectable as an investment to diversify ones portfolio. In my opinion Ali Golkar is one of them. Perhaps fifteen years ago over dinner Ali asked me what he could do to diversify. Whereas before he only painted groupings of women, I suggested he branch out and try other venues such as landscapes, seascapes and still lifes. As you can see here, Ali did just that. I also suggested that he place his art in Martin Lawrence Galleries. There are several locations throughout the country. Ali was immediately picked up by Martin Lawrence. I was delighted to stroll through Soho in New York and chance upon one of his large landscapes in the window!! You can admire his work at aligolkar.com#aligolkar #collectableartists #collectableart #artasaninvestment #abstractart #galleriedart #artgallery #artgalleries #famousartgalleries #gettymuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #guggenheim #themet #louvre #thelouvre #nortonsimonmuseum #hammermuseum  #mussmandesign #mussmandesignassociates #charlotteinteriordesigner #lakenormaninteriordesigner #winstonsaleminteriordesigner#matthewsinteriordesigner #greensborointeriordesigner #chapelhillinteriordesigner #raleighinteriordesigner #triadinteriordesigner #piedmonttriadinteriordesigner #carolinainteriordesign #northcarolinainteriordesigner

text: .Folio from a Qur'an ManuscriptSyria, Damascus, second half of the 8th centuryInk, opaque watercolor, and gold on parchment.This large folio is attributed to the very early Abbasid period, making it one of the earliest datable Qur'an leaves in the collection. On each of its sides are sixteen lines of kufic script, executed in brownish black ink with vowels indicated in red and green dots. Like many early Qur'an folios, it is written on parchment and exhibits extensive elongation of the letters along a horizontal axis. The latter was a response to the vertical page format characteristic of kufic Qur'ans, and a decorative device that resulted in a stunning composition. The text is from sura 15, verses 1 through 10...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #middleeast #levant #damascus #syria #islam #islamicart #quran #koran #kufic #arabic #abbasidcaliphate #vikingage #earlymedieval

name: 2019-08-16 06.46.01 2111291327510447338_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Egypt, Syria, and the Jazira, 969-1250From the tenth to twelfth centuries, the area including present-day Algeria, Tunisia, Sicily, Egypt, and Syria came under the rule of the Fatimid dynasty (909-1171), which traced descent from the Prophet Muhammad's daughter Fatima and from Isma'il, the seventh Shi'i imam. In 969, the Fatimids established Cairo as a new capital. It soon rivaled Abbasid Baghdad in wealth and power. Meanwhile, the Seljuq dynasty, after conquering Baghdad in 1055, set its sights westward, bringing Anatolia under its control after 1071. Based in Konya, Seljuq power in Anatolia reached its zenith in the first half of the thirteenth century. In the Jazira (the region between the northern Euphrates and the Tigris) and northern Syria, local regimes emerged: prominent among them were the Artuqids (1101-1408) and the Zangids (1127-1251). In Egypt, the Ayyubid dynasty came to power under the Zangid general Salah al-Din, known in Europe as Saladin al-Ayyubi. He established himself as sultan (1171) and soon expanded his control to Yemen, Syria, and the Jazira. Despite conquering Jerusalem in 1187, the Ayyubid conflict with the Crusaders continued. To face this challenge, the Ayyubids built an army largely of slave-soldiers (mamluks), who ultimately overthrew the last Ayyubid sultan in Egypt and founded the Mamluk sultanate (1250-1517)...RingEgypt, Fatimid period (909-1171), 11th centuryGold; filigree and granulation.Biconical Bead with ScrollsSyria, Fatimid period (909-1171), 11th centuryGold; filigree and granulation.Spherical BeadEgypt or Syria, Fatimid period (909-1171), 11th centuryGold; filigree and granulation.Crescent-shaped Pendant with Confronted BirdsEgypt, Fatimid period (909-1171), 11th centuryGold, cloisonné enamel, turquoise; filigree.Pair of EarringsSyria, Fatimid period (909-1171), 11th centuryGold; filigree and granulation..On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #archaeology #middleeast #levant #syria #egypt #fatimidcaliphate #islam #islamicart #vikingage

text: .SwordIran, Nishapur, excavated atTepe Madrasa, 9th centuryIron, wood, gilded-bronze.This sword has an iron blade and was adorned with gilded bronze elements on the crossguard and quillon. Parts of its wooden scabbard remain fused to the blade, which also was decorated with gilded bronze mounts at the center and tip. The form of this sword, with its straight, double-edged blade, seems to be a Central Asian type...On display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #artmuseum #archaeology #tepemadrasa #nishapur #iran #persian #islam #sword #vikingage #earlymedieval

text: .1. Nasal HelmetSteel, copper alloyWeight, 3 lb. 2 oz. (1412 g)European, about 1175-1225Although nasal helmets (a type that covers the top of the head, with a bar extending down from the brow to protect the nose) were widely used in medieval Europe, this is one of only a handful that survive today. This example is also distinguished by the remains of intricate interlace designs delicately inlaid in copper wire that form a Christian cross on its brow and nasal..2. Shirt of MailSteel, copper alloy, iron, brassWeight, 20 lb. name: 2019-08-16 16.00.23 2111570355721286309_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Johan Barthold Jongkinds wordt na Vincent van Gogh als meest invloedrijke schilder van de 19e eeuw  van Nederland beschouwt. Jongkind was lid van de school van Barbizon. Deze stroming ontstond in de omgeving van het Franse plaatsje Barbizon bij Fontainbleau. Als reactie op de romantiek was het uitgangspunt om landschappen zo realistisch mogelijk en zonder opsmuk te schilderen. Om de natuur zo waargetrouw mogelijk te schilderen trokken de schilders met hun ezelen de natuur in. Jongkind maakte in de natuur ter plekke aquarellen, die hij later in zijn atelier uitwerkte tot schilderijen. Zijn werken hangen o.a.  in het Rijksmuseum, Louvre en het Metropolitan Museum of Art. Tevens zijn ze dit jaar te bewonderen en te koop tijdens FINE bij de galerie Saxen Weimar.#FINE2019 #kunstbeurs #aquarel #barbizon #Nerves #landschap #fransimpressionisme #modern #impressionism #saxenweimar #galerie #artfair #kasteel #groeneveld #baarn #waterverf #professorturnedartdealer #expo #contemporaryart #art #artfair #louvre #rijksmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #jongkind
