text: after Kay Sage’s “Tomorrow is Never, 1955”Those who fight spirit on.They bore into steel housesand break white walls with the inevitabilityof the day after, and they are gassed, trolled, massacred.Those who don’t fightjust want peace forthemselves. They somber up and suit up and scheduletrips up and down towersand invent many differentways of being.And then there are thosewho know there is neitherescape nor liberation from the cause and the cosmos.They are in a state of gray,defiant in the certainty of their despair.#troglobitepoetry #kaysage #artwork #surrealism #surrealistart #poemporn #poemgasm #poemoftheday #poemofig #poemcommunity #illogicalpoemworld #poetryhive #poetryslam #poetrychallenge #poetrycommunityofig #poetryflow #poetryworld #spilledpoetry #poetryinmotion #poetryisart #artandpoetry #poetryandart #ekphrasis #soulpoetry #darksoulpoetry #paintingoftheday #newyorkart #metropolitanmuseumofart #artgallery #artoftheday

name: 2019-08-17 01.21.33 2111852797963210326_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Wine time! This silver, gold, and electrum wine service was found in a cache deposit at the temple of Bastet at Tell Bubastis during construction of a Delta railroad. It includes lotus-decorated situla for sipping and a strainer for removing sediment. The lion goddess Bastet was appeased through festivals of drunkenness, and I can’t imagine she wouldn’t have enjoyed lapping from this rare set (19th Dynasty, ca. 1279-1213 BCE). #fridaywine #ancientwine #winetime #bastetgoddess #bubastis #metropolitanmuseumofart #egyptology #egypt #museums #tgif #ancientcats #مصر #tomesandtombs

text: Истории из музея.Ежедневно мне задают 1000 вопросов о Метрополитен музее. И только 3 из 10 имеют какой-либо смысл. Иногда вопросы поражают своей изобретательностью и бредом, но я держусь. Но порой бывает и милые комментарии.Подходит ко мне мужчина лет 40-45 и говорит: «Я очень прошу прощения, но я должен сказать, вы похожи на куклу, не уверен, что правильно произнесу, это такая русская кукла - Матрешка».Попадание, как говорится, в десяточку😹

text: “Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal”- Egon Schiele, Austrian born protege of Gustav Klimt, known for his intense, sexually raw works and a multitude of nude self portraits, widely considered to be an early predecessor of Expressionism, owning to an almost abstract depiction of the human body in the painter’s works. Depicted here is Egon Schiele, Crouch Nude in Shoes and Black Stockings, Back View, 1912, The MET Breuer, New York City, New York #art #arthistory #egonschiele #artnouveau #themetbreuer #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkcity #newyork

name: 2019-08-17 10.09.09 2112118350256658394_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Portrait of Juan de Pareja is a painting by Spanish artist Diego Velázquez of his assistant Juan de Pareja, a notable painter in his own right, who was enslaved and owned by Velázquez at the time the painting was completed. Velázquez painted the portrait in Rome, while traveling in Italy, in 1650. It is the earliest known portrait of a Spanish man of African descent.  #metropolitanmuseumofart  #metropolitan  #newyork  #art #rembrandt  #elgreco  #claudemonet  #edgardegas  #vangogh  #picasso  #modernart  #classicalpainting  #goya #sculpture  #michelangelo  #leonardodavinci  #rubens  #ilyarepin  #rodin #augusterodin  #painting  #salvadordali  #caravaggio  #amadeomodigliani  #umetnost  #slikarstvo  #cezanne  #historyofart  #ancientegypt

name: 2019-08-17 19.48.01 2112409701559539451_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Esempio culminante della cosiddetta "opera di notte e di fuochi" per cui il bresciano Gerolamo Savoldo era noto anche allo stesso Vasari: San Matteo e l'angelo, 1530-35. Testimoninanza della modernità della pittura lombarda del 500. The culminating example of the so-called "work of night and fires" for which the Gerolamo Savoldo from Brescia was also known to Vasari himself: St. Matthew and the Angel, 1530-35.  Testimony of the modernity of Lombard painting of the sixteenth century.  #art #artlovers #artintweet#themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #nyc #pittura #paintingoftheday #paintings #painter #museum #museo #brescia #lombardia #artoftheday #instabeauty #arthistory #arthistorian #storiadellarte #arte

text: 2° giorno, sveglia presto, colazione dei campioni nel bellissimo #sanctuaryhotelnyc e lunga camminata verso il #metnyc passando per #centralpark, arrivati al #metropolitanmuseumofart ci troviamo di fronte a 3 mostre davvero eccezionali ed emozionanti, la prima sull #apollo13 e lo sbarco sulla #luna, la seconda sulla moda #metcamp dove sono esposti degli abiti davvero sorprendenti che hanno fatto la storia e la mostra è fatta veramente bene, la terza beh, mi sono emozionato, #playitloud è una mostra dedicata agli strumenti che hanno fatto la storia del #rocknroll e ci sono tutti i miei idoli, chitarre originali di #jackwhite #tommorello #elvispresley #jhonlennon #brucespringsteen #ericclapton #vanhallen #ledzeppelin #thewho  ecc ecc insomma tutti, persino le chitarre rotte di #jimihendrix e #curtcobain, emozione allo stato puro, lasciato il museo andiamo in direzione Chelsea passando per la sopraelevata che in passato era un binario del treno ed arriviamo nel bellissimo #chelseamarket dove troviamo davvero di tutto, passiamo per casa di #carriebradshaw di #sexandthecity e beviamo un ottimo vino al #barvelocenyc super consigliato, torniamo in hotel e super cena sushi all'interno dell'hotel, in tutto 22 km a piedi... name: 2019-08-17 22.48.20 2112500458672432786_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Why Double Coated Dogs Should Not be ShavedWhen deciding whether or not to shave your dog you need to determine what kind of coat your dog has — single or double.Double coated breeds are those that have two layers of fur. The top layer is made of tough guard hairs and the bottom layer is a thick layer of fur called an undercoat. The undercoat is a layer of fine hairs close to an animals skin that help keep them cool in the summer and warm in winter. In the spring they go through a major shedding period known as blowing their coat when much of that undercoat is released to make way for their lighter summer coat.Common double coated breeds include Huskies, Chows, Labradors, German Shepherds, Golden Retrievers, and Pomeranian’s. Most of the herding breeds have a double coat, as well as the Spitz type breeds and a majority of Terriers. name: 2019-08-17 23.32.05 2112522476143887605_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Yesterday morning we started our day in upper Manhattan by eating NY bagels from the very popular Pick a Bagel... did not disappoint. They have everything from vegan spreads to classic lox, jalapeño and strawberry walnut.. delish. We then walked up to Central Park to explore some of the famous sights within the park. We hit up the Carousel, the Bethesda Fountain, the Market, the Loeb Boathouse, the Belvedere Castle and the Shakespeare Garden. Central Park is truly a little oasis within the city...... After we left the park we ventured off into museum world by going by the Metropolitan Museum of Art and touring the Guggenheim. There is something magical about the art scene in NYC than only experiencing it can express.  Before we ended our time in the upper part of the city we walked down Park Ave looking at the well known windows of Bergdorf Goodman. They are unmatched in their visual design capabilities. So very cool. I swear I walked right by Martha Stewart. I looked deep into her eyes to verify it was her lol... Although Christopher does not agree with my identification of Martha 🤣. #centralpark #pickabagel #museums #metropolitanmuseumofart #guggenheim #bergdorfgoodman #travel #thebelvederecastle

name: 2019-08-18 05.16.18 2112695723028132724_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🖼️ Robert Rich, Segundo Conde de Warwick 👨🏻‍🎨 Anthony van Dyck 🇳🇱⏳1632 - 1635🏛️ Museo Metropolitano de Arte (The MET) New York 🇺🇲___________________________________________________🇪🇸Un marinero de fortuna puritano, el segundo conde de Warwick estableció compañías en Virginia y el Caribe, ayudó a colonizar Connecticut, Massachusetts y Rhode Island, y se apoderó de barcos españoles en nombre del duque de Saboya y Carlos I. Las políticas de este último hicieron que Warwick  lado con el Parlamento como comandante de la marina (desde 1642). A pesar de las alusiones a sus aventuras marítimas en la armadura y las naves, Warwick usa el vestido cotidiano de un aristócrata.___________________________________________________🇬🇧🇺🇲A Puritan sailor of fortune, the Second Earl of Warwick set up companies in Virginia and the Caribbean, helped colonize Connecticut, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island, and seized Spanish ships on behalf of the Duke of Savoy and Charles I. The latter’s policies made Warwick side with Parliament as commander of the navy (from 1642). Despite allusions to his maritime adventures in the armor and ships, Warwick wears the everyday dress of an aristocrat.#arte #cultura #pintura #vandyck #art #detail #artdetail #painting #classicalart #arthistory #historyofart #renaissanceart  #vintage #artlovers #portrait #academic  #paintings #fineart #finearts #oilpainting #theancientworld #paintingdetail #figuredrawing #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-18 07.12.57 2112754434107608351_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Here's another jewel from @the_met_museum_of_art that Kimberly and I viewed on our recent visit to New York. Robert Blum was an illustrator hired by Scribner's Magazine. He was able to spend eighteen months in Japan, and the details in this painting show how deeply he was able to immerse himself in the culture over that time period. This is not a large painting (25 1/16" x 31 1/16"), and yet Blum is able to add an extreme level of detail. With the various patterns throughout the painting, the frame itself adds to the chaotic nature of the scene.2) The way Blum handled the patterns in the fabric is breathtaking. It's also important to note that he used red on the foreground figure, which makes it pop right out at the viewer juxtaposed against the more muted colors surrounding it, and adds a further sense of depth to the painting.3) The candy blower becomes the center of interest due to the value contrast and rich color in his clothing, and also the fact that so many of the other figures are focused on his actions.4) I'm personally intrigued by the block letter "2" on the crate. It makes the scene appear to be almost a hybrid of the historical and the modern Japan. ______________________________________________________________ “The Ameya - A Japanese Candy Vendor" • Robert Blum • 1893 • Oil on Canvas • 17"5/8 x 14”Photos by Kimberly at @saundersfinearts.

name: 2019-08-18 07.34.35 2112765324532395927_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Went for a little late-summer camp at @metmuseum today, and since @gucci sponsored the Camp: Notes on Fashion, I thought I’d take @guccibeauty Mémoire d’une Odeur out for a test drive. More thoughts in the future, but I’m into what Gala co-chairs @alessandro_michele and @harrystyles are serving. If Marc Booth said, “Camp [is] granny specs”, then Mémoire d’une Odeur is camp-adjacent: it’s granny scents. Anywho, today’s highlight from my own private Mecca was realizing perfume bottles were used as headpieces in the one of the installations in the Main Hall. The Gaultier bottles were obligatory albeit on the nose, but the phallic Faberge Macho was inspired (bring back that bottle, @officialfaberge, PLEASE), and the bottle of Stetson atop that total bottom of a gay cowboy was truly sublime. Yet another reminder that the Stetson man lassos his best studs in reverse cowgirl. Yeehaw!#perfume #gucci #memoireduneodeur #green #edp #eaudeparfum #scentoftheday #sotd #perfumeaddict #fragrance #samples #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #nyc #camp #summercamp #fashion #campnotesonfashion #perfumebottles #jeanpaulgaultier #faberge #macho #coty #stetson #gay #cowboy #genderwithgenitals

name: 2019-08-18 20.12.24 2113146750671503485_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 📌 Pieter Bruegel the Elder, The Harvesters, 1565, oil on wood, 119 cm × 162 cm, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City. 🇳🇱~Bruegel’s fanfare for the common man is considered one of the defining works of Western art. This composition was one of six created on the theme of the seasons. The time is probably early September. A group of peasants on the left cut and bundle ripened wheat, while the on the right, another group takes their midday meal. One figure is sacked out under a tree with his pants unbuttoned. This attention to detail continues throughout the painting as a procession of ever-granular observations receding into space. It was extraordinary for a time when landscapes served mostly as backdrops for religious paintings.~Do you like this painting?

name: 2019-08-19 00.34.04 2113278450910618666_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ONI Bearing A Dora (Gong) Japan, Kyoto, early 19th century. Metal, wood, lacquer, and polychrome. — The ferocious sculpture was made primarity as a display piece and possibly to appeal to the European export market. The two Oni (demons) are carrying a large dora (gong) in a procession. The gong, a genuine example, is the type used in theater, tea ceremonies, and Buddhist rituals.  #themet #themetropolitanmuseum #themetropolitanmuseumofart #themetropolitanmuseumofartnewyork #metropolitanmuseumofarts #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitan #metropolitanmuseum #museum #museumselfieday #sculpture #sculptures #japanesesculpture #kyotojapan #demons #gong #thegong #teaceremonies #buddhistrituals #oni

text: Illustrations by #MiguelVillalobos commissioned by Hair Stylist #GuidoPalau to illustrate his designs for mannequin heads in the 2012 @metmuseum “Schiaparelli & Prada, Impossible Conversations” exhibition. Each mask design has a signature element of either Prada or Schiaparelli. Some were used in the final exhibition, other were turned into a series of MET postcards.Guido Pualu designed masks for the Alexander McQueen’s “Savage Beauty” & “PUNK: Chaos to Couture” exhibits - meant to enhance the designer’s aesthetic but inevitably adding elements of surrealism in linen, leather + lace. #exhibitiondesign #maskdesign #fashion #masks #illustration #Schiaparelli #Prada #fashiondesign #graphic #fashiondrawing #design #designer #fashionmasks #headpieces #fashiondesigner #TheMET #designinspiration #fashionillustration #maskmaker #ImpossibleConversations #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-19 08.11.12 2113508533040760524_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: |Distorted| Balthasar Permoser (German, 1651–1732). Marsyas, ca. 1680–85. Marble on a black marble socle inlaid with light marble panels. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.In one of the great parables of hubris, the satyr Marsyas challenged the god Apollo to a musical competition. The god triumphed and then punished his challenger by skinning him alive. Here, Permoser condensed the tragic climax of the story into an emotive portrayal of Marsyas. The contorted face, with an open mouth revealing a bitten tongue, and twisting head immediately convey pain, while the taut shoulders suggest that his arms are bound behind his back. The satyr is draped with an animal pelt, pointing to his gruesome fate. The panels of mottled marble set into the base are flecked with red, perhaps evoking spattered blood."It's difficult for me to walk past and not stop and gasp every time."#AliceSchwarz #Marsyas #BalthasarPermoser #metmuseum #sculpture #nycart #nycmuseums #museums  #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #metnyc #marble #sculpture #museums #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #metnyc #sculpture #sculptures #artsculptures #marblesculptures #sculptures #museos #museums #artmuseums #museumstagram #nycmuseums #girlsinmuseums #peopleinmuseums #museumspaces #museumspass #museumoftheworld #museumstag #museumspassambassador #museumholic #museumholics

This competition is the only artistic event devoted exclusively to the use of color.Forty-four artists were selected for the nation-wide exhibition.This years juror, Meredith A. Brown, is a Curatorial Associate in the Department of Modern & Contemporary Art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.The exhibition will be held at the Stamford Art Association, 39 Franklin Street, Stamford Connecticut, Sept 22 - Oct 28, 2019. #jeffolsonart #faberbirren #stamfordartscentre #stamfordartassociation #color #juriedshow #acrylicpainting #amsterdamacrylics #royaltalens #royaltalensna #acryliconcanvas #colortheory #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #national

name: 2019-08-19 08.36.48 2113521420761129033_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: WinterJean Antoine Houdon (French, Versailles 1741–1828 Paris) A frileuse is a woman subject to cold. A marble version (Musée Fabre, Montpellier), dated 1783, was originally intended as an allegory of Winter. For the Museum's bronze, cast by Houdon himself and coming from the collection of the duc d'Orléans, Houdon stripped the spiraling columnar composition to its bare essentials. The girl's tremulous flesh is offset by her tightly drawn shawl, elegant but hardly adequate.Accession Number: 62.55#winter  #jeanantoinehoudon #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #metnyc #marble #sculpture #museums #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #metnyc #sculpture #sculptures #artsculptures #marblesculptures #sculptures #museos #museums #artmuseums #museumstagram #nycmuseums #girlsinmuseums #peopleinmuseums #museumspaces #museumspass #museumoftheworld #museumstag #museumspassambassador #museumholic #museumholics

Clapton played "Blackie" from 1974-1985 and used it to record the classic songs “Cocaine", "I Shot The Sheriff", "Wonderful Tonight", "Farther Up the Road" and many more. It was built using the best parts of three different Strats circa 1956 and 1957. #playitloud #TheMet #metropolitanmuseumofart #guitars #ericclapton #blackie #blackstrat #stratocaster #claptonisgod #ec #ecwashere #newyorkcity #nyc #fender #fenderstratocaster

name: 2019-08-19 13.34.15 2113671124253919541_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 17세기부터 시작되었던 (드러나기 시작했던) 동성애와 패션에 대해 다룬 전시, Camp:Notes on Fashion. Camp는 옛날 동성애를 비밀스럽게 칭하던 용어였다고 한다. 동성애와 그들의 sensitivity, 그리고 그로부터 영향을 받아 발전한 수많은 패션들. 우스꽝스러움과 과장, 극적인 연출이 그들의 키워드였다. 정말 무대의상같던 의상들, 그보다 나에겐 더 인상적이었던건 전시 디자인. 눈부시게 꽉 찬 핑크도 그렇다치지만 글씨체와 방들도 극적이게 꾸몄다!⠀오픈 당시 사람이 적어지면 가려고 기다리다 다녀왔는데 사람에 치이는 줄 알았다. 예술의 전당 수준의 숨막힘을 겪고 나와 조금 아쉬웠던 전시. 그러나 뉴욕이 동성애에 얼마나 오픈된 도시인지를 알 수 있는 전시이기도 하고, 전시를 보러 오는 사람들이 그들에 대해 조금 더 친숙해지는 발판을 마련하는 전시였다. 이런 의미를 두는 것 자체가 편견을 의미할 수도 있지만서도.

name: 2019-08-19 14.34.33 2113701466979452279_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: After all deadlines and chaos ;) …. memories from New York. One of my favorite painter. ... Jackson Pollock - thanks to him American painting freed itself from European dependencies and took over the leading position. Master of action painting - quick gesture painting on canvas flat laid on the floor in the studio. In this way, he became a part of it, he could work around canvas, go inside. Often commented that everyone could create something like this, something so "jerky", accidental and instinctive. However, looking at his entire work can be seen in this well-thought-out workshop.I thought for a long time that his painting is the result of alcohol intoxication. However, the truth is that he always painted on an empty stomach. He drank a lot - but then he fell into depressive states and then did not create. Expelled from Manual School in Los Angeles for his rebellious nature ... today is a symbol of American art, an icon of contemporary art.In the 1930s, the art of American Indians and the frescoes of Mexican artists strongly influenced him. Pollock's sketchbooks have survived, which testify to his proficiency in classical drawing, which confirms the theory that the great masters, before they start to experiment in their style, often destroying the current "order", the previous style - they first master the classic drawing. It was not until 1936 that he began to paint abstract paintings, permeated by violent expressionism. Pollock dies in a car accident in 1956. Pollock's painting was one of the most important phenomena in 20th century art. #pollock #jacksonpollock #jacksonpollock #momanewyork #moma #newyork #met #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumnewyork #guggenheimcollection #peggyguggenheimcollection #guggenheimcollection #guggenheimmuseum #modernart #actionpainting #actionpaintings #contemporaryart #contemporarypainting #newyork

text: 얼마전 영화 Apollo를 봤었는데, 그와 연결되는 전시 Apollo's Muse: The Moon in the Age of Photography. 달을 선망하던 시절 상상의 나래를 펼친 일러스트부터 망원경이 개발되어 보고 그린 그림, 그리고 카메라로 찍은 사진들, 이후 달 착륙이후의 현대예술까지 달과 예술을 연대기로 다뤘다.⠀유럽에서 오랫동안 동경해왔던 달. 그걸 미국이 정복했을 때, 미국은 정점에 다다랏었고, 유럽 사람들을 포함한 전 세계 사람들의 미국 선망이 시작되었다. 그게 50년전 일이다. 지금 미국은 어디에...?

text: This piece depicts archangel Michael's defeat of the Antichrist, a demon cast out of heaven. "Saint Michael" — made with tempera and oil on wood — dates back to the mid-1400s or early 1500s. Master of Belmonte created the work as an altarpiece for a church in northern Spain. It's now displayed at The Met Cloisters in New York City......#art #photography #themet #cloisters #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #nycart #newyork #uptown #artphotography #demon #medieval #medievalart #spain #church #religion #samsung #shotwithsamsung #antichrist #archangelmichael #archangel #heaven #hell #satan #funfact

text: Congratulations @jeffolsonart!#repost @jeffolsonart- - - - - -I am thrilled to announce that my painting "Correo" has been selected for the 39th Annual Faber Birren Color Award Show. This competition is the only artistic event devoted exclusively to the use of color.Forty-four artists were selected for the nation-wide exhibition.This years juror, Meredith A. Brown, is a Curatorial Associate in the Department of Modern & Contemporary Art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.The exhibition will be held at the Stamford Art Association, 39 Franklin Street, Stamford Connecticut, Sept 22 - Oct 28, 2019. #jeffolsonart #faberbirren #stamfordartscentre #stamfordartassociation #color #juriedshow #acrylicpainting #amsterdamacrylics #royaltalens #royaltalensna #acryliconcanvas #colortheory #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #national

name: 2019-08-20 03.49.33 2114101617566338251_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I originally planned to take a photo with this illustration and this sword at the Met (Met accession number 55.46.1) in the same shot, but unfortunately it is no longer on display. I still have some photos from my visit back in 2016...SwordSteel, copper, silver, nielloWeight, 2 lbs. 4 oz. (1021 g)European, probably Scandinavian, 10th century.The richly decorated hilt and pattern-welded blade indicate that this sword was carried by a warrior of high rank, perhaps a Viking chieftain or Frankish nobleman. The braided copper wires on the pommel may represent an earlier Scandinavian custom of tying a protective talisman to a sword hilt. The pattern-welded blade was forged of intertwined rods of steel and iron, a technique that produced a tough yet resilient blade with a distinctive swirling pattern on its surface. Such blades were treasured for both their practical and decorative qualities...The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States......#jungulfmott #jmott #art #artist #illustration #illustrator #minneapolis #mpls #newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #archaeology #artefactillustration #artifactillustration #technicaldrawing #vikingsword #carolingiansword #artmuseum #viking #vikings #vikingage #frankish #francia #carolingian #metsketch

The braided copper wires on the pommel may represent an earlier Scandinavian custom of tying a protective talisman to a sword hilt. The pattern-welded blade was forged of intertwined rods of steel and iron, a technique that produced a tough yet resilient blade with a distinctive swirling pattern on its surface. text: Camp sees everything in quotation marks. It's not a lamp, but a "lamp"; not a woman, but a "woman." To perceive Camp in objects and persons is to understand Being-as-Playing-a-Role. It is the farthest extension, in sensibility, of the metaphor of life as theater. - Notes On “Camp” by Susan Sontag #metropolitanmuseumofart #camp

name: 2019-08-20 10.38.57 2114307676396833622_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Two old ladies were watching me with a smile on their faces. I smiled back and one of them pointed to my sketch and said "it's really nice! You're doing great". She was a ceramic artist and the other lady who was her cousin was a painter. She said "I have to try aqua watercolor pencils; its easy to use and perfect for travellers." She showed me her works from different parts of the world that she had visited when she was younger. She said I have to keep doing it and be patient, because its a long long journy. I don't even know their names, but I will never forget their kind faces. And I will definetly try aqua watercolor pencils very soon.#watercolorsketch #sketchoftheday #traveljournal #travelsketchbook #travelsketch #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #usk #urbansketchers

name: 2019-08-20 21.54.19 2114647594178129547_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The practiced hand of the pickpocket in George de La Tour’s Fortune Teller.  The subtext is in the next image: the enameled inscription AMOR and FIDES—love and faithfulness—on the chain the dupe wears.  And the terrific culmination is in the bewitching beauty of the young gypsy who pretends to be a passive observer but whose right hand is positioned to receive the sack being lifted from the dandy’s pocket.  #stagecraft #theater #georgedelatour #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #genius #streetsmarts

name: 2019-08-20 21.56.02 2114648454312322917_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Be yourself, everyone else is already taken.” you can feel the truth in this Oscar Wilde quote throughout the Camp exhibit at the Met. Camp is many things most often thought as “unmistakably modern” “exaggerated” and “the love of the unnatural” (all quotes from Susan Sontag’s “Notes on Camp” from 1964). It’s a fun exhibit to see with lots of pieces from Jeremy Scott, and a few Bob Mackie and Versace pieces. Totally inspiring and a reminder that fashion should be fun and colorful. 💙💚💛🧡❤️💜#nyc #museumday #metropolitanmuseumofart #metgalacamp #metfashion #camp #thisiscamp #oscarwilde #susansontag

name: 2019-08-21 01.18.59 2114750606720786312_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🇮🇳 Chamunda, the Horrific Destroyer of Evil...This is a fragment of a full-length sculpture portraying the ferocious Hindu goddess Kali in the form of Chamunda, an epithet derived from her act of decapitating the demons Chanda and Munda. Chamunda embodies bareness and decay. Her hair is piled up into a chignon decorated with a tiara of skulls and a crescent moon. She scowls, baring her teeth, and enormous eyeballs protrude menacingly from sunken sockets in her skeletal face. As a necklace, she wears a snake whose coils echo the rings of decaying flesh that sag beneath her collarbone. Just above her navel on her emaciated torso is a scorpion, a symbol of sickness and death. She presumably once held lethal objects in the hands of her twelve missing arms..Chamunda is naked except for a short diaphanous dhoti partially covering the two tiger skins complete with heads that hang from her waist to her knees. Although her extremities are missing, it is clear from comparison with related images that this Chamunda stood with legs straight, the right turned outward. The starkness and uncompromising horror of this sculpture are representative of one aspect of Indian theology..Like images of Shiva in his dark form of Bhairava, such macabre images of the Goddess are common occupants of the exterior walls of temples. They appear both on shrines dedicated to Shiva and those to the Goddess herself..@metmuseum...Chamunda, the Horrific Destroyer of Evil, Made in India, 10th-11th century, Sandstone, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum.Châmundâ, l’horrible destructrice du mal, Produite en Inde, Xème - XIème siècle, Grès, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum...🗓 231th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Art of India

name: 2019-08-21 05.29.44 2114876817060913605_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Love Letter - Jean Honoré Franogard -What I find so fascinating about this work is not only the teasing expression on the woman’s face but also the use of colour. Here we see touches of colour only where the light streams in— the soft touches of blue and pink. The rest of the painting is a monotone and brown. This mirrors the way we view the world— the cones in our eyes pick up on colour but can only do so in light.

text: NYC TRIP DAY 3🗽Upper east side - The met - central park - madison avenue - K Town🗽가은이가 뉴욕 회사 첫 출근을 하며 내 솔로 여행이 시작됐다주말보다 오백배 많이 걸었지만 홀로 다녀서 내 사진은 1도 없는걸 인스타올리면서 깨달았다가십걸 좀 본 사람들은 다 가지는 어퍼 이스트 사이드의 로망은 3보 1공사장에 박살이 났고 수많은 영화와 드라마에서 나온 메디슨 에비뉴 따라 걸으며 쇼핑하기엔 뉴욕의 여름은 굉장히 폭력적이 었다점심은 여행객 답게 쉑쉑을 조졌고 밀크쉐이크는 시켰지만 마지막 양심으로 감튀는 사지 않았다밥 먹자 마자 몇블럭 따라 걸어서 르벵 베이커리에서 손바닥만한 초코칩쿠키를 조졌다배부른데도 존나 맛있다는데 느껴질만큼 아싹 바싹 푹씬 달달 했다 배를 가득 채우고 메트로폴리탄 미술관으로 걸어갔다미술관은 아주 존나 매우 크며 1층 전체에서 미국은 가지지 못한 남의 나라 고대 유물과 약탈유적을 만끽할수 있었다.그리고 남은 절반은 비잔티움 부터 시작하는 종교 예술이 있는데 잘못 들어가서 주님아래 갇혀 2시간 동안 예수님이 다양하게 묘사된 작품만 봐야했다오층의 루프탑의 뷰는 정말 장관이고 절경이며 신이 주신 선물같은 시티의 스카이 하인과 센트럴 파크의 무성한 녹음이 잘 어우러 져있었다. 상설 전시 이외에도패션 전시회와 락앤롤 전시회, 아폴로 11호와 달 사진 전시회가 따로 있었고 현대 미술 좋아하는 나는 세 전시  다 너무 재밌게 봤다.미술관 문닫기 직전까지 전시를 보다 가은이랑 K타운에서 다시 만났다미국에서 굳이 굳이 비싸게 준 종로상회 한우는 진짜 졸라 맛있었지만 K타운 자체가 하나의 큰 음식물쓰레기통 같은 냄새를 풍겨서 다시 꼭 가고싶지는 않다뉴욕은 더워서 그런지 샌프란의 홈리스,떨 쩐내와는 또 다른 오지고 지리는 냄새가 난다. #newyork #nyc #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #shackshack #shackstack #levainbakery #chocolatechipcookies #foodie#traveling #먹스타그램 #먹방 #쉑쉑버거#쉑스택 #르뱅베이커리 #초콜릿칩쿠키 #뉴욕 #어퍼이스트사이드 #멧 #메트로폴리탄뮤지엄 #메트로폴리탄

text: Ancient interpretations of the female form 🚶🏻‍♀️Metropolitan Museum of Art NYC. Perhaps of equal importance to the art itself is the manner in which it is curated. The verb “curate” means selecting, organizing, and looking after the items in (a collection or exhibition). The most significant task of a professional curator is to organize and display the respective pieces in the most aesthetically pleasing and historically relevant manner. It is imperative that an exhibition (such as the one shown above) is curated in a way that is both beautiful and accessible to a wide range of viewers from different academic and cultural backgrounds. #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #nyc  #newyork #newyorkcity #museum #exhibition #female #woman #form #antico #archaeology #ancient #greek #girl #stunning #inspire #inspiration #research #passion #art #arthistory #arthistorian #history #✨ #🎨 #🗺 #🖼 #🗿 #🇺🇸

name: 2019-08-21 09.36.17 2115000901626143814_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Em julho deste ano fiz uma viagem à Nova York que foi um grande divisor de águas em minha vida. Foram vários os momentos e situações que tiveram uma grande relevância para mim e dentre eles está a visita que fiz ao MET (Metropolitan Museum of Art). De todos/as artistas e de todo o acervo - que conta com mais de 5.000 anos de história - o que mais estava curiosa em ver era Van Gogh, o meu pintor favorito da vida. Fiquei extremamente emocionada em ver de perto obras pintadas por esse ser humano incrível..Como forma de me lembrar deste momento comprei um dos vários livros sobre Van Gogh disponíveis na loja do MET, o "Creative Inspirations". Este livro de Arte contém 150 reproduções de desenhos e pinturas feitas por Van Gogh, com citações do pintor que foram editadas e selecionadas para criar um livro esclarecedor, edificante e realmente inspirador para os amantes da Arte, pessoas criativas e artistas. Além disso, "Creative Inspirations" é uma jornada maravilhosa onde podemos conhecer mais intimamente este homem que lutou mais do que qualquer outro pelo direito, espaço e força para ser um artista..Agora me digam: qual/quais os (as) artistas favoritos de vocês? Vamos conversar nos comentários!.#gabriellaeoslivros #bookstagram #instalivros #instabooks #igliterario #booklover #bookaholic #bookworm #amoler #amolivros #leiamais #livro #livros #libro #book #books #themet #themetny #metropolitanmuseumofart #vangogh #vincentvangogh #creativeinspirations

name: 2019-08-21 21.47.13 2115368798274863928_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: SLIT GONG - Papua New Guinea, Korewori River, middle Sepik region; Yimam peoples 19th or early 20th century, wood. — In many parts of New Guinea, the sounds produced by certain types of musical instruments played during ceremonies are said to be the voices of ancestors or supernatural beings. In Sepik cultures, the most important instruments are sacred flutes and slit gongs. Slit gongs are percussion instruments hollowed from logs to create a chamber with a narrow slit like aperture; the edges of the slit are struck with wood beaters to create resonant tones and complex rhythms. Slit gongs are a prominent feature of men’s ceremonial houses, where they are arranged on the earthen floor of the open structure. Although played exclusively by men, they are relatively public objects, visible, at least on certain occasions, to the community at large. Others forms of ritual instruments are strictly secret and hidden from women, children, and uninitiated men.  #themet #themetropolitan #metropolitanmuseumofarts #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumnewyork #newguinea #papuanewguinea #papanewguinea #papua #papuaindonesia #slit #slitgong #carranca #carrancas #sepik #sepikculture #percussion #musicalinstruments #mylife #bestdays #best #vibes #myday

name: 2019-08-21 22.16.20 2115383455429535483_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: AMBRYM SLIT GONGS — The towering slit gongs of Northern Vanuatu are among the largest freestanding musical instruments on earth. Found primarily on Ambrym, Malakula, and neighboring islands, they are carved from the trunks of large breadfruit trees, hollowed out to create a resonating chamber with a narrow slit shaped aperture. The edges of the slit are struck with club like wood beaters, producing deep, sonorous tones. A number of gongs, constituting an informal orchestra, stand on the Village’s dancing ground. These gongs orchestras are played at major social and ceremonial occasions such as initiations, dances, and funerals. Through carefully coordinated actions, the drummers in the gong ensemble produce rhythms of immense variety and complexity. Slit gongs are, or were, used to communicate between villages. Under proper atmospheric conditions, their sound can carry for miles through the forest and, in rare instances, across the water to neighboring islands. A series of gong “languages “ composed of beats and pauses enables highly specific messages to be sent. The slit gong and finials exhibited here are from Ambrym island. The complete gong, from Fanla Village, was commissioned in the 1960’s by the village chief Tain Mai, Who was acknowledged as its creator, but it was carved by Tin Mweleun, an artist from a neighboring village. The gong is made in the form of a stylized ancestor figure. The spiral motifs painted on the eyes represent Metan Galgal, the morning star. Small arms and spirals depicting sacred pig tusks appear on either side of the face, which is surrounded by projections representing hair. The long vertical slit represents the mouth, through which the ancestor’s “voice” emerges as sound whenever the gong is played.  #themet #themetropolitan #metropolitanmuseumofarts #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #themetropolitanmuseumofart #themetropolitanmuseumofartnewyork #papuanewguinea #papua #papuaindonesia #newguinea #newguineaart #papanewguinea #mypics #artpics #myvibes #mydays #nyc #mycaptures

name: 2019-08-21 22.29.24 2115390028860133732_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Kwakwaka’wakw (Kwakiutl), Female Figure, Canada, British Columbia, 19th century, wood paint. Lives in the Arts of Africa, Oceania, and the Americas, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art @metmuseum ..The carving traditions of Northwest Coast peoples are very strong and of uncertain age. The traditions were well established when Europeans arrived in the late eighteenth century and are continued today. The expressive ceremonial life of Native peoples enriches their carving, as it enriches all communal activities. Complex and imaginative mythological themes were rendered three-dimensionally. In terms of the scale and presence of wood sculpture, no group surpassed the Kwakwaka’wakw (Kwakiutl) of Queen Charlotte Strait in central British Columbia. By the late nineteenth century, freestanding Kwakwaka’wakw totem poles were big and tall and deeply carved. This unusual female figure may have been part of such a pole or of an interior house post. It is flattened in back, as if to fit against a support. The position of the figure’s hands implies a sexually derived theme, perhaps one that refers to specific reasons. Remnants of a pattern in red appear on her face, most extensively on the chin, and on the long braids are remains of black paint..Text source @metmuseum wall text..#themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #kwakwakawakw #kwakiutl #femalefigure #canadabritishcolumbia #britishcolumbia #native #19thcentury #artsofafricaoceaniaandtheamericas #africaoceaniaamericas #woodcarving #carving #woodsculpture #sculpture #queencharlottestrait #totempoles #ny #nyc #art #artmuseum #museum

name: 2019-08-21 23.21.13 2115416112958502598_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Time to revisit my version of the Three Graces (original statue on display at @metmuseum ) 🙏🏻🙏🏻🙏🏻. ..............................These young girls, linked in a dance-like pose, represent The Three Graces: Aglaia (Beauty), Euphrosyne (Mirth), and Thalia (Abundance). They bestow what is most pleasurable and beneficent in nature and society: fertility and growth, beauty in the arts, harmonious reciprocity between men. They enjoyed venerable cults in Greece and Asia Minor. In mythology, they play an attendant role, gracing festivals and organizing dances. Their closest connection is with Aphrodite, whom they serve as handmaidens.This carefully calculated, frieze-like composition is typical of classicizing art of the second and first centuries B.C. Instantly recognizable, it soon became the canonic formula for representing the Graces, who appeared in every medium and on every kind of object, from mirrors to sarcophagi. .....#chicago #chicagoart #chicagoartist #jasonbranson #JasonBransonDotCom #redmonks #art #drawing #artist#threegraces #statue#themet#metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc#newyork

Ultimately powerful and creative, Mahadevi is understood by her devotees as the the true reality in the universe. As she was the protector deity of the ruling household of Bikaner, this representation would have had special significance for the court..@metmuseum...Mahadevi, the Great Goddess, Made in Bikaner, state of Rajasthan India, Circa 1725, Ink, opaque watercolor, and silver on paper, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum.Mahadevi, la Grande déesse, Réalisé à Bikaner dans l’état du Rajasthan, Inde, Vers 1725, Encre, aquarelle opaque et argent sur papier, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum...🗓 232th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Art of India

name: 2019-08-22 03.20.08 2115536364863689751_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🍭ELIZABETH MURRAY🍭▫️Children Meeting | 1978 | @whitneymuseum▫️“Art is an epiphany in a coffee cup.” —Elizabeth Murray▫️If I had to describe Elizabeth Murray’s work with one word, I’d keep it simple and say “Fun.” Her colorful, cartoonish style breathed life back into painting at a time when people thought the medium was dying. But Murray’s delightful compositions were equally as serious as they were fun. Murray’s work broke with artistic conventions and, later in her life, frankly acknowledged her own mortality and illness. But even as her art became more serious, Murray held onto her iconic, playful style.▫️I love this painting in particular because of the way it achieves the sensation of children playing without any figuration. Like Brancusi’s “Bird in Flight,” we can perceive the subject matter without actually seeing it. All it takes is some bright colors, eclectic shapes, and a sense of movement.▫️While it may sometimes feel like you need a PhD to understand artists talking, Murray kept her descriptions playful and the simple, using words like goofy, silly, and wacky. This playfulness is exactly what I love about Murray — she didn’t take art so seriously. Murray made painting fun, pushing back against the austerity of previous generations of artists.▫️It wasn’t all fun and games, though. Murray also contributed to the historical canon with her multi-panel compositions that literally stretched the boundaries of painting. Like a jigsaw puzzle, she would piece together dozens of oddly shaped canvases to make sprawling, colorful compositions. While other artists such as Ellsworth Kelly pioneered the shaped canvas, Murray took the practice to its apotheosis. This painting from the Whitney was actually made before Murray developed her signature style, (there’s only one canvas), but the MoMA has the of the great examples of her puzzle-like technique, and it would be worth checking out when the museum re-opens in October.

name: 2019-08-22 03.28.19 2115540482318510995_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🇮🇹 Gruppo statuario delle Tre Grazie, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.Le Cariti, divinità dell'antica Grecia (dette dai Romani Gratiae), sono personificazioni della grazia e della bellezza e loro dispensatrici. Secondo la mitologia greca sono figlie di Zeus e di Eurinome. I loro nomi sono Aglaia (Bellezza), Eufrosine (Gioia), Talia (Abbondanza). Esse erano le ancelle di Afrodite e in questo gruppo scultoreo sono raffigurate come fanciulle nude in una posa armoniosa dalla composizione simile a quella di un fregio. Di questa scultura non si conosce né la provenienza né l'autore. Si tratta sicuramente di una copia romana di II sec. d.C. di un originale risalente al tardo periodo ellenistico.Tale scultura era forse collocata originariamente in un giardino o in un bagno pubblico.🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🇬🇧 Statuary group of the Three Graces, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.The Charites, goddes of ancient Greece (known as the Roman Gratiae), are personifications and bestowers of grace and beauty. According to the Greek mythology they are daughters of Zeus and Eurinome. Their names are Aglaea (Beauty), Euphrosyne (Joy), Thalia (Abundance).They were the handmaids of Aphrodite and in this sculptural group they are depicted as naked girls in a harmonious pose with a composition similar to that of a frieze. Neither the origin nor the author is known of this sculpture. It is certainly a Roman copy of the second century AD of an original dating back to the late Hellenistic period.This sculpture was perhaps originally placed in a garden or in a public bath.🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️📸 Photo by @vif59🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️🔸️🔹️#america #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #met #metnyc #tregrazie #threegraces #graces #sculpture #romansculpture #romanart #statue #museum #museo #history #culture #ancientart #greekmithology #mithology #art #arteantica #archeology #antiquities #museo #archeology #antiqua_archeologia #heritage #worldheritage

text: Aubrey Beardsley, born on this day in 1872, created a portfolio of designs for the first British edition of Oscar Wilde’s "Salomé" in 1894. Perhaps his most celebrated work, here, the figure of Salome floats and holds the severed head of John the Baptist, which she has just kissed. The print depicts the final words said by Salome in the play "J'ai baisé ta bouche Iokanaan, j'ai baisé ta bouche" ("I have kissed your mouth, Jokannan, I have kissed your mouth")⠀⠀Aubrey Vincent Beardsley (British, 1872–1898), published by John Lane, The Climax, for Salomé by Oscar Wilde, 1907, process print from line block [63.693.2(15)]⠀⠀#metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #aubreybeardsley #beardsley #salome #oscarwilde

name: 2019-08-22 05.13.14 2115593283733175652_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Untitled (Lithograph)” (1969) by #SirTerryFrost (British, 1915-2003). Artist proof # 8. Signed by the artist in pencil....Sir Terry Frost was an English painter known for his geometric abstractions and color studies that spanned over 6 decades. Frost was born in the U.K. He served in the Second World War and was captured by the Nazi’s as a prisoner of war. After his release and return to England, Frost attended the Camberwell School of Art and studied under Ben Nicholson and William Coldstream. Frost exhibited worldwide and later taught at the University of Leeds and the University of Reading. In 1992, he was elected to the Royal Academy and knighted in 1998. In 2000, a major retrospective of Frost’s work was held at the Royal Academy of Arts in London. Frost’s work can be found at the Tate Gallery in London, Metropolitan Museum of Art, and the National Galleries of Scotland in Edinburgh, among others.

name: 2019-08-22 06.08.56 2115621320465943938_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: My next stop was NYC to visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art. I was particularly interested to visit the collections of Ancient Near East and the Islamic Art. Today, I will share with you a few highlights from the Ancient Near Eastern collections. The statue, one of my favorite artworks of the ancient world, is of Gudea, who ruled Lagash between 2150 and 2125 BCE and ordered a series of diorite statues displaying him as an ultimate pious ruler. The next photo is of a 5th century BCE Achaemenid rhyton in the shape of a leonid beast, showcasing the technical skills of Persian metalworkers. The next photo shows three Sasanian silver vessels, one of the best-known objects from Sasanian Iran. Many of these vessels display a scene in which a Sasanian king (identified by his specific crown) is hunting wild animals. You can see the details of two of these pieces in the following pictures.I am extremely grateful to Dr. Henry Colburn (seen in the last photo), an amazing scholar of ancient Near Eastern art, who kindly hosted me during my two visits to the museum and made the arrangements for my visit to the special collections. #smuarthistory #smumeadows#meadows50 #arthistory #NYC #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

name: 2019-08-22 07.29.43 2115661975486108078_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The first time I see Diego Rivera’s artwork is in LACMA - Flower Day (Picture 1). The unusual perspective of the flowers, which are seen from above, and blocklike forms of the figures are a symbol of Diego’s earlier Cubist painting. His style reminds me of Paul Gauguin (Picture 2 -Tahitian Women Bathing; Picture 3 - La Orana Maria; in the Met). Not only the bold color that the artists like to use but also the abstruse idiosyncratic iconography. ..#lacama #metropolitanmuseumofart #diegorivera #paulgauguin #oilpainting #oilpaintings #artcollection #artcollector #cubism #artist #artistsoninstagram #artappreciation #fridakahlo #tahiti #tahitiart

text: 뉴욕 멧 수퍼바이저선생님이 한국에 잠시 오셨는데 쉼표를 보러 멀리 부여집까지 오셨다. 오랜만에 황선생님이랑 케빈선생님도 보고, 이쁜 마린이도 만나고😻 그리고 함께 온 머나먼 그리운 뉴욕에서 온 쉼표 선물. 멧 선물을 보니 다들 보고싶어진다. 모든 게 다 추억이 되었다. 옷에 써있는 문구처럼 쉼표도 예술을 좋아했으면 좋겠다. I ❤️ART! 얼른 부쩍부쩍 잘커서 엄마랑 아빠랑 셋이 뉴욕놀러가자🗽✈️ 감사합니다!  Now, he can become a Met baby boy! Thank you all! #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkcity #babygifts #imissyou

name: 2019-08-22 20.32.39 2116056040941740976_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of Art’s (@metmuseum) ongoing exhibition titled ‘Sita and Rama: The Ramayana in Indian Painting’ displays one of the epic narratives of South-Asian Literature through a collection of paintings. These have been made by court artists from the 17th and 19th centuries for the Rajput and Pahari courts of north India. The artworks are on display from August 10, 2019 to February 23, 2020, and again from February 27, 2020 to August 23, 2020, making it a year-long exhibition.#The chosen artworks offer strong visual illustrations of this Sanskrit epic and encompass its various facets effectively through two mediums. "Some of the textiles are huge, and the massive scale suggests that they were meant to be seen by large audiences. In contrast, the paintings would have been viewed by individuals or small groups. In this sense, the paintings often show a single event and relate closely to the text of the Ramayana. The textiles present major characters and climatic moments such as the final battle between Rama and Ravana. Together these two media work well to beautifully tell the story and to emphasise the diversity of the Indian painting and textile traditions,” shares Kurt Behrendt, Associate Curator in the Department of Asian Art at the Met, who has organised this exhibition. #linkinbio#Photography: Rumal with Scenes from the Ramayana India, Jammu and Kashmir, Chamba, 18th century Cotton with silk, tinsel, and metal embroidery. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Rogers Fund, 1931Writer: Avni Raut

name: 2019-08-22 23.05.54 2116133177234958445_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: My very favorite painting, Madame X. The original depicted her right shoulder strap hanging down shocking society and leading Critics to remark how easily the entire dress may fall down 😱. They clearly didn’t know ladies fashion, as the dress was corseted, the straps being purely ornamental. Nevertheless, the painting was redone with the strap UP and the painter was run out of Paris.#johnsingersargent #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-22 23.07.18 2116133882742062959_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Read Alicja Kwade’s interview with Melissa Bianca Amore for BOMB magazine, online now! ✨ The two discuss Kwade’s commission for the @metmuseum Cantor Rooftop, ParaPivot, which continues through October 27th, as well as several works from her recent exhibition at 303 Gallery. “Engaged with scientific theory and social conventions used to perceive reality, she employs the language of sculpture and architecture to examine the origins of perception and measure how information is transferred to an object or form.” Link in stories to the full article. 📸 Photo by Hyla Skopitz. #alicjakwade @alicjakwade @melissa_bianca_amore  @bombmag #bombmagazine #parapivot #cantorroof #paraparticular #metropolitanmuseumofart #303gallery

text: Carmen Herrera (age 104 years) credits her true triumph to the fact that she never had commercial success at an early age. This allowed her to paint her entire life and career for herself and herself alone. Where would your passions lead you, if not driven by outside demands?*Equilibrio 2012

name: 2019-08-23 01.39.02 2116210250230248133_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Credit to from @europe_treasures (@get_regrann) - ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Treasure: 👉 Artemis - 1910Artist: 🇩🇪 Max Nonnenbruch Where:📍Private Collection Photo: 📸 @christiesinc Tag: 🔑#europe_treasures Family:👉 @tesori_italiani👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @archaeology.treasures 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 Max Nonnenbruch (1857-1922) was a German painter born in 1857 in Viersen. A painter of genre scenes in his early days, Max Nonnenbruch was then influenced by neoclassical and symbolist aesthetics as well as by pre-Raphaelite painters. His works represented young women, dancers and odalisques with oriental dresses. Many references to Greek and Roman antiquity can be seen: Greek vases, jewellery, hairstyles, columns and mosaic decorations. The pure and idyllic scenes of Max Nonnenbruch were particularly visible in his works depicting young women dressed in antique at the seaside. The vibrating touch highlights the effects of the lights. Through his work and his involvement in the artistic events of his time, Max Nonnenbruch acquired an important reputation. 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀🏛 Share our Wonderful Heritage 🏛🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹#art #europeanart #artists #artwork🎨 #german #germany #durer #germanart #deutsch #musee #artiste #masterpiece #kunst  #metropolitanmuseumofart #dürer #kunstwerke #renaissance #privatecollection #finearts - #repost  #art #artlover #instagood #regrann

name: 2019-08-23 04.09.02 2116285751058847349_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I got to check out the "Play It Loud" exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC last weekend. It's a collection of the most iconic instruments owned and played by the most iconic rockers - from Bo Diddly to Jack White. This photo is me in awe of Clapton's main guitar from the 70s and 80s, a frankensteined Fender Strat named "Blackie" assembled by his guitar tech from 3 different 50s Strats. More pics comin soon.

name: 2019-08-23 07.16.41 2116380192424299181_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Today, I bring you some of the highlights from the Islamic galleries at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The first picture is from the Sharmin and Bijan Mossavar-Rahmani gallery dedicated to Safavid and Later Persian Art (1500-1924), followed by a close-up of one of the several carpets adorning the room; a fine 16th century Safavid carpet known as the “Seley” carpet.The following pictures are highlights from several galleries of the Islamic art collections at the Met:A group of cosmetic flasks dated to 10th-12th century designed to hold kohl (a black cosmetic powder applied around the eyes).A fine Seljuq luster ceramic of Kashan, depicting a wedding procession.A 12th-13th century minai (enameled) ware depicting the story of Bahram Gur and Azadeh, which also is the motif of a 5th century Sasanian silver vessel posted yesterday.And finally, one of the most impressive pieces at the Met; a 12th century gilded minai ware. In this rare group of ceramics, Medieval Muslim potters boasted their technological and artistic prowess by combining two unique technics of minai painting and gilding to create such masterpieces. #smuarthistory #smumeadows #meadows50 #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

text: A few moments from my lecture tour today at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City on the exceptional exhibition of Leonardo Da Vinci's unfinished painting of "St. Jerome". On loan from the Vatican Museums, and made possible through the generosity of the Patrons of the Arts, New York Chapter, the painting is one of only a dozen or so works in the world by the Renaissance genius. Be sure to see it before it heads to Paris for the blockbuster show on Leonardo at the Louvre scheduled to open on October 24, 2019. #RockyRuggiero #metropolitanmuseumofart #NewYork

name: 2019-08-23 10.03.00 2116463910421650117_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🥀MARK ROTHKO🥀▪️No. 16 | 1960 | @metmuseum▪️.”Silence is so accurate, Rothko WroteAccurate like an arrow without a targetand no target in mind.Silence has its own roar or, not-roar,just as Rothko wrote “I don’t express myself in my paintings. I express my not-self.”.A poem that expresses the not-self.Everything but the self.The meadow’s veil of fog, but is veil self-referential?Already, dawn, the not-birds alert to what silence has to offer.The fog, one of Rothko’s shapes,hanging there in the not-self, humming.Mikel, before he died, loved Rothko most.When he could still think, he put his mind to those sorts of judgments.If I pull the fog away like theater curtains, what then?Sadness shapes the landscape.The arrow of myself thwacks the nearest tree.Fog steps closer like a perpetrator or a god.Oh. I’m weeping.Tears feed the silence like a mother drops into her baby not-bird’s open beaksome sweet but dangerous morsel.”.—DIANE SEUSS, Silence Is so Accurate

name: 2019-08-23 10.31.34 2116478289777892293_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Хочется посвятить искусству отдельный пост.С искусством у меня сложились особые отношения. Вне работы.Призовые места в школьных поэтических конкурсах, окружные театральные сцены с постановками на английском. Диплом по выявлению и дифференциации акцентуаций у людей творческих профессий и сопутствующая аналитическая работа с выборкой 300 человек. Среди вас в моем кругу общения остались вдохновляющие друзья, актеры/режиссеры/писатели/художники. До сих пор помню запахи застывающей краски в мастерской и сакральный момент, когда после легкого мазка работа завершена. Потом fashion съемки в журнале Vogue и работа с ведущими московскими стилистами параллельно учебе МГУ. Скажем, коммерческий привкус творчества.И вот уже отлавливание внутренних ощущений и расслабление через движения в Тодес в Олимпийском. Выражение телом то, что хочешь сказать.В последнее время выражение через фотографию. Пожалуй, благодаря искусству воспитала чувство вкуса и понимание красоты, выстроила диалог с интуитивным восприятием едва уловимого за материальным. Кажется, прожила несколько жизней)А Metropolitan это моя большая любовь❤️#metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #art

name: 2019-08-23 15.30.30 2116628738012810561_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Empress Dagmar by Ivan Kramskoi.In 1864, tzarevich Nicholas became betrothed to Dagmar. On 22 April 1865 he died from meningitis. His last wish was that Dagmar would marry his younger brother, the future Alexander III. In 1881 her father-in-law Alexander II of Russia was killed by a bomb. In her diary, Maria later described how the wounded, still living Emperor was taken to the palace: "His legs were crushed terribly and ripped open to the knee; a bleeding mass, with half a boot on the right foot, and only the sole of the foot remaining on the left."Alexander II died a few hours later and Maria became tzarina.Maria is described as a success in her social role as Empress, loved to dance at the balls of high society and became a popular socialite and hostess of the Imperial balls; her daughter Olga commented, “Court life had to run in splendor, and there my mother played her part without a single false step.” After the Bolshevic revolution and the murder of her son Nicholas II she writes in her diary "I am sure they all got out of Russia and now the Bolsheviks are trying to hide the truth." She firmly held on to this conviction until her death. The truth was too painful for her to admit publicly. Her letters to her son and his family have since almost all been lost; but in one that survives, she wrote to Nicholas: "You know that my thoughts and prayers never leave you. I think of you day and night and sometimes feel so sick at heart that I believe I cannot bear it any longer. But God is merciful. He will give us strength for this terrible ordeal." Maria's daughter Olga Alexandrovna commented further on the matter, "Yet I am sure that deep in her heart my mother had steeled herself to accept the truth some years before her death." #drawing #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #hermitage #oldmasters #canvas #uffizigallery #artist #painting #christies #sothebys #creative #instaart #artdealer #artbroker #art #artistsoninstagram #artad #russianpaintings #russianrealism #romanov #imperialrussia #nicholasii #otma #otmaa #naotmaa #romanovs #russia #tretyakov

text: ...오늘 로로가 그랬다...."엄마, 나는 쉬는 시간에 하루도뉴욕 생각을 안 한 적이 없다.." .깜놀 해서 "정말..?" 그랬더니..그냥 뉴욕에서 여기 저기 막~~🚸걸어 다니던 생각이 자꾸 난다고..그리고 어쩌다가 학교에서 기분 안 좋은 일이 있을 때는 그냥미국에서 즐거웠던 걸 떠올린다고..3학년 되더니 갑자기 생각이 이렇게나성숙해진 로로를 보고 너무 감동하고..또 너무 훌~쩍 커버려서 급 울컥 하기까지..💚💛💙..아이에게 가장 좋은 선물이 여행과체험이구나..라는 확신이 들며..정말내가 더 노력 해서라도 자주 여행도가고 캠프도 다니게 해주고 제주도에서도 더 많은 곳을 탐험 하고 새로운 걸 도전해 보게 해줘야 겠구나 라는생각을 해본다..🗺..#nyc 🗽#ilovenyc#맨해튼#loro_nyc #loro_curiousexplorer #themet#metropolitanmuseumofart #loro_year3 #growingup#beautiful#memories#timessquare#chelseapiers #benjaminsteakhouse#boatbasincafe#batterypark...

text: From the #1970s until her passing in #2018 , #bettywoodman created an  #innovative and exciting body of work, each being an amalgamation of ceramics, painting, and sculpture. In #2006 , #woodman was given a #retrospective at the #metropolitanmuseumofart in #newyork, a rare honour for a #livingartist and the first time the institution held a show for a #living #woman artist.  Among #museums worldwide, Woodman’s work can be found in the #permanent #collections of the #victoriaandalbertmuseum in #london , and the #museedesartsdecoratifs in #Paris. #clay #pottery #plasticarts #robinrosenbergfineart #rrfa @ldk.art #contemporary #ceramic #vases #woodman #womeninthearts #vase #womenartists Sent from my iPhone

text: About last night ... 💦 “La Tempête”, Pierre Auguste Cot, 1880 @metmuseum☔️..“One day, while descending from the mountaintop, I saw Virginie running from one end of the garden toward the house, her head covered by her overskirt, which she had lifted from behind her in order to gain shelter from a rain shower. From a distance I had thought she was alone, but upon coming closer to help her walk I saw that by the arm she held Paul who was almost entirely covered by the same blanket. Both were laughing together in the shelter of this umbrella of their own invention.” - “Paul et Virginie”, Bernardin de Saint-Pierre, 1788.#rainstorm #thunderstorm #nycweather #rainynight #couplesgoals #arthistory #frenchpainting #romanticism #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: As promised, here’s one of the finished commissioned wearable art jewelry piece. I have say that I surprise myself on this piece. I put my heart and sold in this piece and the client loves this statement necklace. I love this piece as well as the creation journey. I was kind of sad went creation process ended. This is always the bitter sweet part of the process. You give creative birth to a breathtaking work of art, then you have to let it go. At least the piece is loved and has a new home. name: 2019-08-24 02.33.13 2116962287420971348_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🇮🇳 Celestial dancer (Devata)...The Hindu temple is conceived as a heavenly abode for the presiding deity. The building's stepped, indented, and towering exterior evokes the mountains of Indra's heavens, home to the assembly of gods as well as celestial beauties, dancers, and musicians. This life-size sandstone sculpture is an extraordinary rending of a heavenly celebrant performing in honor of the gods. The dancer's face and body are treated according to prescribed canons of beauty. Her body is contorted in an improbably pose, her legs projecting to her right while her upper torso and head turn sharply left. The extreme flexion reflects dance positions (karunas and sthanas) described in the Natyasastra, an ancient dramatic arts treatise. It is understood in Indian aesthetics that such positions enhance the appreciation of beauty..@metmuseum...Celestial dancer (Devata), Made in Central India, Madhya Pradesh, mid-11th century, Chandela period, Sandstone, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum.Danseuse céleste (Devata), Réalisé dans le centre de l’Inde, Madhya Pradesh, Milieu du XIème siècle, Grès, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum...🗓 234th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Art of India

name: 2019-08-24 03.08.45 2116980184388273831_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: New York loves lines. ...I mean, they seriously love lines. I understand the security check at entry but then why not add a couple more tables to speed it up? And now all I want is to grab a coke from the café and still have to stand in an effing long queue for fecks sake. Or is this some kind of American cafeteria/buffet hall fetish?Also, they have big proud signs saying they're phasing out plastic straws for environmental reasons (great!) But then their fridge isn't cold so they're giving everyone plastic cups of ice for their soft drinks, not to mention no mugs for the coffee and tea, just disposable cups. Excellent work.#newyork #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #touristseverywhere #hatecrowds #sheepculture

text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art MET は圧巻でした。建物も展示も素晴らしい😍1日ではとても見切れない量のお宝from all over the world 🌎 触れちゃうほどの至近で名画鑑賞。唯一混んでいたのが、ゴッホの自画像。日本の美術館（人気展だと）の人の隙間から眺めなきゃいけない状態って😨日本関連では、名和晃平さんのガラスの鹿のオブジェ（中に本物の鹿が入ってる❗️）や華やかな屏風、刀などは熱心に見ている人がいたけど、浮世絵はさっぱり。#metropolitanmuseumofart #メトロポリタン美術館 #koheinawa #名和晃平

text: // Eternal Spring by Auguste Rodin // c.1884 carved marble // Paris, France•The woman arches her torso in willful surrender to her partner, who bends at his ease to kiss her. Rodin sought to temper the works over eroticism by suggesting his direction was a metaphorical depiction of Cupid and the Psyche. This piece struck me hard.

name: 2019-08-24 11.52.25 2117243748279574241_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Наши предки оставили нам свою мудрость в рисунках. Но мы не смогли сохранить ее. Не познав свою историю, как можно познать свое предназначение?.Остаётся лишь по крупицам собирать истории своей семьи и своего народа. Можно обратиться в прошлое, к астрологу, вглубь себя, проделать практики. И можно обратиться к Создателю всех творений..О, мой дорогой Господь Нараяна, пожалуйста, веди меня🙏 укажи мне путь мой✨Когда-то я попала сюда, забыв свою духовную природу и привязавшись к материальному миру. Лишь теперь память понемногу возвращается спустя тысячи воплощений.Все это время моя душа искала смысл. Но смысл сокрыт лишь в тебе, о дорогой Господь Мукунда💕 Дарующий освобождение💕Ты никогда не предаешь, ты никогда не совершаешь ошибок. Ты полон (самодостаточен) и милосерден. Ты даёшь каждому живому существу возможность найти тебя в своем сердце, прийти к тебе и полюбить тебя. Лишь ты даруешь истину и безУсловную любовь 💖 которую ищет каждый..#джанмаштами #мояистория #какпознатьсебя #какпознатьбога #моялюбовь #мояпечаль #мойсмыслжизни #моясемья #ньюйорк #магаполис #манхеттен #метрополитен #newyorkcity #metropolitanmuseumofart #mystory

name: 2019-08-24 12.58.44 2117277131282000029_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Friday nights at the @metropolitanmuseum have become a monthly ritual. As an artist, museum visits are mostly work or research, I barely go as a “viewer”. But, my sacred Fridays are a special occasion. Everytime my father and I met in a city we haunted a museum. In Paris it was the @museelouvre or @museerodinparis , in NYC it was the MET. He was the only one that could keep up with me. On Fridays we continue this tradition en esprit 🕊 ....#reneecaouetteart #metropolitanmuseumofart #sacredfridays #enesprit

name: 2019-08-24 19.29.19 2117473710014389316_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Tesoro: 👉 Piazza San Marco - 1720 d.C.Artista: 🇮🇹 #CanalettoLuogo:📍#NewYork - #Metropolitan MuseumFoto: 📸@metmuseum Tag: 🔑#tesori_italianiFamily:👉 @europe_treasures👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @archaeology.treasures✤ ✤ ✤🇮🇹 Canaletto fu il pittore più celebre di Venezia del settecento, particolarmente apprezzato dai visitatori britannici in città. Questa tela ben conservata ci mostra la piazza di San Marco. Le finestre del campanile sono meno numerose che in realtà e le bandiere sono troppo alte, ma a parte questi dettagli Canaletto si è preso poca libertà con la topografia e ci ha restituito una magnifica fotografia della piazza dell'epoca.✤ ✤ ✤🇬🇧The most celebrated view painter of eighteenth-century Venice, Canaletto was particularly popular with British visitors to the city. This wonderfully fresh and well-preserved canvas shows Piazza San Marco. The windows of the bell tower are fewer in number than in actuality, and the flagstaffs are too tall, but otherwise Canaletto took few liberties with the topography.✤ ✤ ✤ #arteitaliana #ig_italia #italia #beniculturali30 #metmuseum #cultura #italiainunoscatto #veneziano #yallersitalia #venecia #metropolitanmuseumofart #museitaliani #metropolitanmuseum #piazzasanmarco #italy #venice #sanmarco #artista #masterpiece #sanmarcos #campanile #marmo #belltower #metmuseum

name: 2019-08-24 22.12.45 2117555976991535974_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art⠀В 1870 году группа бизнесменов-почитателей искусств открыла в Нью-Йорке музей, который в наше время стал четвёртым по посещаемости музеем мира и вобрал в себя коллекцию произведений искусства со всего мира: от древнего Египта до артефактов Индейских племён.⠀Лично меня очень впечатлил отдел с древнеегипетскими находками.⠀Здесь вы можете наблюдать @stacy_iuferova на пути к раскрытию смысла таинственных иероглифов.⠀Также настоящий полноразмерный храмовый комплекс в огромном зале со стеклянным потолком.⠀#metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #themetegyptianwing

name: 2019-08-24 23.14.12 2117586903583557649_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Good Morning TEAM!! Today, inside or outside the Met the sun shines on all of us. This is it! This is always it!No matter what you do, I believe it's your best. I know your passion will light the room. I know you take the greatest risk, to be surprised or disappointed in your work. This is the courage of the artist who shows up ready for any result but eager to be triumphant. I see this in all if you and I know where ever you find yourself today, you will bring that light to others. Today is the day. Now let's live it! 🔥🙌🔥...#AOTM #artistsofthemet #threegraces #thisisit #onlynow #art #forartssake #metmuseum #artstudy #artcollective #nycolletive #museum #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #bringthelight

name: 2019-08-25 01.48.24 2117664509498951326_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🇮🇳 Śankh...In Hinduism the conch shell is usually associated with the god Vishnu, Lord of the Waters, but the brass fittings on this shell indicate a link with Shaivite ritual. The mouthpiece suggests a lotus, while the heavily decorated conical end depicts rows of nagas (serpent divinities) and wreath-bearing kirtimukhas ("Faces of Glory"). A yoni design (symbol of female energy) is interspersed between each naga and kirtimukha. The fitting terminates with the head of a makara (elephant/crocodile monster), atop which strides a yali (elephant/lion monster). Three figures rest at the upper edge of the shell's opening: the lingam/yoni, symbol of Shiva and representation of the unified male/female force; Ganesh, the elephant-headed son of Shiva; and Nandi, a milk-white bull who serves as Shiva's vehicle. The opening of the hoofed stand represents a yoni..@metmuseum...Śankh, Made in the Kerala State, southwestern Malabar Coast of India, 19th century, Shell (Turbinella pyrum), brass, wax, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum.Śankh, Réalisé dans l’Etat indien du Kerala, XIXème siècle, Coquillage (Turbinella pyrum), laiton et cire, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York | @metmuseum...🗓 235th post of 2019📍 #DailyMuseum📚 This week : Art of India

text: [NY/Philly Trip] Throwback to this lovely trip! 💛 When your highschool friends @christophermolini @angelamolini move to NY, you take off a week to visit ‘em!! Knowing us, you knooww this itinerary was packed with delicious food! We visited Dominique Ansel’s Bakery, Sugar Fish Sushi, Shumai from Chinatown, Kati Roll, and of course O’Bagel! 🥓🥯🧀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀As an avid 30 Rock fan, I was so hype to visit the Rockefeller Center. Got to live my Liz Lemon dreams ✨💁🏽‍♂️✨ Not pictured are the three cups a day of boba we consumed in NY 😅Shoutout to everyone who sent us 🔥 food recommendations!⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀We also stayed in Philly for two days. Cheers to those nights of drinking and watching National Treasure! 🥂🍺That Wawa near our Airbnb was clutch with snacks! We were hella snack ready for Reading Terminal Market, the Liberty Bell, and the Rocky Steps. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#30RockIsBetterThanTheOffice #LizLemon #GrizzAndDotCom #obagel #sugarfishsushi #katiroll #ChinatownShumai #vanleeuwenicecream #niccagenationaltreasure #BellinisWithTheMolinis #whitegirlsippin #NoraebangKoreaTown #letsmeatkbbq #SpidermanPS4NYVibes #milkbar #gongcha #kftnyc #metropolitanmuseumofart #911memorialmuseum #wawahype

name: 2019-08-25 03.12.01 2117706608113251877_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: what is art? . . .I believe art gives people something to question, contemplate, and compete with. It’s a never ending process that will constantly change along with the society and the members of it. Art both depends on the artist, the storyteller, and the audience, however, it is the audience’s responsibility to be open to the new ideas that might be put at them and those that may contrast their beliefs. Art is imitation, expression, application, and imagination.. . .There’s a new blog post up on what is art. The link will be in my bio. 🎭. . .Comment what you think art is. #metmuseum #whatisart #metmuseumnyc #metmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-25 03.25.25 2117713347284667772_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Canova’s ‘Perseus with the Head of Medusa’. The statue was so well sculpted that the marble felt alive. I’m happy that the Neoclassical period in European art history existed so that we could get such sublime depictions of the stories of the Ancient Greeks. Though I sometimes wonder about the course of aesthetic history had people known about the garish colors of the original statues of the Classical period. #art #sculpture #neoclassical #ancientgreece #ancientgreek #neoclassicalart #nyc #metropolitanmuseumofart #beauty #sculpturegarden #sculpturegallery #sublime #perseus #medusa #perseuswiththeheadofmedusa #museum #museums #museummile

text: Here is one of the things I wanted to do during this summer!!🌞Now I feel like playing the drums again🥁.前回ゆっくり観れなかったメットガラの展示と合わせて、ずっと気になってた #playitloud をみてきました！とんでもなくテンション上がりました😂.お父さんが何十年も愛用してるストラトもちゃんと飾ってあって感動✨お腹の中にいるときから今までロックと共に育ってきたので笑、特別この展示は心に響くものがありました🎸.ギターは詳しくないので願わくばギター好きのひとの解説つきでもう一回観に行きたいな💓笑.#nyc#manhattan#metropolitanmuseumofart#rock#exhibition#ニューヨーク#マンハッタン#ロック#美術館#留学日記

text: 📍紐約大都會博物館旅行日期2019.04.18颱風天無處去只好來發照片世界三大博物館之一的大都會博物館有機會一定要來啊館藏之豐富要認真看完可能要好幾天因為早上在自然歷史博物館待太久然後又走吃了個下午茶結果可以停留大都會的時間只剩90分鐘就只能挑重點展廳來看但也因為時間已晚幾乎沒有什麼人一整個暢行自如完全不用排隊埃及文明必看，終於看到木乃伊了後來發現中華文化也要看宛如高中歷史課本攤在你面前二位臭男孩也看的津津有味#大都會博物館 #紐約大都會博物館 #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumnewyork #newyork #newyorktrip #紐約 #紐約景點 #紐約旅遊

name: 2019-08-25 22.25.53 2118287361401232400_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A lesser known painting by my favorite artist, Edouard Manet.  Manet’s model, Victorine Meurent, had recently posed as the brazen nudes in Olympia and Luncheon on the Grass (both Musée d’Orsay, Paris). Here, appearing relatively demure, she flaunts an intimate silk dressing gown. Critics eyed the painting as a rejoinder to Courbet’s Woman with a Parrot and as indicative of Manet’s "current vice" of failing to "value a head more than a slipper." Recent scholars have interpreted it as an allegory of the five senses: the nosegay (smell), the orange (taste), the parrot-confidant (hearing), and the man’s monocle she fingers (sight and touch). #manet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #impressionism #painting #olympia #modeling

name: 2019-08-25 22.37.43 2118293309394339764_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Я безумно влюблена⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀В живопись.Воспитана  на альбомах музея Пушкина и Третьяковской галереи, тут в Нью-Йорке ходила смотреть картину Леонардо да Винчи Святой Джеронимо,в Мет.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀The Met.Metropolitan музей моё место силы, у меня есть свои любимые мумии и уголки чтобы посидеть подумать. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Подумать у картины Леонардо да Винчи на сей раз у меня не получилось – темнота зала и странный пустой взгляд Святого пробирает до мурашек.Ушла к своим привычным мумиям-как-то мне с ними веселее что ли😀 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#shtyrkova_pro_life

name: 2019-08-25 23.26.35 2118317911882915995_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Tesoro: 👉 Salomé con la testa di San Giovanni Battista - 1509 d.C.Artista: 🇮🇹Andrea Solario Luogo:📍#NewYork - #Metropolitan MuseumFoto: 📸@metmuseumTag: 🔑#tesori_italiani Family:👉 @europe_treasures👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @archaeology.treasures✤ ✤ ✤🇮🇹 Salomé con la testa di San Giovanni Battista è un dipinto del pittore milanese Andrea Solario. Del dipinto esistono più versioni, questa al Metropolitan Museum è senz'altro la più bella e fu realizzata per un nobile committente in Francia, dove Solario lavorò intorno al 1507-1509. Realizzata con un'incredibile attenzione per i dettagli, l'artista ha raggiunto un effetto impressionante giocando sul contrasto tra la bellezza e i gioielli intricati di Salomé, e l'orribile vista della testa del Battista tenuta in mano dal braccio del carnefice. Il naturalismo descrittivo dei riflessi e delle superfici è debitore sia a Leonardo Da Vinci, che per decenni lavorò a Milano, sia alla pittura olandese.✤ ✤ ✤🇬🇧 Salome with the Head of Saint John the Baptist  is the finest of several versions of this composition painted by the Milanese artist and may have been painted for a noble patron in France, where Solario worked from about 1507–9. Carried out with incredible attention to detail, the artist achieved a striking effect by contrasting Salome’s idealized beauty and jewels with the horrific view of the Baptist’s head held by the cropped arm of the executioner. The descriptive naturalism of reflections and surface textures is indebted to both Leonardo, who worked for decades in Milan, and Netherlandish painting.✤ ✤ ✤#italia #beniculturali30 #italianpainter #peinture #painter #metropolitanmuseumofart #ig_art #italy #italianart #アート  #renaissance #andreasolario #rinascimento #metropolitanmuseum #usa🇺🇸 #kunst #арт #musee #metmuseum #искусство #volgoarte #museum #museo #فن #艺术 #藝術

name: 2019-08-26 01.02.32 2118366206959351251_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: There was a bus stop outside my apartment. Everyday i took a private bus (cheaper and not as well kept as public) to  Manhattan. I didn’t care who the stranger sat next to me was. I didnt care who saw me or if i looked too upscale for this not so expensive bus. I didnt worry about my uber driver taking a turn down a dark road, or him staring at me with hungry eyes through the rear view mirror. I didnt care that i was walking alone in Times Square at 2am. I didnt care about what i wore. I didnt care what people thought of me. I didnt feel uncomfortable in my own body. I didnt feel like my gender was a free ticket to stare me up and down lane. I didnt feel like a helpless prey open for predators to look at, to undress with their eyes. I felt free. I felt liberated. I felt independent. I felt like there wasn’t anything I couldn’t do on my own. Then i realisedThis is what men feel like all the time..........#fashionblog #pinkblob #formaldresses #themet #priyankachopra #beautyblogger #makeupartist #womenempowerment #womenhelpingwomen #goalsmakeup #fashion #styleinspo #styleblogger #nyc #nycmuseums #metropolitanmuseumofart #liberation
