name: 2019-08-26 01.56.19 2118393272989046618_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ...What does a can of tomato soup have in common with fashion?The answer: an artist’s eye!One needs to be insane to a degree, to have a different prospective in order to be able to create something others never even thought of before.You have the last chance to discover #CAMP at The Costume Institute’s 2019 exhibition, “Camp: Notes on Fashion”, on view through September 8, 2019 at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, NewYork. Camp’s disruptive nature and subversion of modern aesthetic values has often been trivialized, but this exhibition reveals that it has had a profound influence on both high art and popular culture,” said Max Hollein, Director of The Met. “By tracing its evolution and highlighting its defining elements, the show embodies the ironic sensibilities of this audacious style, challenges conventional understandings of beauty and taste, and establishes the critical role that this important genre has played in the history of art and fashion.”🍅🍅🍅“Camp — dandyism in the age of mass culture — makes no distinction between the unique object and the mass-produced object”) as is shown in a Warhol Campbell’s tomato soup print and a minidress made of the same pattern.🍅🍅🍅You don’t have to fully understand camp to enjoy the show, but it’s worth trying.#fashion #art #gallery #gucci #campnotesonfashion #notesonfashion #collection  #design #artist #inspiration #creation #visual #newyork#metropolitanmuseumofart #andywarholart #andywarhol #popart #campbellssoup #canoftomatosoup #dress #exhibition #provocation #bespoke #clothing

text: Still Life with Peaches, by Auguste Renoir, 1881 at the #met . When I was a child, I actually rather disliked Renoir because his paintings always seemed “too sweet” to me. But after I saw the way he painted still life, I understood that his incredible ability of handling fragile fruit so gently applies to his drawing of humans too... Drawing them as soft, fragile things, just like peaches. Now Renoir is one of my favorite artists 🍑 #metropolitan #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #renoir #pierreaugusterenoir #peaches #soft #museum #impressionism #art #newyork #ソフト#ルノワール #メトロポリタン美術館 #美術館 #印象派 #桃 #импрессионизм #ренуар #музей #искусство #нежность #нежно #персик #אמנות #מוזיאון

name: 2019-08-26 06.17.05 2118524527188410007_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Romance and passion 💖 sizzle in the summer, 🌞 , 夏 ”natsu”, été, tābistān (Persian:‎ تابستان)‼️ The season of love 😍 , growth ⤴️, joy 😄, vitality ⚡️, fullness 🈵, youthfulness 🔥, and the main period of vegetation 🌱 growth.  Life is an open book 📖 and adventures abound.  A season of vacation, holidays ㊗️, and when children 👶 are out of school 🏫. Characterized by noisy 🔊 and annoying insects 🐜 and with the blistering sun ☀️ 🌡 providing warmth.  In literature 📚 , summer often coincides with the prime of a protagonist’s life, overcoming challenges to build character, and an occasional ritual death 💀. Shakespeare equated summer with beauty 👧🏼 and youth.  Fertility, love, and ambiguous sexuality are major themes in his play “Midsummer Night’s Dream”. Mendelssohn, who composed the music for the play, made extensive use of violins 🎻 and symphonic bombasts 💣 .  The composer’s famous recessional “Wedding March” 👰 served as incidental music 🎶 for this play. “If summer had one defining scent 👃 , it’d definitely be the smell of barbecue.” -Katie Lee

name: 2019-08-26 07.11.58 2118552145692112129_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Egyptian, 1st dynasty, Young Lion,  quartz, c 3100 - 2900 BC, coll Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. Despite its small size (9 3/16 x 4 3/4 x 4 15/16 in) and its extreme simplification of form, it manages to powerfully convey its lion-ness. It is said to be from Gebelein in southern upper Egypt. It is very early indeed;  it comes from the time when Egyptians were just learning to carve in hard stone. The luster and sparkle of the quartz are richly appealing.#egyptian #egyptiansculpture #quartz #1stdynasty #animal #lion #lioncub #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-26 09.00.19 2118606685670422556_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: We are lovers, curators, and educators of sneakers, fashion, art, and culture. Every week we feature a staff pick of something we love outside of our normal stream of commerce.⁣⁠⠀⁠⠀Several RuleofNext Team Members were onsite the Grand Opening of the District Art Gallery-”a sophisticated, modern environment (that) provides art enthusiasts, established and new collectors, decorators and browsers with an unrivaled visual art experience." (district-gallery) An evening to remember, hundreds gathered in celebration to the Van Aken District's new addition to the community, and were delightfully welcomed with food, music, drink and a sleek, modernistic atmosphere pleasantly housed within high ceilings snd elegantly textured floors. ⁠⠀⁠⠀The District Art Gallery is home to both national and international art exhibits, and represents emerging, established and mid-career level artists- in addition to providing consultation, installation, framing and art curation services. Fostering relationships between art dealers and buyer, engaging through the local community through partnership opportunities and education, are among the initiatives the District Art Gallery has sought out to accomplish. Committed to bringing world renown art and artists with providing opportunities for emerging artists, the District Art Gallery brings hope, culture and possibility to the community for what we hope to be, for a very long time,⁠⠀⁠⠀For more information on art and other inquiries, visit: ⁠⠀⁠⠀https://district-gallery.com⁠⠀⁠⠀@districtgalleryart ⁠⠀⁠⠀We hope you are having a great weekend!⁠⠀⁠⠀Rule of Next Staff⁠⠀⁠⠀

text: I've not posted in awhile, so here are a few pics from my visit to the Met (@metmuseum) earlier this summer. The Roof Garden is one of the best views in the city, not only for the skyline, but the Roof Garden Commission. Currently on exhibit is Alicja Kwade's ParaPivot (@alicjakwade). I think the ideas of science, time, and space that it evokes work wonderfully with the rooftop location and NYC as the backdrop. The fact that you can enjoy a glass of bubbles while viewing is an added bonus! Check it out through October 27!.....#museums #museum #art #artmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #alicjakwade #cantorroof #exhibition #exhibit #rooftop #summer #nyc #NewYorkCity #NewYork #sculpture #steel #stone #femaleartist #parapivot #skyline

name: 2019-08-26 10.00.22 2118636903019397679_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: FINALLY posting this one even though I've finished the book well over two weeks ago and took this first picture on my birthday nearly a month ago. 1984 is simply stated my favorite novel, and no words seemed right to convey the whole background story SO I'll try and keep this succinct!First off, a massive thank you to @coffeeandaclassic for still having 1984 boxes available in your Etsy shop!! The beanie and pint glass are amazing 😍👌 !! The whole box was beautifully organized and I could not be happier with it. Second, the #criterion release of 1984 is stupendous and well worth viewing and buying. @eric___charles and team did a masterful job restoring it to its totalitarian glory!Third, yes I did get a 1984 tattoo on my foot. Done wonderfully by @christianmasot!  Highly recommend him if you are looking to get work done in the Jersey City area. Sorry the pic is crappy but it is still healing.Finally, the actual book pic was taken at #metropolitanmuseumofart on my birthday. May seem an odd place to read, but they have all these cool places that are perfect for relaxing and taking in the art work. Plus, it was weirdly fitting to read about a government that destroys the past when you are in a place that is all about the past. If you haven't read this one, I cannot recommend or nag you enough to. This is one of those books that is terrifyingly relevant. Thanks for reading my ramble if you got this far!! #igreads #orwell #1984 #booktattoo #bookphotography #coffeandclassics #bookworm #booksofinstagram

I highly recommend it if you see it out in the wild! #thriftstore #thriftshop #cats #thriftstorefinds #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-26 20.02.47 2118940117645613127_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Russian-born American artist, Raphael Soyer, was 33 years old when he had his first solo exhibition at the Valentine Gallery.  The show, which opened in February 1933, featured a collection of recent paintings and may have included this 1932 work titled "The Artist's Parents." Soyer is known to have been influenced by the artwork he saw at the Valentine Gallery -- Valentine Dudensing allowed his artists to study the paintings in his gallery's inventory -- and Soyer's painting references both Degas and Matisse.  This painting is in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

name: 2019-08-26 20.32.44 2118955186982190460_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: C’est déjà la rentrée 💼💼 !!Pour la dernière fois de l’#été, l’équipe Luxurytail vous conseille une exposition. A l’honneur cette semaine : l’exposition « Camp, notes on fashion » qui se tient au Métropolitan Museum of Art (#MET). Inspirée d’un essai de Susan Sontag, cette #exposition retrace le parcours de l’expression « se camper », de la Cour de Versailles jusqu’à nos jours ☀️🎀 #met #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #metny #metnewyork #ny #newyork #camp #notesoffashion #costumeinstitute #heritage #fashion #Paris #backtoschool

name: 2019-08-26 20.36.31 2118957094971873964_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: #10: Een aantal dagen door New York struinen, kilometers lopen, fietsen door Central Park, met de boot naar Liberty Island, stilstaan bij het monument van Ground Zero, kijken naar de kunst bij het MET, vanaf de 86e verdieping van de Empire State Building een rooftop bar zien om vervolgens daar heen te gaan, bij een Broadway musical heel hard gelachen en op Time Square rond gewandeld, New York heeft ons verrast! Het was een avontuur, super bijzonder, nu weer richting Amsterdam, tot gauw🌺!! #Adventure #newyork #libertyisland #statueofliberty #empirestatebuilding #nationalseptemberelevenmemorial #timesquare #broadway #broadwaymusical #centralpark #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #cityscape #cityphotography #buildingphotography #artphotography

name: 2019-08-26 20.37.24 2118957534451461194_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The MET was massive, impressive, comprehensive. I didn’t even get through half of it. Can’t show you everything I saw there, but I’m sharing a few samplings to give you an idea of the variety of collections to see. I did see #CAMP though, which was a very educational installation on the history and evolution of the word “camp” and how it applies to fashion and expression in our culture. 🤓🙂 #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkcity #manhattan #nyc #missprissinnewyork2019

name: 2019-08-27 00.38.00 2119078634921131613_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: August 26, 2019 - Metropolitan Museum of Art.The Ascent to Heaven.In the summer of 1985 I went to Antwerp where I was overwhelmed by the work of Hieronymus Bosch - I bought a post card of his Ascent to Heaven (and many others) and I taped them all over my walls in my freshman dorm room -  my idea was to present a mini-museum for my guests and it looked great - 50 or so postcards of the great masters on my wall - when other kids had 1...maybe 2 posters on their wall...I had 50 - the idea was good...one problem...I didn't take into account that no one in their right mind was willing to come into my dorm room and see my "musée". This is looking south from the north fountain with the steps to the Met and 432 Park avenue in the distance.Time 11am.#mackysnewyork #ny1pic #432park #themet #ascenttoheaven #hieronymusbosch #freshmandorm #streetphotography #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: Focusing on Africa and the Pacific Islands at the Met today.  We've been going bit by bit and doing little sections at a time.  Today for Greg's time off we are focusing on an area we haven't been to and I'm finding it really interesting.  Bird masks that may have been an influence on Beetlejuice, Oracles that look like like something from a horror movie and two faced devil women that are ritual objects for an altar. #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #artsofafrica #artsofoceania

name: 2019-08-27 06.43.06 2119262398670805957_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Egyptian, Middle Kingdom, 12th Dynasty, c 1961-1828 BC, Hippopotamus (“William”), faience, 7 7/8 x 2 15/16 x 4 7/16 in, coll Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. I’ll wager this is one of the most popular objects in the Met’s collection. When I was there the other day I overheard a Japanese tourist asking a guard where William was; the guard immediately pointed him to this. The nickname was first used in a 1931 Punch (the British humor magazine) and it stuck.  No doubt modern eyes find him adorable but for Egyptians he was a large and dangerous beast. Three of his legs are restored; they were probably intentionally broken when he was placed in the tomb (presumably that of steward Senbi) so that he would not be able to hurt the deceased. Even knowing that, I find it hard to see William as anything but charming.#egyptiansculpture #faience #hippopotamus #hippopotamuswilliam #metropolitanmuseumofart #middlekingdom #12thdynasty #egyptian

name: 2019-08-27 07.51.46 2119296959213813948_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I'm a museum child. As a kid, i used to roam around the national museum looking for the oddest things, curious about the old world,  always craving to explore. I would stare into the little mysteries hidden beyond a world unknown and left behind but immortalized by art in various forms. In museums my sense of wonder is magnified as if i get to time travel, and this is why i always love museums- i get to be that child again. 🎈........#themet #museum #museumlover #artsy #artlover #metropolitanmuseumofart #ootd #realoutfitgram #polkadotdress #style #cute #dresses #outfitobsessed #outfit #outfitsideas #happyplace #asianbarbie #reddress #pretty #nastygal #art

text: #قصه_هنری 💌🎭#یکی_بود_یکی_نبود هیرودیوس، پادشاه #فلسطین قصد داشت با دختر برادر خود، هیرودیا، #ازدواج کند. حضرت یحیی(ع) یا همان Saint John the baptist سرسختانه مخالف این وصلت #حرام بود و گفت که این ازدواج خلاف دستورات «#تورات» است و من با چنین مواردی مبارزه خواهم کرد.هیرودیوس یحیی را به زندان انداخت. هیرودیوس و هیرودیا با هم ازدواج کردند. هیرودیا (زن) همواره از یحیی(ع) کینه به دل داشت. مدتی گذشت تا اینکه در جشنی، دختر هیرودیا (سالومه) به قدری زیبا رقصید که هیرودیوس پادشاه به وجد امد و به او گفت میتواند هر آرزویی کند تا آن را براورده شده ببیند. دختر به تحریک مادر خود، سر یحیی(ع) را طلبید. سر یحیی(ع) را بریدند و در ظرفی، برای دختر آوردند.به لباس و جواهرات سالومه دقت کنید.تابلوی بسیار زیبا با رنگهایی زنده از هنرمند ایتالیایی و از دنباله رو های #لئوناردو_داوینچی بزرگحس خود را در مورد این تابلو زیبا در کامنتها بیان کنید. 🙋🏻‍♂️🌏🇮🇹🍀🍀🍀🍀 #SaintJohntheBaptist#andreasolarioArtist: #Andrea_Solario (Italian, Milan ca. 1465–1524 Milan)Date: ca. 1507–9Medium: Oil on woodDimensions: 22 1/2 x 18 1/2 in. (57.2 x 47 cm)Classification: PaintingsPlace: #metropolitanmuseumofart @metmuseum#هنر #هنر_نقاشی #تفسیر_میراث #نقاشی #هنر_ایتالیا #رنسانس #فلورانس #داوینچی #هنری #تاریخ_هنر #راهنمای_گردشگری #تورلیدر #راهنمای_سفر #ایمان_روئین_دژی  #travelwithiman

name: 2019-08-27 20.39.47 2119683515701257726_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Тыдыщ!⠀5 лет!⠀5 лет, как я смело называю себя фотографом, да такая профессия существует!🤘🏻⠀Я честно не помню почему, зачем я решила стать фотографом. Зато прекрасно помню, сколько раз я это дело бросала.⠀Мой путь был банальным: купила камеру, начала снимать друзей, потом по немного брать деньги за съемки, затем курсы, свадьбы и группа вконтакте.⠀Что сейчас происходит в моей голове, в моей карьере - вам лучше не знать😹Я и сама не могу ответить на многие вопросы, и не понимаю, как мне начать делать то, что я хочу и закончить то, к чему уже не тянет.⠀Одно могу сказать «инсайт 5-ти летнего, выдержанного, фотографа» - все эти годы я училась только фотографировать🤘🏻 И скажу я вам, научилась😹#rollei35 #rollei35te #nycfilmphotography #filmcamera #filmphotography #film_zaharova #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #nycphotographer #filmisnotdead

name: 2019-08-27 21.22.40 2119705101133033448_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The artist Alicja Kwade’s ParaPivot—a 15-foot-tall illusionistic sculpture installed atop the Metropolitan Museum of Art—” is on view through October 27, 2019. Nine marbled spheres—some of which weigh more than a ton—sit suspended among a series of interlocking steel frames. The spheres give off an uneasy feeling, appearing to be both frozen in a gravity-defying moment, and capable of falling on you at any moment. Like the nine planets they symbolize, the stones each have a different look, composition, and backstory. One is made of azul macaubas sourced from Brazil; another comes from materials found in Norway.“We’re all playing this game,” Kwade said. “Everyday things seem so important. But then you zoom out and realize that you’re standing with another 7 billion [people] on a spinning sphere.” With that perspective, she says, you’re reminded to just be glad you’re here at all.

name: 2019-08-28 02.00.13 2119844787344681137_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Me quedé con tantas ganas de compartirles cosas sobre el arte después del video que hice para @fargstudio ! Asique voy a compartirles un par.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Por un lado, cómo encarar un museo cuando uno viaja, qué puede haber en un museo y cómo saber a donde ir, y además, qué hacer frente a una obra de arte para disfrutarla y empezar a entenderla ! Para esto último, les dejo un par de consejos / comentarios:⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀1. Contexto — intenten entender el contexto en que la obra fue pintada. El contexto es importantísimo, porque nos sitúa en todas las problemáticas del momento en que el artista elige pintar su obra. Nos ayuda a entender qué estaba viviendo el artista, y en relación a esto, por qué su obra terminó siendo importante en la historia del arte.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀2. Técnica y materiales — esta es la parte maravillosa que uno se puede quedar mirando y explorando por un rato largo. Acérquense, vean las pinceladas, los colores, la textura, qué eligió, y junto con el contexto, sitúense en el lugar del artista, tal vez hace 50 o 100 años pintando esta obra que hoy están mirando ustedes. No les parece fascinante?⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Las obras de arte son una combinación de tantas cosas fascinantes (un momento en la historia, una problemática, una cultura, creatividad, lo que quiso transmitir el artista, cómo lo terminó realizando, sus miedos, sus inquietudes y sus pasiones, todo!) y tienen la oportunidad de estar enfrente a ella y contemplarla. Aprovéchenlo !Mañana subo un video contándoles un poco más sobre cómo encarar un Museo !⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀Las fotos son de obras en el @metmuseum y en el @themuseumofmodernart que saqué en mi último viaje a Nueva York !#art  #beauty  #newyork  #metropolitanmuseumofart  #buenosaires  #travel  #modernart

name: 2019-08-28 02.03.08 2119846263202622675_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🌻These last days of summer are slowly becoming cooler, with rain and fresh temperatures. As a season farewell, for august we have "El Baño" (1905) by Joaquim Sorolla. Sorolla was a master of light; he truly captured its ethereal, vivid and golden appearence. For me, summer always brings back memories of childhood, days of sunlight, water, happiness and innocence 🌻💙 @museo_sorolla #sorolla #joaquimsorolla #thelight #masteroflight #luz #goldenlight #summermemories #summerlight #waterreflection #artimitateslife #childhood #summerdays #sunlight #oilpainting #impresionista #ethereal #metropolitanmuseumofart #postimpresionista #bluewaters #mediterranean

text: "my lover found me in the grasses..."48"x43"Oil on marble plastered panel,  polished wax surface and gold leaf2019.www.nathanielgalka.comEmail for availability and inquiries."My work... is recently about the environment and the displacement of plants and animals for the vanity of humans. My focus now is about how we are placing non-indigenous plants in locations and disrupting nature. I highlight our need for conservation of domestic flora and fauna through historical and aesthetic references in my paintings.".📸 @myloveishugeCopyright 2019..#americanartist #photography #chinoiserie #flowers #nathanielgalkaart #nathanielgalka #nycgallery #magicalrealism #kunst #artstudio #art #gaynyc #newyorkartist #nyc #newyorkcity #fineart #interiordesign #painting #losangelesartist #gallery #chelseagalleries#landscape #paintedflowers #instagay #metropolitanmuseumofart #contemporaryartist #instagramartist #dutchmasters #contemporarypainting

name: 2019-08-28 11.05.37 2120119300153380110_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Two Tahitian Women is an 1899 painting by Paul Gauguin. It depicts two topless women, one holding mango blossoms, on the Pacific Island of Tahiti. The painting is part of the permanent collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.Tahiti is depicted as an innocent paradise, the two women in the painting confront the viewer in a way similar to that in Manet, and follow an artistic tradition of comparing woman's breasts to flowers or fruit.#gauguin #paulgaugin #tahiti #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #art #masterpiece #paintings #toples #mango #mangoflower #mangoflowers #paradise #flower #fruts #arte #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitan

name: 2019-08-28 13.14.02 2120183932809816890_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Greek, Pair of Gold Earrings with Dolphins’ Heads,  1 1/2 x 3/8 x 1 3/8 in, 2nd - 1st c BC, coll Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. I am accustomed to seeing Greek earrings of this general form, but perhaps most often with lions’ heads, and generally just of gold . These dolphins’ heads seem unusual to me as does the use of emeralds and glass separated by bands of granulation. Please realize that I speak out of almost total ignorance; all this may be much less rare than I think. I do know that they are extremely striking and decorative. I’d love to wear them. (This is not the first time I’ve posted ancient jewellery I covet.)#greek #hellenistic #earrings #classical #dolphin #granulation #gold #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-08-28 14.25.56 2120220124854435776_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This is a #teeshirt seen at the #metropolitanmuseumofart gift shop in #NYC for the exhibit #Camp followed by two quotes from the not so small mind of #RusselBrand ! (cause I believe that's him on the tee) And I have to say I'm not sure which one I like better. "Its difficult to believe in yourself because the idea of self is an artificial construct. You are in fact part of the glorious oneness of the universe. Everything beautiful in the world is within you." "We all need something to help us unwind at the end of the day. You might have a glass of wine, a joint or a big delicious blob of heroin to silence your silly brain of its witterings but there has to be some form of punctuation or life just seems utterly relentless"

name: 2019-08-28 18.05.42 2120330734161528664_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 📌 El Greco, View of Toledo, 1596–1600, oil on canvas,121.3 cm × 108.6 cm, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City. 🇬🇷~View of Toledo is among the best known depictions of the sky in Western art. In this painting, he takes liberties with the actual layout of Toledo insofar as certain building locations are re-arranged. However, the location of the Castle of San Servando, on the left, is accurately depicted. El Greco's signature appears in the lower-right corner.~Ever seen this painting before?

name: 2019-08-29 02.57.09 2120598225162836834_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This version of Augustus Saint-Gaudens “Diana” is actually only half the size of the 1893 version, which served as a weather vane for the Madison Square Garden tower until 1925. Being the tallest fixture in the New York skyline at the turn of the century, Diana’s nudity caused a sensation and scandal. Numerous attempts by the New York Society for the Suppression of Vice to have the statue torn down or covered by a cloth, which blew away in the wind almost immediately, all ended in vain. Diana remained visible all the way to New Jersey and was the first monument in history to be lit at night by electricity. She was only removed when the tower was demolished. Shrouded in urban myth and legend, many believe New York ‘It Girl’ and silent film actress Evelyn Nesbit to be the model for the original Diana. Nesbit herself would be the obsession of a media frenzy in 1906 when her drug addicted and mentally unstable husband, architect Harry Kendall Thaw, shot socialite Stanford White in the rooftop theatre of Madison Square Garden. Thaw sought retribution of White for having raped Evelyn when she was just 15 years old. Evelyn divorced Thaw in 1915 and died in 1967 at the age of 82. —————— #art #history #sculpture #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkcity #dianaofthetower #augustussaintgaudens #evelynnesbit #murder #silentfilm #scandal #socialhistory #madisonsquaregarden #urbanmyth #legend

name: 2019-08-29 05.39.31 2120679944045253346_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 10 Great Reasons to follow @BlackandBlueChip 1. Kerry James Marshall. Untitled (Studio). 2014. Acrylic on PVC panels. 83 5/16in x 119 1/4in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.2. Deana Lawson. Sons of Cush. 2016. Inkjet print. 42 1/2in x 53 3/4in. The Whitney Museum of American Art, New York (Also apart of the Guggenheim Museum’s collection)..3. Toyin Ojih Odutola. Wall of Ambassadors. 2017. Charcoal, pastel, and pencil on paper. 38 1/2in x 29 7/8in. The Whitney Museum of American Art, New York.4. Dawoud Bey. Harlem, NY. 1978, printed 2010. 14in x 11in. The Art Institute of Chicago.5. Nina Chanel Abney. Forbidden Fruit. 2009. Acrylic on canvas. 67in x 77 1/2 in. The Brooklyn Museum , New York.6. Romare Bearden. Baptism. 1964. Mixed media collage. 10in x 6.5in. Romare Bearden Foundation.7. Betye Saar. House of Tarot. 1966. Etching with relief printing and relief-printed and embossed found objects. 19 15/16in x 27 9/16in. The Museum of Modern Art, New York.8. Jacob Lawrence. Blind Beggars. 1938. Tempera on illustration board. 20 1/8in x 15in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.9. El Anatsui. Between Earth and Heaven. 2006. Aluminum, copper wire. 86 3/4in x 128in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.10. Aaron Douglas. Let My People Go. c. 1935-1939. Oil on masonite. 48in x 36in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.#KerryJamesMarshall #DeanaLawson #ToyinOjihOdutola #DawoudBey #NinaChanelAbney #RomareBearden #BetyeSaar #JacobLawrence #ElAnatsui #AaronDouglas #BlackandBlueChip

text: Had to go CAMPing at least once this summer❣️•••I was so glad I was able to see the #MetCamp exhibit before it closes next week! It was so rewarding learning about the history of camp and viewing all the groundbreaking, boundary-pushing designs featured! text: This exhibit just....blew me away. Like, it was thorough and had bits of everything and I especially loved the way it charted the use and history of the word, as well as its significance to queer culture and how that evolved (especially into low v high camp, sophistication v vulgarity; it's gorgeous and an art form v it's hideous and I love it). Shame I didn't get more pictures.......#metgala2019 #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #artmuseum #museumexhibition #museumdisplay #museum #camp #queerculture #pride #gayculture

name: 2019-08-29 15.14.26 2120969308866770632_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Just wanted to share something I've learned recently from @askvinhHave you ever faced a problem that you could not solve? But when you stood back or looked at it from a different angle, you were able to see it differently and was able to create a solution. Perhaps you were able to get input from the right person and they were able to help you find the solution.Why couldn't you solve the problem the first time? It's because you have fallen victim to silo mentality, "looking at the problem through one perspective". So what did you do to find the solution? You looked at the problem through a different perspective or was able to get someone else's perspectiveMy friends, Perspective is Power. When you are faced with a problem or adversity sometimes all you have to do is look at it from a different perspective or find the right people and get their perspective and you might just find the solution.....#perspective #convention #problemsolving#collaboration #nyc #metropolitanmuseumofart#art #shareknowledge #tourist #paintings #entrepreneurminds #ifyournotgrowingyourdying

name: 2019-08-29 16.23.58 2121004308783670530_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Marseille-My Fav Snap-The Met NYC Part 2 of 2⚔️🎶 🖼 🛐🖤☮️🌚🏛🎨🦉🌹🎶⚔️The Arts do spark your memories Mary..Philippe to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the death of Leonardo da Vinci,  The Met presents the artist’s painting Saint Jerome Praying in the Wilderness,  begun around 1483,  on special loan from the Vatican Museum..The exquisitely rendered work represents Jerome (A.D. 347–420), a major saint and theologian of the Church.. The scene is based on the story of his later life, which he spent as a hermit in the desert..The unfinished painting provides an extraordinary glimpse into Leonardo's creative process, and the paint surface reveals the presence of da Vinci’s fingerprints❣️I hope I can get snaps of his fingerprints! Mary, it may bring back the 5% of your lost memories..#leonardodavinci #davinci #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #myfav #explore #travel #artphoto #artphotography #adventure #museum #wanderlust #wander #travelphotography #exhibit #vaticanmuseum #louiscomforttiffany #art #artist #artphotography #artphoto #saintjérômepraying #saintjeromeprayinginthewilderness #saint #catholicchurch #vaticanart #stjerome

text: Now at the @metmuseum: “Death Is Elsewhere” (2019), a seven-channel video installation by the acclaimed Icelandic artist Ragnar Kjartansson. Provocatively rethinking the possibilities for performance and video art, Kjartansson makes work in which he simultaneously evokes Romantic clichés while using irony, nihilism, and absurdity to undermine them.Ragnar Kjartansson, Death is Elsewhere (2019). ©Ragnar Kjartansson. text: ▪️#themetropolitanmuseumofart예술 점수 0점으로 작품들을 다 이해할수는 없지만,짧은 가이드 강의 덕에작품관람이 더 풍성해졌다💕(고마워요 가이드님).나는 미알못이지만가끔 전시회를 가곤한다.많이 알지는 못하지만,모르는 재미로 가서 취향 저격하는 작품들을 만나는 재미.메트에서는 어마무시하게 유명한 작품들이 많은데,정말 인터넷에서 보는 것과실제로 보는 것의 확연한 차이가느껴졌다. 박물관은 어렵지만 미술관은도전할만 한곳이다💕@theyumee.☑️메트로폴리탄입장권할인은#빅애플패스 강추강추☑️미리 작품공부를 한다면#방구석미술관 책을 추천☑️출구에서 당일날짜가 적힌입장권을 붙이는 묘미💕☑️마지막으로 메트는 사람이 어마무시하게 많다..#메트로폴리탄뮤지엄 #메트로폴리탄뮤지엄후기#빅애플패스후기#metropolitan#metropolitanmuseumofart#nyc #newyork #manhattan#뉴욕여행 #뉴욕여행추천#여행에미치다_뉴욕#유디니_미국 #유디니_뉴욕

name: 2019-08-29 20.32.11 2121129237822582513_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Samuel Fosso. Self Portrait. 1976. Gelatin silver print. 20in x 20in. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York (Also apart of the Studio Museum in Harlem’s collection). ---“On our street, there was a studio photographer who I began to spend time with. I asked him to teach me photography. I spent five months as an apprentice, after which I wanted to have my own studio. The problem was making prints without wasting too much paper because, as my uncle said, “You don’t do business for loss, you do business for gain.” But I found out that the owner didn’t want me to leave because he had stopped losing money when I started working in his studio. After learning that, my uncle told me to find a space for my own studio and he bought me an enlarger.” -- Samuel Fosso. (Credit: Aperture)#SamuelFosso #BlackandBlueChip

text: 逛博物館，除了看展出的藝術品，也喜歡看人。喜歡看那些認真作畫或是觀看展品的人們所流露出的專注神情，眼神裡有星星的那種。喜歡看到面對事情會發亮的眼睛，那是會感染人的光度，讓人覺得世界真好。（最近咳嗽咳到厭世，需要一些覺得世界美好的自我激勵😂）-期望自己也能眼睛裡有星星地面對所有自己喜歡甚至不喜歡的一切。（emoji 示意圖：🤩）-而照片裡男子的腳趾和雕塑的腳趾指向同一個遠方。Their toes are pointing toward the same direction. Who are they? The guy and the sculpture.·····#tbt #throwbackthursday #throwback #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #nyc #manhattan #art #sketch #peoplewatching #shotoniphone #exhibition #hangoutwithEliseinNY #EliseinNewYork

name: 2019-08-29 23.15.41 2121211530721509703_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 意思思來幾張這兩天的照片是說美國夜晚仍舊太精彩天天都只有3-4小時能睡也根本沒剩時間能修修圖😂就趁早餐時光IG出圖囉-跑了大都會博物館走馬看花雖然展品也夠豐富但有些太雜亂個人還是偏好羅孚或大英-再來就是往布魯克林區晃晃一次看兩座經典大橋「布魯克林大橋」、「曼哈頓大橋」在橋上走很文青很美但就人太多是說一直讓我聯想到潛龍諜影2史尼克一開始跳下橋那幕🤔-再者搭船去自由島看女神朝聖一種頗熟悉的感覺原來是來到了台場喔😂-而朝聖之旅怎能少了大蘋果裡的第五大道的蘋果呢😉另外華爾街證券交易所當然也是必踩的點而自己則覺得911紀念博物館也很棒雖然已事過好一陣子了但再看到當時相關影片、照片及文獻也真的讓人覺得很震撼跟悲痛-#大都會博物館 #metropolitanmuseumofart #ladym #布魯克林大橋 #曼哈頓大橋 #brooklyn #brooklyndumbo #brooklynbridge #manhattanbridge #applestorenewyork #自由女神 #statueofliberty #libertyenlighteningtheworld #華爾街 #wallstreet #newyorkstockexchange #911memorialmuseum #worldtradecenter

text: Безцінні книги музею Метрополітен, частина 4Частини 1-3 шукайте за хештегом #pricelessmetbooksPriceless books of The Metropolitan Museum of Art, part 4Find part 1-3 follow #pricelessmetbooks1️⃣Аркуш з Коментаря до Апокаліпсису святого Іоанна. Іспанія, Кастилія-Леон, з монастиря бенедиктинців Сан-Педро-де-Карденья, Бургос, близько 1180 р.Leaf from a Beatus Manuscript: Christ in Majesty with Angels and the Angel of God Directs Saint John to Write the Book of Revelation. Spanish, from the Benedictine monist very of San Pedro de Cardena, Burgos, ca. 11802️⃣Молитовник, зроблений близько 1294 року, Австрія або Франконія. Дошка з Христом та чотирма євангелістами, 11 століття. Ця табличка, ймовірно, була прикріплена до обкладинки Оттонської книги Євангелія, тепер прикрашає обкладинку євангельського лекціонера кінця XV століття.Prayer book, made about 1294, Austrian or Franconian.Plaque with Christ in Majesty and the Four Evangelists, 11th century. This plaque, which probably was affixed to the cover of an Ottonian Gospel book, now decorates the cover of a late fifteenth-century Gospel lectionary.3️⃣Буклет зі сценами Страстей Христових,північнофранцузьке різьбленнябл. 1300 р., живопис - Верхній Рейн, приблизно 1310–20 рр.Booklet with Scenes of the Passion, ca. 1300 (North French carving); ca. 1310–20 (Upper Rhenish painting) 4️⃣Лекціонарій Захаріса Візантійського, Візантія, близько 1100 р. Візантійський календар у цьому лекціонарії та якість твору свідчать про те, що рукопис був зроблений для Собору Святої Софії в Константинополі.Jaharis Byzantine Lectionary,ca. 1100Byzantine The calendar in this lectionary and the quality of the entire work suggest that the manuscript was made for the great church of Hagia Sophia in Constantinople.5️⃣Євангеліє, блиько 825-50 рр., династія КаролінгівGospel Book,ca. 825–50, CarolingianДалі👇#metropolitanmuseumofart #oldbooks #manuscripts #gospelbook #ottonian #art #armenianmanuscripts #psalter #coptic #byzantine

name: 2019-08-30 00.52.16 2121260141780429391_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I came across this beauty of a book while working on the suggested reading list for Snapshots of Early Modern History and had to buy it immediately! There are a lot of really great art history books for kids, but most of them stay quite surface level. What I particularly love about this book is the way it digs in deeper and introduces art criticism. It spends several pages on each painting it examines and includes multiple close up shots to really bring out the details of the painting. “What Makes a Rembrandt a Rembrandt?” is part of a series from the Metropolitan Museum of Art that also includes books on da Vinci, Raphael, Monet, Degas, Van Gogh, and Picasso.

name: 2019-08-30 05.38.22 2121404139628294432_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: SOLD - From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler, E.L. Konigsburg - middle grade fiction - paperback, very good condition - $2.Claudia carefully plans to run away ... to the Metropolitan Museum of Art! She and her brother are remarkably successful at moving in to the museum. Then she gets swept up into a puzzle involving a beautiful statue and a mysterious figure called Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler..I didn’t read this one as a child, but I wish I had! It’s so funny and smart. And yes, the premise is just a little out there, but that just makes it more fun to imagine: what if you could run away to live in a museum? Anything could happen!.Please reference the Shop Policies in my Highlights for buying guidelines..#betweenworldsbooks #usedbooks #books #bookstagram #independentbookseller #shoplocal #lynchburgva #shopused#fromthemixedupfilesofmrsbasilefrankweiler #elkonigsburg #mixedupfiles #basilefrankweiler #longtitle #middlegrade #fiction #mystery #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #awardwinner #newberymedal#bwbsold

text: Just spent four hours exploring and studying the extraordinarily wonderful decorative art collections in The Met and was just about to leave when I discovered this gem of an exhibition. It displays some of the most iconic guitars in Rock & Roll history including two of my all time favourites, Eric Clapton’s Stratocaster ‘Blackie’ and Jimmy Page’s Les Paul Standard ‘Number One’ wasn’t expecting that at the Met but it certainly made my day! #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #iconic #fenderstratocaster #ericclapton #lespaulstandard #jimmypage #guitarheros #themet #rocknroll

It is sponsored by Gucci and shows a few wonderfully extravagant Gucci pieces like the accessories in the second picture. However, the Gucci Art Wall we came across in SoHo and which advertises a new collection seemed no less camp to me than what was exhibited at the museum. name: 2019-08-30 20.01.49 2121838736061726053_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Take a closer look at the magnificent gilt gesso decoration on an extraordinary George I gilt gesso card table designed in the manner of James Moore.  Gilt gesso card tables are incredibly rare, and only four known examples are known to survive today.  One of the tables is in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York - the table is said to have come from the collections of the Earls of Carnarvon at Highclere Castle, Berkshire.  The table was one of the few gilded pieces acquired by the esteemed English furniture collector Irwin Untermyer before he bequest his collection to the museum.  The pair to this table is in a private collection in the UK.  A fourth example was previously in the collection of Winston Guest and sold at Sotheby’s in 1967.  #masterpiece #antiques #metropolitanmuseumofart #highclerecastle #artcollector #antiques #18thcentury #jamesmoore #royalcollection #gilding #flowers #sothebys #houseandgarden #howtospendit #theworldofinteriors #happyfriday #decorativearts #nationaltrust #englishheritage #museums

text: My first trip many moons ago to the @metmuseum I couldn’t believe my eyes when I saw The Temple of Dendur. What an amazing gift from Egypt.....I have always been fascinated by Egypt and my stomach dropped when I received my DNA results and saw Northern Africa. I believe the obsession started around 2nd grade and grew from there, @danmouradian and I even visiting @fieldmuseum on one of our first dates to view the Egyptian exhibit they had at the time (2006). I left with a beautiful little replica mirror that I cherish all these years later......One day Egypt.....one day...............#barbaramtravels #travel #travelgram #seetheworld #newyork #nyc #bigapple #travelguide #travelholic #wanderlust #traveler #iamtraveler #newyorkcity #instatravel #manhattan #travelphotography #traveladdict #traveltheworld  #explorer #traveler #travelbug #travelislife #wonderfulplaces #iamatraveler #met #metropolitanmuseumofart @metmuseum #metmoment #egypt #egyptian #egyptianart#templeofdendur

name: 2019-08-30 22.29.15 2121912940463702778_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Dünyanın en büyük ve en önemli müzelerinden bir tanesi Metropolitan Sanat Müzesi. Müzede eski doğu, Mısır, Yunan ve Roma dönemlerine ait eserler var. Avrupa’da pek çok müze gezmeme rağmen buranın beni etkilediğini söylemem gerek. Özellikle Asya ve Mısır bölümünde tapınakların olması, eserlerin sunumları çok ilgi çekiciydi. Müze gezmeyi sever misiniz bilmiyorum ama eğer sevmediğinizi düşünüyorsanız bence henüz ilginizi çekeni bulamadığınız içindir, sonra müzesiz yapamaz hale geleceksiniz 🤓 Ben kültürleri tanımayı, ünlü tabloları yakından görebilmeyi, eski yaşamı keşfetmeyi çok seviyorum 💜

name: 2019-08-30 23.10.48 2121933842935035404_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A Matter of Perspective: I visited New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art in August of 2009, and was taken by the sight of a solitary, nattily attired artist sketching a marble statue in the Museum’s American Wing. I snapped a few photos over his shoulder, and when I turned around I was startled to see growing crowd of onlookers gathered around him. The crowd maintained a respectful silence as the oblivious artist continued to sketch. #perspective #pointofview #pov #artist #art #sketch #sketching #americanwing #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #mof #drawing #newyork #nyc #ny #sculpture #statue

name: 2019-08-31 02.49.40 2122044008721971508_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Bernard Van Orley likely painted this depiction of the Virgin and Child with Angels around 1518, when he was appointed as the court painter to Margaret of Austria, regent of the Netherlands. The intricate fountain and the architectural details contain Italian decorative motifs, showing the influence of the Italian Renaissance upon Netherlandish art of the early 16th century. The houses and landscape depicted in the background also testify to the growing influence of landscape painting.

name: 2019-08-31 03.13.25 2122055959802486360_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Happy birthday to Jacques Louis David, born on this day in 1748! This sheet is an early exploration of the subject that Jacques Louis David would later treat in his 1787 painting, The Death of Socrates, which entered the Met’s collection in 1931. The composition features the ancient Greek philosopher Socrates in his prison cell, surrounded by disciples. Sentenced to death by the Athenian courts for his unorthodox beliefs, he prepares to drink from a cup of hemlock. His gesture heavenward indicates that he has paused to expound upon his theory of the immortality of the human soul.⠀⠀Jacques Louis David (French, 1748–1825), The Death of Socrates, ca. 1782, pen and black ink, with brush and gray wash over black chalk, with light squaring in black chalk [2013.59]⠀⠀#metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #jacqueslouisdavid #socrates #deathofsocrates #penandink #drawing

name: 2019-08-31 07.01.42 2122170865411301612_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Merced River, Yosemite Valley by Albert Bierstadt, 1866. Albert Bierstadt, my favourite landscape painter, was born in Germany in 1830. His family moved to the US when he was one year old. When he was 21, he began to paint in oils, and two years later, he moved back to Germany to study and paint Alpine landscapes. When he was 27, he returned to the US and travelled through the American West taking photographs and making sketches of the mountain ranges which he later painted in his New York studio. His paintings were sold at record prices making him extremely successful financially, but later decreased in popularity in the wake of impressionism. When he was 37, he moved to the Bahamas where he painted the tropics, but continued to travel to the West and Canada to paint his beloved Rocky Mountains. He died when he was 72, having completed possibly around 4,000 paintings.

name: 2019-08-31 10.01.37 2122261415512150804_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: .Jungulf Mott.Viking Age sword (variant & original), 2019Pen & ink, charcoal, and pencil on paper..SwordSteel, copper, silver, nielloWeight, 2 lbs. 4 oz. (1021 g)European, probably Scandinavian, 10th century.The richly decorated hilt and pattern-welded blade indicate that this sword was carried by a warrior of high rank, perhaps a Viking chieftain or Frankish nobleman. The braided copper wires on the pommel may represent an earlier Scandinavian custom of tying a protective talisman to a sword hilt. The pattern-welded blade was forged of intertwined rods of steel and iron, a technique that produced a tough yet resilient blade with a distinctive swirling pattern on its surface. Such blades were treasured for both their practical and decorative qualities..(Met accession number 55.46.1)The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City, United States. @metmuseum.....#jungulfmott #jmott #art #artist #illustration #illustrator #minneapolis #mpls #newyork #newyorkcity #nyc #empirestate #manhattan #uppereastside #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #archaeology #artefactillustration #artifactillustration #technicaldrawing #vikingsword #carolingiansword #artmuseum #viking #vikings #vikingage #frankish #francia #carolingian

name: 2019-08-31 15.04.30 2122413858019369226_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Statuette of AmunThe god Amun (“the hidden one”) first came into prominence at the beginning of the Middle Kingdom. From the New Kingdom onward, Amun was arguably the most important god in the Egyptian pantheon. As a creator god, Amun is most often identified as Amun-Re (in the typical Egyptian blending of deities, Amun is combined with the main solar deity, Re). Made of solid gold. Third Intermediate Period, 22nd Dynasty, ca. 945-712 BC. Now in the Metropolitan Museum of Art. 26.7.1412#amon #amun #statue #sculpture #golden #kemet #egypt #ancientegypt #ancientart #ancientkemet #thehidden #metropolitanmuseumofart #stolenmonements #neter

text: Wishing everyone a safe and relaxing Labor Day Weekend! Wayne Art Center will reopen Tuesday, September 3.In honor of the long history of art dedicated to the American workforce, we share “The Furniture Factory,” by artist Bumpei Usui. Usui painted this work of oil on canvas following his immigration to New York from Japan when he integrated into the American labor market as a frame maker. Outstanding!#metropolitanmuseumofart #laborday2019 #laborart #bumpeiusui #oiloncanvas #painting #respect

text: As a member of the Op Art movement of the mid-1960s, Bridget Riley experimented with repetitive colorful patterns to create illusions of movement.•Riley created the study for “Elysium (Acrylic on canvas, 1973-2003) in the 70s, but personal circumstances prevented her from realizing the work until four decades later.•Swipe to see the 1973 study exploring the interplay of red, blue, and green alternating with white.

name: 2019-08-31 21.59.24 2122622690587263737_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Repose,1895John White AlexanderIn this painting, the provocative facial expression and supple curves reflect the contemporary French taste for sensual images of women as well as the undulating linear rhythms of Art Nouveau. With its model decoratively attired in a sweep of white fabric, "Repose" was lampooned in a French magazine as a portrayal of Loïe Fuller (1862–1928), the American dancer famous for manipulating swirling folds of silk in her performances at the Folies Bergère in Paris..Parece ser un retrato de Loie Fuller,  bailarina, actriz, productora y escritora estadounidense que adquirió una gran fama al concentrarse en los efectos visuales utilizando tejidos que flotaban y luces multicolores y siendo reconocida por los científicos franceses por sus teorías sobre la iluminación artística..#gorinart #oilmasters #art #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #newyork

name: 2019-08-31 23.14.30 2122660482146758725_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Good Morning Team! I wish you the greatest day of your lives because no one, not even ourselves can deny the infinite possibilities of the day. I hope you find peace, love and light as intuition guides you. Everyday you push onward towards your greatest self and you're doing a marvelous job. Today we are at the Museum of Natural History till 530. At 6 we will be in Greco Roman section at the Met till late. Today is a day of new friends, growth and inspiration in the beauty of all that is unpredictable. Power to you all and to the mission of art. 😌🙏..Featured: @kylekhansketches developing his 5 hour graphite study of "Memory" in the American Wing. Kyle is taking part in a group show tonight titled "Kink" at 1131 Broadway Booklyn, NY 11221 from 7 to 10. I highly recommend checking out his master work!..#AOTM #artistsofthemet #metsketch #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #metmuseum #artists #artcollective #art #graphitedrawing #AOTMatAMONH #memory #americanwing #power #unpredictablebeauty #infinite #artfamily #missionofart

name: 2019-09-01 07.04.31 2122897056671273754_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Egyptian, Fayum Entrance Area, Necklace of Sithathoryunet with the Name of Senwosret Il, Middle Kingdom, Dynasty 12, c 1887-1878 BC, coll of Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. The pectoral (1 3/4 x 3 1/4 in) is composed of gold,  carnelian, lapis lazuli, turquoise, and garnet, and the necklace (32 5/16 in long)of gold, carnelian, lapis lazuli, turquoise, and green feldspar. Swipe for photo of back which is as finely finished as the front. The cloisonné pectoral is inlaid with 372 pieces of semi-precious stones. This is not just bling (though it is utterly gorgeous adornment). It is laden with symbolism far too complicated for me to list here; do go to the Met’s website for a full accounting. Just as an example, let me quote: “zigzag lines on the base bar represent the primordial waters out of which the primeval hill emerged.” Works like this inspired Art Deco jewellery of the 1920s; some of the most stunning examples are by Cartier and the fashion was fueled by the 1922 discovery of King Tutankhamun’s tomb.#egyptian #jewellery #sithathoryunet #middlekingdom #dynasty12 #artdeco #cartier #metropolitanmuseumofart #tutankhamun

text: Robert Smithson (1938-1973), Mirrored Ziggurat, mirrors, 11 x 25 1/2 x 25 1/2 in, 1966, coll Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY, in Home is a Foreign Place:  Recent Acquisitions in Context at the Met  Breuer. This is a spellbinding object, ill-served by my pedestrian photos. It shimmers, reflects, mutates as one moves around it; perhaps my third image (swipe) best captures its magic. The Met’s notes say it was inspired by Aztec architecture. This is an ancient form; I myself was reminded of the pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara. #robertsmithson #landartist #ziggurat #aztecarchitecture #pyramidofdjoser #metropolitanmuseumofart #metbreuer #mirrors

name: 2019-09-01 23.30.53 2123393509600721116_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: We can make an effort to be inspired or sometimes inspiration weaves itself into our lives in either active or passive ways...but is still a breath of fresh air. We are all inspired by the great master paintings. I had the privilege to see “Study of a Young Woman” by Johannes Vermeer at the MET a few weeks ago. However what we don’t see is the collection of paintings that went in to make the masterpiece we see. That collection may not have been worth showing, but that is not to say that it did not in any way or form contribute towards the making of the piece. The ingredients to the inspiration may be just as vital as the painting itself.

name: 2019-09-02 02.21.37 2123479443876836482_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Last month (14 August) I posted about The Holburne Museum’s show Édouard Vuillard - The Poetry of the Everyday.  Another prominent member of the group of Parisian painters known as Les Nabis was Félix Vallotton (1865-1925), subject of an exhibition at the Royal Academy, London: Félix Vallotton Painter of Disquiet.  It continues to 25 September at the RA and will be at the Met, New York from 29 October to 26 January 2020.Many of the pictures were familiar from 2013’s Félix Vallotton Le Feu sous la glace (The Fire under the Ice) at the Grand Palais in Paris, although that show probably benefited from fewer of Vallotton’s nudes and more of his landscapes (next post). His ability as a painter is clear from still lifes like:Le service à café (The Coffee Service, 1887)Poivrons rouges (Red Peppers), 1915and his portraits:Gertrude Stein, 1907Les Cinq Peintres (The Five Painters), 1902-3 - the Nabis: Vuillard 2nd from the left, Vallotton on the right.His woodcuts of contemporary Paris are in the tradition of Daumier:Le Bon Marché, 1893La Manifestation (The Demonstration), and La Charge, both also 1893 and showing that some things change little.  #felixvallotton #felixvallotonpainterofdisquiet #royalacademyofarts #royalacademy #nabi #lesnabis #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-02 08.17.16 2123658444281373086_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Went to the @metmuseum again today. Second time in a month. Wanted to take my gf. ..The first picture is from an exhibit they had where they had a bunch of guitars on display from famous musicians/ Hendrix’s, prince, Metallica- you get the jist but this fucking ICEBERG and mindfuck of an object ( I saw it from the next room and was like what in god name is that because it had a whole corner to its self) is actually a PIANO that Lady Gaga played!..Then I saw some Van Gough and a beautiful pointillism piece and I haven’t seen any other pointillism besides Serurat so that was cool and this piece was STUNNING because the dots were so far spread a p a r t making it so visually appealing and kind boggling to think how painstaking it was to create that image. ..#Art #MetMuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #NYC #Artist #vangogh #Painting #Oilpainting #ClassicalArt #History #Music #LadyGaga #Piano #Beauty #Museum

name: 2019-09-02 09.50.17 2123705262008098594_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: David Roentgen (1743-1807), Rolltop Desk, c 1776-79, 53 1/2 x 43 1/2 x 26 1/2 in, coll Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. Like several of France’s leading cabinet makers, Roentgen was German; he met great favor in ancien regime France and was appointed ebeniste-mechanicien by Marie Antoinette. The first owner of this extraordinary desk is not known but was presumably French; it was in French collections until the end of the 19th century.This tour de force is composed of many kinds of wood (among them maple, burl woods, and mahogany), mother-of-pearl, gilded and tooled leather, bronze, steel and brass; swipe to see one of the marquetry panels. Roentgen was obviously proud of this creation, for his  initials appear loud and clear right above the kneehole drawer. Roentgen was known for his mechanical ingenuity and this desk is a wonderful example; it has all kinds of moving parts and secret drawers. The Met has cleverly posted a video (swipe) next to it, showing how it all works - irresistible.#davidroentgen #cabinetmaker #ebeniste #ancienrégime #france #marieantoinette #metropolitanmuseumofart #rolltopdesk

text: Funny story • True storyWhen @danmouradian and I met many things happened that left us both feeling a little stumped. On one of our first dates he mentioned that he collected old locks 🔒 I laughed because I collected old keys 🗝 Today we both have tattoos that signify one another and that funny date. We both saw this lock and key, stopping dead in our tracks. What’s even funnier is I snapped the photo of the lock as he shot the key from above at the same time............#barbaramtravels #travel #travelgram #seetheworld #newyork #nyc #bigapple #travelguide #travelholic #wanderlust #traveler #iamtraveler #newyorkcity #instatravel #manhattan #travelphotography #traveladdict #traveltheworld  #explorer #traveler #travelbug #travelislife #borntotravel #wonderfulplaces #iamatraveler #met #metropolitanmuseumofart @metmuseum #metmoment

text: ❁ ⁠⁠📍Palais de Tokyo, Paris 🇫🇷⁠.⁠.⁠.⁠. ⁠⁠➸➸➳ What's cooler than being in the Palais de Tokyo?⁠Being in the Palais de Tokyo ad midnight and having the museum all for yourself! 😁⁠.⁠➳ ⁠🎨Set very close to the Trocadero, not only is it an art gallery, it's also a hub of artistic innovation and interaction, and one of Paris' most alternative cultural spaces.⁠.⁠➳ ⁠Next to it, there’s also a beautiful garden and two restaurants – one serving French food, the other Japanese.⁠I liked the French one better 😝⁠.⁠ ⁠.⁠.⁠#joshuasanders #palaisdetokyo #contemporaryart #art #like #instaart #modernart #artwork #paris #painting #museum #artoftheday #victorclauss #victorclaussoriginal #sketch #becreative #moma #artmagazine #drawing #metropolitanmuseumofart #commentforcomment #gallery #hermitage #guggenheim #tatemodern #artist #inspiration #galleryart #creative #dametraveler ⁠

name: 2019-09-02 23.04.09 2124104834358249244_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Walking into the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s CAMP exhibit had my head going round and round in circles because these extravagant artistic larger than life displays of exuberant fashion make me so loopy. On the left the purple feathered circular blob form with a multicolored swarm of butterflies zooming round and round is intoxicating romantic for I hope to meet someone who makes my heart skip a beat like this one day. Check out how skinny her legs are🥰. On the right a lilac expertly pleated and tiered strapless bow gown with some moss green shirring at the bodice is styled on the mannequin form backwards. Fashion is so interesting and stumps you in imaginable ways, I definitely find myself taking a step back on more than a few occasions and wondering what the artist was thinking at that moment in time when the dress silhouette was altered and flipped to the mannequin’s feet. Wild creation! Next picture:)....@metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #museum #ilovemuseums #ilovemuseum #iloveart #ilovefashion #ilovefashion❤️ #fashionandart #fashionworld #artworld #butterflies #butterflies🦋 #butterfliesofinstagram #butterflies_lovers #mannequinfashion #extremefashion #fashionshop #fashionartist #pleateddress #tiereddress #fashionbackwards #fashioninterestgram #fashiongram #abstractfashion #fashionmuseum #fashionexhibition #fashionexhibit #fashionexhibitions #fashionhoarder #fashionable

name: 2019-09-03 00.46.57 2124156571281072902_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Head and shoulders of a sphinx of Hatshepsut, ca. 1473 - 1458 B.C. 18th Dynasty. | Голова и плечи сфинкса Хатшепсут. Она была второй женщиной-фараоном, если верить историкам. Первой была Собекнеферу из 12 династии. Египет не принял идею женщины-фараона, и после ее смерти имя Хатшепсут вырезалось из картушей и заменялось именами предшествующих фараонов-мужчин. Возможно, Хатшепсут это предвидела и приказала зодчим высечь ее имя в более укромных местах, возможно, просто потому, что исполнители, уничтожавшие упоминания о ней, попросту пропустили некоторые из них. Лишь в начале 19 века великий французский учёный, Жан-Франсуа Шампольон, благодаря которому стало возможно чтение египетских иероглифов, смог вернуть имя Хатшепсут в мировую историю. | @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-03 01.31.09 2124178815061257293_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Art Fact 📜⁣⁣Early in 1963, Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa arrived in the United States, to be exhibited at the National Gallery, Washington, DC, and then at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. The Mona Lisa received over one million visitors in its New York presentation. ⁣⁣Among these spectators was Andy Warhol, who began working on a series of silkscreen paintings of the Mona Lisa, using images of the painting in the Met’s exhibition brochure as source material. ⁣⁣#wheretheinkmeetsthepaper #trifoliosrl #MonaLisa #AndyWarhol #WarholWomen #NationalGallery #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

name: 2019-09-03 03.15.47 2124231477601199672_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I ran out of energy before so I just stopped posting! I’m back and ready for some action. This blog is everything to me, that’s why I keep on coming back! Back to the museum I go snapping away with my camera. I left this museum feeling so inspired, on the left is this Vogue editorial colorblocked sequined long sleeve off the shoulder fitted jumpsuit. I don’t want to disrespect the garment I’m talking about in any way, that’s why I give an enormous amount of details in every post I send out. On the far left- the mannequin’s head is made up of a plain white Vogue cover without a photo. In the middle is a V- shaped extreme plunging neck copper hued pailettes mini dress. Her shoe candy is beyond!! Pointed red pumps with gold coin chain ankle bracelets layered on the foot. Tres chic for sure! On the right is a money inspired outfit and shoes! Will you just look how flat the pleats are layered on this mini dress silhouette and how they are styled with fanned out ruffles on the sides to excret a feminine flare. Unfournately the designer only used one dollar bills in designing this masterpiece because they aren’t as valuable as some other options. I don’t know!! I make this shit up as I go!!....@metmuseum #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #ilovemuseums #museumworthy #museum #museums #museumart #museumlover #museumlovers #museumday #museumvisit #fashionandart #fashionandstyle #fashionblogger #copperdress #fashionart #magazinecover #magazinecovers #money #moneymoney #flaredout #plungingneckline #minidress #fashionindustry #fashioninspo #fashioninspiration #voguecover #colorblocked #sequindress #jumpsuit

name: 2019-09-03 03.22.44 2124234976815034073_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtLouis XV (1710–1774) at the Age of Five in the Costume of the Sacre Hyacinthe Rigaud (French, Perpignan 1659–1743 Paris) and Workshop ca. 1716–24 Oil on canvas 195.6 x 141 cmРиго  Гиацинт  Портрет Людовика XV (1710-1774)  в возрасте пяти лет  в коронационных одеждах холст, масло 195,6 х 141 смОколо 1716–1724Музей Метрополитен, Нью-ЙоркЛюдовик ХV был лишь четвертым в очереди на престол, но так как все его  предшественники скончались от кори, то он стал королем Франции.  Людовик  выжил благодаря  своей нянюшке: она не позволила врачам делать процедуры кровопускания двухлетнему ребёнку. 1 сентября 1715 года пятилетний наследник взошёл на французский престол. На протяжении  длительного правления Людовика мало интересовали государственные дела. Он занимался исключительно своими метрессами и охотой,  а когда ему указывали на опасность, угрожавшую престолу, и на бедствия народа, он отвечал: «Монархия продержится ещё, пока мы живы» («после нас хоть потоп», «après nous le déluge»). #childreninart #Louis #hyacintherigaud #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее #корольфранции #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-03 04.08.36 2124258069134212850_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: last year I had the chance to visit the #metropolitanmuseumofart in #newyork I literally spent the whole trip literally tripping and visiting art galleries. I was so amused by this specific museum though because of its brilliant collection obviously but it was really so informational and brushed on every #ancient era capturing the #culture and essence of what our ancestors believed in and lived like. I spent 7 hours at this museum and I didn’t even get to see it all!! But #Davincis art work happened to be on display that day so that was wicked to experience. Couldn’t even believe I was surrounded by so many important artifacts that tell the stories and show the soul of many tribes and dynasties before us. The work of the Greats you could literally feel it. This power inspired me SOo I decided I’m going to do something with all of these pictures that I captured because they deserve to be brought back to life #exalted and #honored When I’m done with all of these I’ll post them on my #flickr and website for you all to see. Till then stay safe my friends and remember to stay true to your roots #metmuseum #galactica #collageart #digital #magic #artifacts #ancientcivilization #ancientarchitecture ⭐️ #breatheart #makeartinstead #newyork #practicemakesperfect

name: 2019-09-03 04.20.25 2124264011012041884_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtFrancisco de Zurbarán,(1598 - 1664)The Young Virgin,  1630Испанский художник  Франсиско де Сурбаран Детство Мадонны - Франсиско Сурбаран. Около 1632-1633. Холст, масло. 116,8x94  Метрополитен музейДева Мария в образе современной автору испанской девочки. Нежная, трогательная. С большой любовью и трепетом относится художник к своему произведению.  Лицо прекрасного дитя обращено к небу, а вокруг, в бессловесном почтении собрались ангелы. Их лики едва видны, они словно нимб святого окружают девочку. Вокруг ребёнка растут цветы, корзиночка с чистым, белым покрывалом. Рядом, на столике маленькая книга – это молитвенник и ножницы - символ будущего посвящения. Слева от Марии – ваза с цветущими лилиями, цветами чистоты и непорочности и алые розы – символ жертвенной любви. На коленях у дитя лежит плоская, красновато-серая подушечка с рукоделием - вышивкой. Предметы отдалённо напоминают надгробный камень и плащаницу Христа.#childreninart  #Zurbaran #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-03 06.22.05 2124325243739937019_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I was lucky enough to see the“Play It Loud: Instruments of Rock & Roll” exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art which showcased some of the most incredible instruments, played by some of the most legendary performers in history. Here are my favourites of the day! First is Stevie Ray Vaughan’s iconic Fender Stratocaster. My all time favourite guitarist! 2: Eric Clapton’s Martin 000-42. He used this guitar in many live performances including a recording of Layla! 3: Bob Dylan’s Fender Strat. Not much more to say. Love the guy. 4: Elvis Presley’s Martin D-18. Wow! 5: Angus Young’s Gibson SG!! 6: The Beatles’ actual drum set. 7: Keith Richards’ Gibson Les Paul Custom. I recall a documentary about him where he said he was probably on acid when he decorated it. 8: A Fender Strat Kurt Cobain destroyed during a show finale in 1993. Epic. 9: An original Woodstock poster! #Metropolitanmuseumofart #NewYork #Music #Instruments #Art

name: 2019-09-03 06.50.01 2124339305078798478_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Castellani, Firm of, Necklace with Cameo of Veronica’s Veil, c 1870, gold and sapphires, length of chain with tassels 27 15/16 in, cameo 2 3/4 x 1 13/16 in, coll of Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY. The firm of Castellani was founded in Rome in 1814, and closed in 1927. It was immensely successful, pioneering the production of archaeological jewellery. This opulent necklace features a seriously religious image carved on a luscious sapphire which to me somewhat secularizes it (if that is a word). As Christ was walking up the Via Dolorosa to His crucifixion, St Veronica cleansed His face of blood and sweat with her veil; that image was imprinted on the veil.The Castellani collection of ancient jewellery and the firm’s own work is housed at the Villa Giulia in Rome. Years ago it was rather a secret and one had to ask and to surrender one’s passport before being admitted; now it is on open view - and pretty stunning it is.#castellani #archaeologicaljewellery #rome #villagiulia #stveronica #veil #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: Andy Warhol - Pink and purple cow (1976)According to Warhol, the inspiration for the cow image came from art dealer Ivan Karp:Another time he said, 'Why don't you paint some cows, they're so wonderfully pastoral and such a durable image in the history of the arts.' (Ivan talked like this.) I don't know how 'pastoral' he expected me to make them, but when he saw the huge cow heads — bright pink on a bright yellow background — that I was going to have made into rolls of wallpaper, he was shocked. But after a moment he exploded with: 'They're super-pastoral! They're ridiculous! They're blazingly bright and vulgar!' I mean, he loved those cows and for my next show we papered all the walls in the gallery with them.#andywarhol #andywarholmuseum #popart #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy  #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-03 07.19.12 2124353999579112615_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Claude Monet - Waterloo bridge, Sunlight Effect (1903) If not for the fog, Claude Monet once remarked, “London wouldn’t be a beautiful city. It’s the fog that gives it its magnificent breadth.” While working on his London series, he rose early every day to paint Waterloo Bridge in the morning, moving on to Charing Cross Bridge at midday and in the afternoon. He observed both motifs from his fifth-floor window at the Savoy Hotel. The Art Institute’s two Waterloo Bridge paintings are dated 1900 and 1903, but both were likely begun in 1900 and dated only when Monet felt that they were finished. He worked on all of his London paintings in his studio in Giverny, refusing to send any of them to his dealer until he was satisfied with them as an ensemble.#claudemonet #claudemonetgardens #impressionism #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy  #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-03 08.30.32 2124389896396574584_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: UK punk subculture began in the early 1970s and quickly spread into American pop culture. It embodied a style, an ideology and a way of life for those who rejected capitalism, authoritarianism and emphasized a ‘do it yourself’ attitude. Self made clothing, often held together in rudimentary ways and paired with Dr. Martens boots, became the standard look for punks. Punk made a mainstream revival in the 1990s, as the grunge movement rebirthed these anti-establishment ideals. High end fashion houses began to adopt the cheap, hand made aesthetic of punk clothing but with quality craftsmanship and materials. In the MET’s 2013 exhibit, ‘PUNK: Chaos to Couture’ this transition is epitomized by two of Versace’s 1994 S/S gowns. The black of the pair is by far the more infamous. Made of silk and lycra and held together by large good safety pins, the dress was worn by Elizabeth Hurley when she accompanied Hugh Grant to the premier of ‘Four Weddings and a Funeral’. Her appearance in the dress made international headlines, though many criticized her revealing choice. Hurley states that the dress was a last minute decision, as it was the only option available from the Versace office. The dress was also worn by Lady Gaga in 2012, who showcased many archived Versace pieces that year. ——————- #fashion #versace #punk #punkmovement #punkfashion #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #couture #elizabethhurley #hughgrant #ladygaga

name: 2019-09-03 08.30.43 2124389987276544263_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Now I have some downtime ( with Hurricane Dorian  on our site ) l’ll continue sharing with you work of art @metmuseum  This huge work by Thomas Hart Benton - Offering a panorama of “American life “ throughout the 1920s, America Today is a room-sized mural comprising ten canvas panels. Missouri native Thomas Hart Benton painted America Today to adorn a boardroom on the third floor of the New School for Social Research, a center of progressive thought and education in Greenwich Village. The mural was commissioned in 1930 by the New School's director Alvin Johnson. Benton finished it very early in 1931, when the school opened a new building designed by architect Joseph Urban. Although the artist received no fee for his work on commission, he was "paid" with free eggs, the yolks from which he created the egg tempera paint.  #thomashartbentonart #metmuseum  #metropolitanmuseumofart  #nyc  #enjoyart  #beart

text: At an exhibition dedicated to the #fashion of Camp, you'd expect me to take photos of the clothing. But what really moved me wasn't the styles; it was the stories.In a world of cruelty, discrimination and violence, Fanny Park and Stella Boulton defied Victorian morality and English Law to defend their right to cross-dress. But moreover, they fought to be #happy, as they were and with no apology for it.#MetropolitanMuseumofArt #TheMet #Manhattan

name: 2019-09-03 15.33.46 2124602914709515081_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Park Dae-Sung <박대성> 9/3(Tuesday)On this week’s #HeartToHeart. Painter Park Dae-sung, also known by his artist name Sosan, is the #master of #KoreanPainting. Well-known for a modern reinterpretation of #Ink-and-washPainting, he currently makes his artwork in #Gyeongju, Korea.His major works include paintings of Jangbaek Waterfall and Seongsan Sunrise Peak, both of which were featured at the historical scene of the #Inter-KoreanSummit. Also, the #MetropolitanMuseumOfArt displayed his painting of Guryong Waterfall on a Korean exhibition held last year.한국적인 아름다움으로 세계를 사로잡다한국화의 거장, #소산 #박대성 화백!남북정상회담을 빛냈던 '장백폭포'와 '성산일출봉'을 비롯한 수많은 대작을 발표하며, 한국 화단의 독보적인 존재로 자리잡은 박대성 화백과의 특별한 만남!#아리랑TV #하트투하트 에서 확인하세요~#한국화 #수묵화#한국화의재해석 #한국적인아름다움#남북정상회담 #장백폭포 #성산일출봉#메트로폴리탄뮤지엄 #구룡폭포#경주솔거미술관 #한국화거장#전통에묻다

name: 2019-09-03 16.16.02 2124624194149810398_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Серьги "Перо павлина". MMA (METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART).💎💎💎Изысканное украшение из коллекции "Перо павлина" выполнено из бижутерного сплава и покрыто 18К золотом. Декорировано россыпью чешских и австрийских кристаллов разного цвета и размера. Оригинал данного украшения, изготовленный в начале прошлого века во Франции и богато украшенный драгоценными камнями, хранится в Музее. Сопровождается сертификатом. Маркировано. Состояние: новое. Размер: 4,7 см (вместе с дужкой) на 1,8 см.👛Цена: 1300 руб.

name: 2019-09-03 20.58.30 2124766362173041959_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of Art The Crossing Sweeper Seymour Joseph Guy: 1824–1910 ca. 1860s; Oil on canvas; 12 1/8 x 8 1/2 in. (30.8 x 21.6 cm)Музей МетрополитенДжозеф Сеймур Гай (1824—1910) Уборщица перекрёстка 1824-1910 ок. 1860; Холст, масло; 12 1/8 х 8 1/2 дюйма (30,8 х 21,6 см); Aмериканский художник эпохи романтизма. Родился и учился в Лондоне, но впоследствии переехал в Нью-Йорк.Среди его жанровых работ много детских портретов. И это объяснимо: художник сам имел 9 детей. Одна из  отличительных черт романтизма - интерес к простым людям. Они не могут заплатить художнику  за работу, не носят роскошных одежд, ноги их сбиты о каменные мостовые и покрыты грязью: нет денег на туфли. Но интересны художнику своей близостью к природе, непосредственностью.  Романтик Гай помещает свою героиню в исключительные обстоятельства: несчастное дитя  вынуждено работать с младенчества.😢😢😢 #childreninart  #seymourjosephguy: #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-04 01.08.54 2124892391613939812_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Almond Blossom was painted immediately before one of his attacks; "My work was going well," he informed his brother, "the last canvas of branches in blossom - you will see that it is perhaps the best, the most patiently worked thing I had done, painted with calm and with greater firmness of touch. And the next day, down like a brute." Poised between lucidity and desperation, this lacework of light and color is kept aloft by the confidence Van Gogh had acquired in the previous two or three years and the sheer technical finesse now at his command.In painting the Almond Blossom, Van Gogh was not out to revive his own optimism, but to make an offering to his ever-caring brother. In spring 1889, Theo had married Jo Bonger, and in February 1890 she gave birth to their son, whom they named Vincent after the boy's godfather. The Blossoming Almond Tree was van Gogh's present to the infant that would perpetuate his name.#vincentvangogh #vincentvangoghmuseum #almondblossom #impressionism #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy  #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-04 01.17.28 2124896706243133973_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtGoya (Francisco de Goya y Lucientes) (Spanish, Fuendetodos 1746–1828 Bordeaux)ca. 1810 Oil on canvasDimensions:41 3/8 x 33 1/4 in. (105.1 x 84.5 )Музей Метрополитен:  Гойя (Испания, Фуендетодос 1746-1828 Бордо) - Хосе Коста Бонелс (умер l870), по прозвищу Пепито Франсиско де Гойя и Люсьентес Холст, масло; 41 3/8 х 33 1/4 дюйма (105,1 х 84,5 см)Отец Пепито, Рафаэль Коста де Кинтана, был врачом короля Фердинанда VII. Этот портрет  связан с работами Гойя,  посвящёнными  Испанской войне за независимость (1808–14): курточка Пепито сшита в форме солдатской формы, мальчик подстрижен "под Наполеона". Военная аналогия дополняется барабаном и игрушечной винтовкой с фиксированным штыком.#childreninart  #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait #goya #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее #гойя #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-04 04.58.21 2125007882276704268_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Finally got to see the CAMP: Notes on Fashion exhibit at the MET!...Just before it’s officially close this week I got to see this fabulous exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC! One of the many things on my semester bucket list, and I was not disappointed! My favorite look was this Undercover spring/summer 2018 ensemble inspired by the classic horror film The Shining, which is one of my favorite classic scary movies! I loved the accent of blood made out of red glass beads! Super creepy and fun!.You only have a few more days to catch this exhibit, if you live in the city it’s a must see!

text: Transplanted history. America is a young nation. As a result, we have always been fascinated by the historical artifacts of older cultures. Just as the Europeans have been with the Egyptian, Persian and Chinese artifacts. Is transporting artifacts and objects good or does it rob these cultures of their history? Not all is good or evil. It does promote understanding and familiarity, and it does rob them of a piece of their history.  DO these objects belong to humanity or a nation? #cloisters #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #canon #wander #vacations #travellife #travelpics #lonelyplanet #travelphoto #adventuretime #getaway #travelstoke #exploreeverything #InstaPhoto #PicOfTheDay #PhotoOfTheDay #visualsoflife #worldtravelbook #instatravel #travelgram #tourism #passportready #LPPhotochallengekaleidoscope #yourshotphotographer #nomadict #wander #travellife #travelpics #lonelyplanet⁠
