name: 2019-09-04 07.00.53 2125069557177967611_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Antioch Chalice consists of a small cup encased in a decorated, gilded shell. It was discovered in the early 20th century in Syria, but is believed to be originally from Antioch. This city is one of the five early pillars of the Christian church, the others being Rome, Jerusalem, Constantinople, and Alexandria. The outer shell is decorated with plant life, animals, and twelve figures. Two of the figures represent Christ, while the other ten are philosophers and prophets who foretold His coming. ...After its discovery, the Antioch Chalice was identified as the Holy Grail, or the cup that Jesus used at the Last Supper. It was believed that the interior piece was the Grail itself, while the decoration had been added later in order to honor it. It was displayed all over America as the Holy Grail and people came in droves to see it. However, further testing revealed that it is most likely an oil lamp from the 6th century. The Antioch Chalice can now be seen at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.

name: 2019-09-04 07.09.37 2125073949091161762_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Metropolitan Museum of Artموزه هنری متروپولیتن یکی از زیباترین موزه های نیویورک، آمریکا و دنیاست. این موزه از تمامی دنیا آثاری را در خود جای داده و‌فراتر از همه زیبایی های آثار، خود موزه ساختمانی تاریخی و‌بسیار زیبا دارد و محل مراسم بزرگ و با شکوهی در آمریکا مثل Met Gala Dinner و خیلی از فشن شوهای آمریکاست. این موضوع در مجاورت پارک مرکزی Central Park نیویورک هستش و بعد دیدن این‌موزه میتونین سری به سنترال پارک بزنین.#themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #NYC #مهاجرت #گردشگری #آمریکا

name: 2019-09-04 11.51.27 2125215801148922678_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtMetropolitan museum: Claude Monet - Jean Monet (1867–1913) on His Hobby Horse Claude Monet: French, Paris 1840–1926 Giverny 1872; Oil on canvas; 23 7/8 x 29 1/4 in. (60.6 x 74.3 cm)Музей Метрополитен: Клод Моне - Жан Моне (1867-1913) на лошадке Франция, Париж 1840-1926 Живерни 1872; Холст, масло; 23 7/8 х 29 1/4 дюйма (60,6 х 74,3 см); Жан Моне ( Jean Monet) (1867 - 1914 года) был старшим сыном французского импрессиониста Клода Моне и Камиллы Донсье Моне. Летом 1872 года  Клод  Моне нарисовал своего пятилетнего сына на лошади-хобби в саду дома, которую семья арендовала в Аржантее под Парижем. Клод Моне сохранил картину и никогда не демонстрировал ее на протяжении всей своей жизни.Жан  женился на своей сводной сестре Бланш Ошеде в 1897 году. Учился на химика в Швейцарии, работал у своего дяди Леона Моне в качестве химика.Умер после продолжительной болезни 10 февраля 1914 года. Похоронен на кладбище Живерни. Жан изображён на лошадк - велосипеде.. Велосипед изобрели в начале девятнадцатого века, и идея совместить лошадку-качалку с велосипедом буквально лежала на поверхности. В  1821 году в Париже Жан Луис Гурд (Jean Louis Gordoux) получил патент на изобретение "mechanical horse". #childreninart  #monet #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #моне #картиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-04 14.45.33 2125303424638798060_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Девушка в матросской блузе. Холст, масло, 40х60.Копия-подражание Амедео Модильяни, оригинал (Girl in a Sailor's Blouse, 1918) хранится в Метрополитен-музее.Работы Модильяни, очень самобытные и узнаваемые - непропорционально вытянутые шеи, искаженные лица, глаза без зрачков - не пользовались популярностью при жизни художника и вызвали интерес у публики лишь после его смерти. Помимо подобных портретов в творческое наследие Модильяни входит также большое число картин, воспевающих красоту обнаженного тела.Чем меня заинтересовала Девушка в матросской блузе? Одним интересным фактом - случайно увидел репродукцию этой картины в фильме "Служебный роман". На стене в квартире Калугиной висит то, что объяснить крайне сложно. Людмила Прокофьевна - тетка серьёзная. Воспитанный твердой рукой Партии (не забываем, она - директор нехилого учреждения, периодически ездящий на ковёр к министру) человек не станет вешать на стену маляки алкоголика, рисовавшего непотребства всякия. Но вот висит же :) По интернету кочует мнение, что таким образом Гениальный Рязанов показал скрытую линию-параллель любви Калугина-Новосельцев - Ахматова-Модильяни (да, был у Анны Андреевны в молодости интерес к горячему итальянскому парню... интерес, о котором она рассказала лишь много лет спустя). Якобы, изображенная на картине девушка и есть Анна Андреевна... Но тут много сомнений. Модильяни действительно оставил несколько портретных рисунков Ахматовой, но все они выполнены в другом стиле и созданы задолно до этой картины. И чувственных отношений в жизни художника после Ахматовой было немало, к моменту написания картины он уже женат (по любви, кстати) вовсю был... И алкоголь прибавился. В общем, ни к чему ему Ахматову к тому времени рисовать было. Да и непохожа она ))) Думаю, тут дело в другом... ⬇⬇⬇⬇⬇⬇⬇⬇

name: 2019-09-04 18.13.06 2125407889039377273_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ニューヨークにあるメトロポリタンミュージアムのキャンプ展覧会。毎年フャションを中心に展覧会やっていて、テーマは面白くないと思ったが、勉強になりました。L’exposition fashion de l’année au MET à New York. Je pensais pas apprécier autant une expo sur le thème « camp » (d’ailleurs je savais pas ce que c’était). Finalement c’était bien conçu et j’ai appris des trucs. Comme quoi.This year’s MET fashion exhibition was about camp, which I had never heard about nor was I interested in any way. But in the end I was surprised, it was well done and I learnt some things. ☆☆☆☆☆☆☆#メトロポリタンミュージアム #メトロポリタン美術館 #ニューヨーク #アメリカ #キャンプご飯 #旅行 #アメリカ🇺🇸 #アメリカ旅行 #metropolitan #camp #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #unitedstates #usa #travel #travelphotography #museum #newyork #newyorkcity

name: 2019-09-04 20.08.13 2125465831881337451_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Smartphones wave like palm fronds above the viewers who throng “Leonardo da Vinci‘s ‘St. Jerome’” at the Met through October 6, a shrine-like display of a painting that the Master started around 1483 and then abandoned, perhaps when its commission lapsed but as likely owing to ennui. Leonardo had fully drawn only the face, clavicle area, and right foot of the old, nearly toothless Jerome, who is about to pound himself in the chest with a rock as he contemplates a crucifix in a cave or a grotto. A glum brown undercoat occupies much of the wood panel. The saint’s sketched companion animal, a lion, appears to roar at him for some reason. The work’s torqued composition and canny human anatomy are impressive, but it registers mainly as a relic for the contemporary cult of Leonardo - the innovator’s innovator - which dates from Bill Gate’s purchase, in 1994, of one of his notebooks. How exciting is it that a Leonardo fingerprint appears in the paint? Your call. #bethsorenson #thenewyorker #museum #leonardodavinci #stjerome #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #october6 #painting #master #leonardo #face #foot #toothless #jerome #crucifix #sketched #lion #humananatomy #impressive #contemporary #cult #innovator #billgates #notebooks #fingerprint #paint #nyc #manhattan

text: The Starry Night is an oil on canvas by the Dutch post-impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh. name: 2019-09-05 00.30.23 2125597784812251677_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Starry Night (Norwegian: Stjernenatt) is an oil-on-canvas painting created by the Expressionist artist Edvard Munch in 1893. This night landscape represents the coastline at Åsgårdstrand, a small beach resort south of Oslo in Norway, where Edvard Munch had spent his summers since the late 1880s. In this painting Munch shows the view from the hotel window, where he fell in love for the first time.#edvardmunch #munch #munchmuseum  #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #impressionism #skirts #louvre #fashionale #fashionista #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

text: Starry Night Over the Rhône (September 1888, French:Nuit étoilée sur le Rhône) - one of Vincent van Gogh's paintings of Arles at nighttime.It was painted at a spot on the bank of the Rhône that was only a one or two-minute walk from the Yellow House on the Place Lamartine which Van Gogh was renting at the time. The night sky and the effects of light at night provided the subject for some of his more famous paintings.#vangogh #vangoghskirts #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy #starrynight #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #impressionism #skirts #louvre #fashionale #fashionista #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-05 01.02.44 2125614067410694305_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Vincent van Gogh - The Alpilles with Olive Trees in the Foreground (1889)Of Olive Trees in a Mountainous Landscape in the collection of the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), Vincent wrote his brother Theo: "I did a landscape with olive trees and also a new study of a starry sky," calling this painting the daylight complement to the nocturnal, The Starry Night. His intention was to go beyond "the photographic and silly perfection of some painters" to an intensity born of color and linear rhythms.Within the painting, twisted green olive trees stand before the foothills of the Alps and underneath the sky with an "ectoplasmic" cloud. Later, when the pictures had dried, he sent both of them to Theo in Paris, noting: "The olive trees with the white cloud and the mountains behind, as well as the rise of the moon and the night effect, are exaggerations from the point of view of the general arrangement; the outlines are accentuated as in some old woodcuts."#vincentvangogh #vincentvangoghmuseum #almondblossom #impressionism #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy  #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-05 01.04.33 2125614975444442611_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: One of only a few extant examples of an Early Netherlandish painting executed in distemper on canvas, this picture was completed by Justus of Ghent around 1465. The colors, which would have once been vibrant, have deteriorated quite heavily due to the fragility of the medium. Justus of Ghent, also known as Joos Van Wassenhove, began his career in Ghent (it is thought that he may have worked in the studio of Dieric Bouts and he was friendly with Hugo van der Goes), but left for Italy in 1469 to work for Federigo da Montefeltro, the Duke of Urbino. This canvas depicts the Adoration of the Magi, however the figures are shown inside a decaying formal building, instead of the stable in which they are normally pictured. The Virgin sits upon a canopied bed, and the glass of wine and bread on the table symbolize the Holy Eucharist.

name: 2019-09-05 01.06.16 2125615845745107599_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Claude Monet “Water lilies” (1915) “One instant, one aspect of nature contains it all,” said Claude Monet, referring to his late masterpieces, the water landscapes that he produced at his home in Giverny between 1897 and his death in 1926. These works replaced the varied contemporary subjects he had painted from the 1870s through the 1890s with a single, timeless motif—water lilies. The focal point of these paintings was the artist’s beloved ﬂower garden, which featured a water garden and a smaller pond spanned by a Japanese Footbridge. Over time, the artist became less and less concerned with conventional pictorial space. By the time he painted Water Lilies, which comes from his third group of these works, he had dispensed with the horizon line altogether. In this spatially ambiguous canvas, the artist looked down, focusing solely on the surface of the pond, with its cluster of vegetation ﬂoating amid the reﬂection of sky and trees.#claudemonet #claudemonetgardens #impressionism #fashion #urbanfashion #streetfashion #luxurystreetwear #instafashion #fashionposts #artsy  #painting #paintings #uniqueclothing #fashiondesigner #fashiondesign #fashionart #fashionstyle #louvre #art #museum #classicalart #museum #modernartmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #louvre #louvremuseum #museums #museumofmodernart

name: 2019-09-05 01.32.16 2125628928535156574_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Robe à l'Anglaise, ca. 1770, British, silk, Credit Line: Purchase, Irene Lewisohn Bequest, 2018Accession Number: 2018.111a, bThis robe à l’anglaise is a superb expression of the English taste in dress—skillful cut and construction, and free from elaborate trimmings—a sensibility that increasingly influenced European modes of dress in the late eighteenth century. The refined simplicity and neat tailoring associated with English dress grew increasingly influential in France during the latter half of the eighteenth century. By the 1770s, French fashion magazines regularly featured the robe à l’anglaise, praising its elegance and modest charm. This example is impeccably made and discreetly adorned, its sole ornamentation being bands of pinked, self-fabric trim. The choice of textile, a delicately patterned silk damask dating to the 1730s, is evidence of the common eighteenth-century practice of repurposing finely woven fabrics.https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/771113#metmuseum #metmuseumnyc #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #museum #newyork #ny #allabout18thcentury #robealanglaise #anglaise #reddress #damask #reddamask #18thcenturyfashion #18thcentury #instagram #fashion #fashionstudy @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-05 01.47.38 2125636660137086931_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtFrancisco José de Goya y Lucientes; . Don Manuel Osorio Manrique de Zúñiga, niñoГойя (Испания, Фуендетодос 1746-1828) "Дон Мануэль Осорио Манрике де Суньига в детстве"На полотне Гойи изображён дон Мануэль Осорио Манрике де Суньига, забавляющийся с сорокой, которую подстерегают коты. Мануэль Осорио - младший сын графини Альтамира (свояченницы герцогини Альба) и дона Висента Исабеля Осорио де Москосо, графа Альтамира и члена правления Банка де Сан-Карлос (в будущем Банк Испании). Гойя получил заказ, будучи в то время портретистом при дворе Карла III, на изображение всех членов семьи Альтамира.3-4 летний ребёнок изображён неестественным. Выражение лица и весь внешний вид серьёзен и непроницаем, что не соответствует его возрасту. Одет маленький Мануэль в модный тогда яркий красный костюм с золотым поясом. В руках он держит тонкую верёвку с привязанной сорокой. Сорока символизирует любопытство и возможно, как птица, невинность ребёнка. Коты же, злобно наблюдающие за ней, противопоставлены невинности сороки и ребёнка. Коты, как дьявольские животные, были изображены позднее у Гойи в «Капричос». С правой стороны размещены птицы, заключённые в клетку. Сам же Мануэль Осорио скончался в 1792 году, не достигнув и 10 лет.#childreninart  #goya #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #гойя #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

text: ..CAMP..a few of my favs from the CAMP exhibit @ the Metropolitan Museum of Art, NYC..it was an AMAZING style #exhibit that blew my mind & gave me so much insight into what one can do w fashion. The exhibit examines how the elements of #irony, humor #parody, #theatricality and #exaggeration r expressed in fashion. I hav to admit some the styles I was attracted too were somewhat modest  considering the overall presentation & I wish now I had taken photos of the more exaggerated styles..but here..a man's #suit frm the 18th century.has inspired me to #thrift a similar #jacket & style  w leggins/jeans..so i'll definitely b heading more over to the men's section when i thrift!!...LiveLoveStyle😎#campexhibit #metropolitanmuseumofart #nycstylin #seveenthcenturytothepresent#notesoncamp #susansontag #fashion #style #mystyle #styleover60 #styleover60 #ardisbougiethriftstyle

text: Wisata Misteri BanyuwangiHilangnya mahasiswa saat KKN di desa penari Banyuwangi, cukup menghebohkan. Justru, lokasi wisata religi di kota Blambangan makin menarik didatangi. Lokasi keramat menyapa ramah. Diantaranya, pertapaan Prabu Tawang Alun, Raja Blambangan yg ada di Songgon menawarkan suasana lain. Suasana antara ada dan tiada. Terlebih ketika bisa bersentuhan dengan batu tempat bersemedinya sang Prabu pasca menyerahkan kerajannya pada adiknya. Ngeri? Enggak. Justru disinilah ke Esa-an Allah SWT sangat terasa. Ada mahluk lain sekain kita manusia? Ya. Bukankah, Allah menciptakan golongan jik dan manusia seperti dalam kitab suci kita? Tak percaya? Ayo ke kabupaten yang dipimpin pak @azwaranas.a3 itu.#kkn #kkndidesapenari #tvone #metropolitanmuseumofart #metrotvjatim #cnn #banyuwangikeren #explorebandung #eksotic #ghost #desapenari #transcorp #rcti #rawa #rajaampat #king #blambanganbanyuwangi #osingnese_banyuwangi #angker #mitos #gunungagung #alas #alaspurwo

name: 2019-09-05 20.54.00 2126213647402307425_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Вчера был MET, но я правда не знаю, сколько нужно дней там провести, чтобы увидеть чуть больше, чем что-то.Музей - как все в Америке, абсолютный Диснейленд для взрослых. Немного искусства, бар, много искусства, ресторан, еще немного античности, магазин, руфтоп и один билет на 3 дня.И так во всем. Меня, суровую русскую, воспитанную в традиции, что искусство - это очень серьезно, а потребление - это отдельно и только после того, как сделаешь уроки, в первый раз в Америке это  повергло в шок. Потом я расслабилась, привыкла и поняла, что жизнь должна приносить удовольствие. У каждого оно - свое, у кого-то - такое. И так тоже бывает.Придется идти еще. Чтобы увидеть что-то кроме ресторанов, Византии,  европейской живописи и Кэмпа.P.S. дорогие, если вы хотите узнать у меня, во что я одета, каким шампунем я мою голову, хотите посоветовать, куда пойти в Нью-Йорке или сделать мне комплимент, делайте это в комментариях, умоляю! Не засоряйте директ, там я все равно никогда не отвечу.#maltsevastylegoestoamerica#maltsevastylegirls #богиняселфи#lookdujour #ilovenyc #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-05 21.09.09 2126221273613809941_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Did you know that the spacious living room from one of Frank Lloyd Wright’s grandest prairie houses is meticulously recreated in NYC’s Metropolitan Museum? Even the daylight coming in through the wall of windows honors the designer’s original intentions. #500hiddensecretsofnewyork 📷 @springerinn

name: 2019-09-05 21.22.15 2126227863619720123_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: This abstract by my favourite world renowned master of colour Petro Lebedynets is my choice of art for my study, above the desk.  Difficult to summarise in a few sentences why I love his works so much. I could write endless essays. One of the most important reasons would be (to me !) is his profound attention to colour.⠀“Colour is stronger than the language.  It’s a subliminal communication” -  Louise Bourgeois.⠀There were artists who were very specific about the space, the placement and positioning of their art (Gunter Forg, Soulages, etc.) In line with this,  I like installing Petro Lebedynets’s works in storied contexts, as I did in my study:  beautiful #antique  English desk and an antique rug from Russian Imperial Family Romanovs. The legend goes that the Russian Emperor Nicolas the Second used to walk on it.⠀I hope my “to do list” will be done quicker in this study. ➡️➡️➡️➡️ Swipe to see more.⠀Upholstery by Dedar, Rubelli, Armanicasa.#pierresoulages

name: 2019-09-06 00.58.31 2126336721059624654_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Marie Rinteau, called Mademoiselle de Verrières,1761 by François Hubert Drouais FrenchThe sitter is Marie Rinteau, who in 1748 had given birth to an illegitimate daughter, Marie Aurore, by the famous soldier and courtier Maurice de Saxe (1696–1750). Marie is remembered as the great-grandmother of the writer George Sand (1840–1876). Marie and her sister Geneviève enjoyed a brief moment of success in music and theatre and long careers as cultured courtesans, known as "les demoiselles de Verrières."Artist: François Hubert Drouais (French, Paris 1727–1775 Paris)Date: 1761Medium: Oil on canvasDimensions: 45 1/2 x 34 5/8 in. (115.6 x 87.9 cm)Classification: PaintingsCredit Line: The Jules Bache Collection, 1949Accession Number: 49.7.47https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/436214#metmuseum #allabout18thcentury #vanityfair #voguemagazine #metropolitanmuseumofart #museum #ny #francoishubertdrouais #postillondamour #whitedress #allabout18thcentury #18thcentury #frenchfashion #18thcenturyfashion @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-06 03.00.37 2126398177914174090_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Theodore Robinson. "The Old Mill". 1892, oil on canvas. "The first American artist to be given the predicate of Impressionist in the USA. When he finally returned to the USA permanently at the end of 1892, he remained faithful to landscape painting, successfully. But measured against Monet, his views are dependent on a more subdued coloration and place greater emphasis on the aspect of linear structuring coordinates. Altogether, the reception of Impressionism by American artists is generally characterised by the fact that the French stylistic form represented only one of several parallel Europeans models. Academic and realistic composition and coloration often provided them with stimuli of equal status." from "Impressionism: Reimagining Art" by Norbert Wolf #theodorerobinson #impressionism #oiloncanvas #oilpainting #peinture #pintura #painting #impressionist #art #arte #artlovers #landscapepainting #oldmill #artbook #coffeetablebook #americanart #americana #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-06 03.27.45 2126411834198424318_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: "Unto This Last: Two Hundred Years of John Ruskin" is open now through December 8..The #Victorian polymath—visionary, uncompromising, contradictory, and sometimes troubling—remains one of the greatest #writers on #art in the English language..His ideas demand our attention today as we address the progression of issues he observed in his time. As such, we focus on #Ruskin as a pioneering ecologist, advocate for social justice, and historic preservationist..The timing could not be better to take another look at what he called "the coming storm…".Featuring @Yale’s combined collections of Ruskiniana—the largest outside the UK—with exceptional loans from @metmuseum, @fitzmuseum_uk, @beineckelibrary, @themorganlibrary, among others..Image credits (left to right): #JohnRuskin, "In the Pass of Killiecrankie," 1857, #watercolor and #gouache on board, The Fitzwilliam Museum, University of Cambridge; Frederick Hollyer, "Portrait of John Ruskin (Datur Hora Quieti)," ca. 1894, platinum #print, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, #YaleUniversity; John Ruskin, "Study of an #OakLeaf," undated, #pen and brown #ink with watercolor over #graphite, heightened with gouache and gum #onpaper, Yale Center for British Art, Paul Mellon Collection; John Ruskin, “The Dryad’s Waywardness,” from "Modern Painters" (London: Smith, Elder and Co., 1843–60), vol. 1, plate 59, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, #Yale University; J. M. W. Turner, "#Venice, from the Porch of Madonna della Salute," ca. 1835, #oil on canvas, The #MetropolitanMuseumofArt, New York, Bequest of Cornelius Vanderbilt

name: 2019-09-06 04.13.15 2126434728629693709_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: These first two images are front and back details of a tapestry panel woven at the Royal Gobelins Manufactory in Paris in the 18th century as part of a larger commission for the sixth Earl of Coventry and his house Croome Court in England. When an object is too large to fit on tables, we have the option of using a hoist system to hang large textiles for staff examinations or photography (see image 3). The central panel, where you see the white fabric, is undecorated because it is meant to be covered by a mirror. This piece was added later with painted borders by Conservator Nancy Britton in @metobjectsconservation to blend seamlessly with the woven 18th-century side panels (see image 4).⁣ ⁣⁣⁣Mirror surround with vases, designed 1758–67, woven 1764–71. General conception by Jacques Germain Soufflot. Manufacture National des Gobelins, Paris. 58.75.5⁣ ⁣⁣⁣#Gobelins #Tapestry #RattiTextileCenter #MetTextiles #MetMuseum #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

name: 2019-09-06 05.02.23 2126459457324969931_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: With approximately 100 exhibitions, Jane Peterson had a highly successful career. While her style varied, from Impressionist to Expressionist, her use of color and the spontaneity of her execution, both encouraged by her teacher Joaquin Sorolla, remained constant. Through Sorolla, Peterson met and befriended Louis Comfort Tiffany with whom she traveled on painting expeditions and whose garden at Laurelton Hall she painted many times—an example can be seen at the Metropolitan Museum of Art (“Turkish Fountain with Garden”). While the subject matter of Peterson’s work varied, she often used floral arrangements, which she called “flower portraits,” as a means of studying color, as she likely did here. Although Peterson focused mostly on floral portraits during her brief 4-year marriage at 50 years old, she painted countless numbers of cityscapes during her lifetime depicting the beauty of the many foreign cities she called home throughout her life. Out of the vaults—Jane Peterson’s (1876-1965) “Petunias and Zinnias,” ca. 1926. Now on view in “American Still Life Moderns.” #janepeterson #womenartists #expressionistart #joaquinsorolla #louiscomforttiffany #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #floralpainting #stilllife #feministarthistory #womenknowhistory #arthistory

name: 2019-09-06 13.43.45 2126721873341788750_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Один из лучших музеев мира - Метрополитен. Не знали куда бежать, все так интересно. В результате, какие-то выставки прошли по три раза. 💃🤓👍 // One of the best museums in the world is the Metropolitan Museum of Art. We wanted to be everywhere at the same time. As a result, some exhibitions were visited three times. 😍🥳🙏 #📌art⠀•⠀⠀В карусели слева направо // In my carousel from left to right:⠀📌 The Window of Tiffany Studios. Autumn Landscape. 1923-1924. ⠀📌 Peter Paul Rubens (Flemish). Study of two heads. 1609.⠀📌 Pieter Bruegel The Elder (Netherlandish). The Harvesters. 1565.⠀📌 Eugene Delacroix (French). text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtThe Metropolitan Museum of Art of New York City, colloquially "the Met",[a] is the largest art museum in the United States. With 6,953,927 visitors to its three locations in 2018, it was the third most visited art museum in the world.[8] Its permanent collection contains over two million works,[9] divided among seventeen curatorial departments. The main building, on the eastern edge of Central Park along Museum Mile in Manhattan's Upper East Side is by area one of the world's largest art galleries.#metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #leonardodavinci #renoir #horsesrmour #sculpture #andromedainchains #virgin #motherandchild #vatican #stjerome #exhibitions #manhattannyc

name: 2019-09-06 21.08.40 2126945810654838454_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Francisco Toledo (July 17, 1940 – Sept 5, 2019) Expressionist painter Francisco Toledo, who was well known and respected in Mexico both for his art and his activism, has died, the country's president announced late Thursday. President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador wrote in his Twitter account that "art is mourning." He called the 79-year-old Toledo "an authentic defender of nature, customs and traditions of our people." Toledo's enigmatic paintings and sculptures were marked by the animals, colors and traditions of Oaxaca. Insects, cats, and other animals were presented in almost mythological contexts in Toledo's work, whose colors also evoked the brilliant palette of Oaxaca. Wild-haired and bearded, Toledo led movements to save old convents and other colonial-era buildings from developers and helped turn them into centers for the arts and gardens. Culture Secretary Alejandra Frausto wrote of the artist "something flowered at every step Toledo took." He also founded the Museum de Arte Contemporane de Oaxaca (MACO), the Patronato Pro-Defensa y Conservación del Patrimonio Cultural de Oaxaca, a library for the blind, a photographic center, and the Eduardo Mata Music Library. Francisco Toledo has had exhibitions in Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Spain, the United Kingdom, Belgium, France, Japan, Sweden, the United States, as well as other countries. His work is represented in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Museum of Modern Art in New York and the Museo Tamayo in Mexico City.  Mono con Bicicleta, 2005, The Wanderer, 1989 #Toledo #FranciscoToledo #Expressionist #Painter #Mexico #activism #PresidentAndresManuelLopezObrador #Twitter #artismourning #nature #tradition #AlejandreFrausto #MuseumdeArteContemporanedeOaxaca #Argentina #Brazil #Colombia #Ecuador #Spain #UK #Belgium #France #Japan #Sweden #UnitedStates #MetropolitanMuseumofArt  #MuseumofModernArt #NewYork #MuseoTamayo #MexicoCity

text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. One of the most inspirational places for art and fashion hosted an exhibition called CAMP. It explores the origins of Camp’s exuberant aesthetic and how the sensibility evolved from a place of marginality to become an important influence on mainstream culture. In theseimages we can see ANDY WARHOL’S iconic Campbell Soups Cans Dress which isworld famous, BALENCIAGA, HOUSE OF MOSCHINO, VIVIENNE WESTWOOD, MARYKATRANTZOU and several other designers evolving in their fashion journey and inculcating architectural structures into their designs.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#DelnaPoonawallaDesigns #InspirationalNYC #NYC #NewYork #NewYorkCity #NYCInspired #MET #MetropolitanMuseumOfArt #Camp #CampExhibition #FashionInspo #AndyWarhol #Balenciaga #HouseOfMoschino #VivienneWestwood #MaryKatrantzou #InternationalDesigners #DelnaPoonawalla  #HolidayDiaries #HolidayInspiration #DesignInspo #Designer

name: 2019-09-07 08.35.26 2127291462734521018_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Este es un fragmento del Oleo de Federic Church “Heart of the Andes” inspirado en los escritos de Humboldt sobre el Ecuador. Esta obra esta en el MET de Nueva York. Church viajó al Ecuador entre 1853 y 1857 y sus obras representan el rango de diferentes climas del Ecuador. . . .La firma de Church representa un grabado en un tronco de la pintura. . . .En esta obra se ve detalle de animales, flores y lo que se supone que representa el Chimborazo.#met #newyork #fredericchurch #heartoftheandes #chimborazo #humboldt #alexandervonhumboldt #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: “Through more than 250 objects dating from the seventeenth century to the present, The Costume Institute's spring 2019 exhibition explores the origins of camp's exuberant aesthetic. Susan Sontag's 1964 essay "Notes on 'Camp'" provides the framework for the exhibition, which examines how the elements of irony, humor, parody, pastiche, artifice, theatricality, and exaggeration are expressed in fashion.” #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #camp #newyorkcity

text: For Sale: the  Venetian watercolour painting can be considered an historical document because it shows S. Marco square without the bell tower, that fell down in July 14th 1902 and that was then rebuilt and opened in 1912. The painter is Vincenzo Migliaro (1858-1938), a vedutista from Naples who lived few year in Venice at the beginning of the 1900's. Available at antique gallery in Italy. name: 2019-09-07 20.39.02 2127655667842868471_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: [7th Muharram, 1441 / 6th September, 2019]▫1. Lullaby (1). UV print on polyester film, back-lit by LED panel. 18 x 18 inches (2018)2. Crib of the Infant Jesus. Wood, polychromy, lead, silver-gilt, painted parchment, silk embroidery with seed pearls, gold thread, and translucent enamels. 35.4 x 28.9 x 18.4 cm (15th century)▫Wish I had a whole other lifetime to study religious symbols and their migrations from continent to continent, their astounding fluidity. Image 1 is a digital collage that I made for the #stationsofthecross2018, along with an animated short exploring commonalities between Shia and Christian iconographies and mourning/remembrance rites. It is made up of photographs that I took at an #imambargah in Lahore. The cradle represents Husayn ibn Ali's infant son and his martyrdom in Karbala. Image 2 shows another cradle, housed at the Met, New York, symbolising the Christ Child. Both are examples of devotional objects, particularly central to female-led religious observances.▫#ashura #mourningtraditions #husaynibnali #karbala #islamicart #christianart #iconography #rites #southasianart #artfrompakistan #devotionalart #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-07 21.00.33 2127666497921518927_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ."The lighter the skin,  the more acceptable you are. The darker the skin, the more marginalised you become.  I want to demonstrate that you can produce beauty in the context of a figure  that has that kind of velvety blackness. It can be done.".Kerry James Marshall / b.1955Untitled (Studio)  2014Acrylic on PVC panels.Black skin is a constant in Mr. Marshall’s art. More than three decades ago, he resolved to devote himself to creating a new, disruptive art history, one that would insert — big-time — the absent black figure into the tradition of Western art, which was a tradition he loved and identified with.  Working across various media in portraits, interiors, nudes and landscapes, Marshall combines actual and imagined events from African American history and culture and integrates a range of stylistic influences to address the limited historiography of black art..#blackisbeautiful #odetomanet #olympia #beauty #manet #color #artismylife #modernart #americanhistory #kerryjamesmarshall #metropolitanmuseumofart #negativespace #artiststudio #artinspired #arthistory

text: And I thought I had a splitting headache jk lol. Went to see Camp at the Met last night.  Wasnt really my scene though they did curate an interesting exhibit. What was really cool was being in the museum after hours when it's mostly empty, membership perks rule. Id suggest to all my fellow art loving,  NewYorker friends get a member ship st your favorite museum, they will hook you up with sweet deals and you are helping a good cause.  #metropolitanmuseumofart #artinstone #carvedstone #marble #sculpture #themet

name: 2019-09-07 22.57.49 2127725519016645988_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtMaría Teresa (1638–1683), Infanta of Spain Juan Bautista Martínez del Mazo (Spanish, Cuenca ca. 1612–1667 Madrid) ca. 1645Oil on canvas 148 x 102.9 cmОколо 1645 года. Инфанте Марии Терезии 7 лет. Инфанта Мария Терезия (1638-1683) – дочь короля Испании Филиппа IV от первого брака.  Мария Терезия в 1646 году, в 8 лет, стала наследницей престола после смерти ее брата принца Бальтазара Карлоса (1629-1646). Мария Терезия (1638-1683) знаменита в большей степени многочисленными изменами своего блистательного супруга Короля-Солнце Людовика XIV (1638-1715) – ровесника и двойного кузена. Людовик XIV и Мария Терезия были двоюродными братом-сестрой и по материнской, и по отцовской линиям: отец Людовика и мать Марии Терезии были родными братом и сестрой; отец Марии Терезии и мать Людовика XIV также были родными братом и сестрой.Мария Терезия вышла замуж за короля Франции в 1660 году по условиям Пиренейского мира 1659 года, завершившего франко-испанскую войну, тянувшуюся с 1635 года. В знак мирных намерений французский король брал в жены испанскую инфанту Марию Терезию, за которой полагалось солидное приданое в размере 500 тысяч золотых экю, они должны были быть выплачены Франции в течение полутора лет.На картине Масо Мария Терезия гладит собачку. Это  фален.  Из-за своей аристократичной внешности собачки становились моделями таких известных мэтров изобразительного искусства как Рубенс, Ван Дейк, Тициан. Высший свет Франции обожал эту породу. Причем, собачка не только украшала дома знати, но и выполняла функцию ловцов крыс.#childreninart  #juanbautistamartínezdelmazo #metropolitanmuseumofart #princess#paintingchildren #kids #portrait #dog #портретнаяживопись #instagrammuseum #фален  #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #инфанта #принцесса  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtPortrait of a Boy with a Falcon Wallerant Vaillant (Flemish, Lille 1623–1677 Amsterdam)Oil on canvas75.6 x 63.5 cmКроме предметов европейского искусства, в МУЗЕЕ МЕТРОПОЛИТЕН хранятся наиболее значимые картины и скульптуры американских авторов. Помимо этого, Метрополитен является одним из крупнейших хранителей коллекции импрессионизма и постимпрессионизма. Общая стоимость переданных в дар коллекций произведений искусства исчисляется миллиардами долларов. Среди самых крупных – коллекция финансиста и филантропа Роберта Лемана, переданная в дар музею в 1969 году. В числе двух с лишним тысяч шедевров (2 589, если быть точнее) – полотна Питера де Хоха, Ренуара, Боттичелли, Рембрандта, Франциско Гойи и Эль Греко. #childreninart  #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-08 07.39.28 2127988075559725347_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Kicked off Fashion Week (more like Fashion Week weekend for me!) in NYC with the amazing @joyadass at The Metropolitan Museum of Art.  Joya, a CNN anchor and founder of Lady Drinks — a networking platform primarily for South Asian professional women — hosted a private tour of the Met’s “Fashion Through the Ages.” Thrilled to personally experience one of Joya’s events and meet some of her members (scroll!) Joya and I have spent a lot of time supporting one another through our own women’s network so seeing her in action was, well, a joy! Love the comfy sneakers Joya — I’m  bringing mine next time!And...the icing on the evening was having dear friend @lauriehardenstylist from San Francisco be able to join us (scroll again!). We also have spent hours talking biz and years supporting one another both personally and professionally.  Our families go way back.  Laurie is one of those people who lights up a room with her beauty and kindness.  So glad you were able to make it girl!  Loved that vintage duster too! Great to be in the company of such fine women supporting each other.  Here’s to the entrepreneurial sisterhood!#dressingwellboston #nyfashionweek2019 #metropolitanmuseumofart #ladydrinksnyc #lauriehardenstylist #womensupportingwomen #entrepreneurialsisterhood #kickingofffallinstyle

text: Keith Moon's "Pictures of Lily" drum kit. I audibly gasped when I turned a corner in #MetRockAndRoll and saw this pop-art beauty in a display about destruction and the rock and roll image. (Basically, it was a display about The Who.) The wall text explained that the two kick drums were replicas, as the originals had been destroyed in a pyrotechnic stunt. I'm guessing it's the first time that particular explanation has been needed at the Met?💣💥💣💥💣💥#metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #playitloud #rockandroll #keithmoon #thewho #lilylangtry #picturesoflily #patentbritishexplodingdrummer #60smusic #60srock #classicrock #popart #psychedelicart #psychedelic #1960s #60sart #drumset #drumkit #drummer #60s #autodestructiveart

name: 2019-09-08 18.00.36 2128300699646100462_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: - New York Impressions part2 -紐約行只有短短兩天，硬是塞入大都會博物館、古根漢美術館和Wicked，財金出身的我斷然捨棄去華爾街撫摸那一隻金牛 (感覺會很空虛哈哈)藝術氣息縈繞整座紐約城，讓人暫時忘卻地鐵難以忍受的腐朽氣味和結舌的物價，陶醉在白色線條相間的舒服觀賞空間裡，滿足於畢卡索的立體抽象作品，找一幅特別喜歡的畫，慢慢地、靜靜地想像畫家的心境及意象大都會博物館玲瑯滿目，特別喜愛莫內印象派的模糊又細膩、梵谷的豐富色彩及大膽線條、馬克·布拉德福德充滿活力跳躍的抽象，但 腳 hen 痠Wicked作為入門百老匯音樂劇很棒，在紐約每餐開始導入劇情介紹以防看不懂哈哈，舞台燈光、服裝效果震撼 (但我媽不知是否太累居然還可以睡著⋯)，音樂動人好聽，尤其是For Good這首，Elphaba與Glinda和好的感人瞬間”So much of me is made of what I've learned from you, you'll be with me like a handprint on my heart”泛淚～停留時間太短、遺珠一大堆，但仍對於紐約人很有個性印象深刻，不爽的話一定要開到你車旁，按一聲極長的喇叭讓你知道，再帥氣揚長而去。#newyork #nyc #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #guggenheimmuseum #wicked #broadway #timesquare

name: 2019-09-08 20.23.11 2128372468933749891_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of Art "The Grandchildren of Sir William Heathcote, 3rd Baronet". William Owen (British, Ludlow 1769–1825 London) Oil on canvas 140.3 x 171.5 "Внуки сэра Уильяма Хиткота, 3-его баронета." Уильям ОуэнУильям Оуэн был современником и соперником выдающегося английского художника сэра Томаса Лоуренса. На картине внуки знатного баронета  изображены в крестьянских одеждах. Пасторальность сюжету придают и венки, сплетённые из колосьев пшеницы.  Эта картина, выставленная в Королевской академии в 1806 году, является одним из почти десятка портретов, выполненных художником для членов семьи сэра Уильяма.  #childreninart  #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #owen  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #артиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-08 22.14.29 2128428483712647298_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Metropolitan Museum of ArtThe Sackville Children John Hoppner (British, London 1758–1810 London) 1796Oil on canvas152.4 x 124.5 cm1789 Джон Хопнер (1758-1810) был назначен портретистом принца Уэльсского, который позже взошел на трон как Георг IV.Сразу заслужив успех, он имел в течение жизни самых фешенебельных и богатых заказчиков и был самым большим конкурентом живописца короля Томаса Лоренса.  Лучше всего Хоппнеру удавались портреты женщин и детей.  Многие из его прекрасных портретов находятся во Дворце С-Джеймса. Как выразительны детские лица, позы на этом портрете! Мы можем предположить, что старшая сестра чем-то обидела младшую девочку. Брат же, как настоящий мужчина, встал между ними, чтобы прекратить ссору. Он нежно обнимает и защищает маленькую.Возможно, сестры просто чем-то расстроены,  брат же, в первую очередь, утешает малышку... Очень трогательный портрет. 💕 Дети третьего герцога Дорсетского были нарисованы в Knole, родовом поместье семьи Саквилла.  Это (слева направо): леди Мэри Саквилл (1792–1864); единственный сын герцога, лорд Мидлсекс (1793–1815), позже четвертый герцог Дорсетский;  и леди Элизабет Саквилл (1795–1870). Картина была выставлена ​​в 1797 году под названием «Портреты дворянских детей». Поза мальчика происходит от знаменитого портрета Генриха VIII Ганса Гольбейна.#childreninart  #johnhoppner #metropolitanmuseumofart#paintingchildren #kids #portrait  #портретнаяживопись #произведениеискусства  #искусствовечно #красотаспасетмир #инстаграммузей #дети #вмузее  #музейметрополитен #детскийпортрет #портрет #картиннаягалерея

name: 2019-09-08 23.31.06 2128467048905517172_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: „Robe à la Française, 1760–70, French“Standard European silhouettes of the eighteenth century accommodated a world of change and specifically a changing world dominated by new textile techniques from Asia and the Middle East. This French textile emulates ikat (a technique in which yarns are tie-dyed before weaving) in a manner then known as a result of a geographic mistake as chiné. The softened edges of the ikat do not mitigate a bold textile design, nor do they entirely surrender to the authority of the Western shaping. Pinked-edge pleated and ruched self-fabric (see detail) trace the form of the open robe. An eighteenth-century template of dress is all but unchanging, yet the influence of new material requires a syncretism. In terms of eighteenth-century revivals, it is important to recognize how much the classic forms of eighteenth-century dress accommodated translations into arresting new textile forms in the 1760s and even the new textiles in the cottons of the 1780s.Date: 1760–70Culture: FrenchMedium: silkCredit Line: Purchase, Irene Lewisohn Bequest, 1960Accession Number: C.I.60.40.2a, bhttps://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/82638#robealafrancaise #francaise #museum #fashionmuseum #metmuseum #metmuseumnyc #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #hautecouture  #chanel  #dior #allabout18thcentury #tagdesoffenendenkmals #18thcentury #warpprint #18thcenturyfashion @metmuseum

text: I had about as much fun as you can possibly have this morning during a 1 mile all out sprint! 🎉 What an amazing race that I will surely make sure to be back for again next year! Kinda went into it thinking I’ll try and stick with a 6:30 pace until the last 200-400m and then give it my all. When I passed the 1/4 mile mark in exactly 1:30 I thought ugh oh that’s a little fast and just told myself to maintain effort but I never looked at my watch again. So I was superrr extatic to see a 6:10 on the clock! 🎉 ..The crowd support along 5th avenue was awesome!! And I even got to sneak in a loop around Central Park after the race for a total of 7.5 miles today! ..#nb5thavemile #nyrr #1milerace #nycrunning #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-09 06.37.47 2128681808139663251_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Frankenstrat. Graphite sketch. Eddie Van Halen playing his custom-built “Frankenstrat” guitar, circa 1983. A hybrid of a Fender and a Gibson, the Frankenstrat, with its distinctive striped paint job, was used by Van Halen throughout the 70s and 80s. It was originally black and white on the cover of Van Halen’s debut album and was later repainted the red, black and white color scheme for which it is most recognizable. Retired in the 1990s, the original Frankenstrat guitar is currently on display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City. 🎸 #playitloud #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet #nyc #edwardvanhalen #eddievanhalen #vanhalen #frankenstrat #gibsonguitars #fenderguitars #guitargods #rockstars #rockguitar

name: 2019-09-09 06.58.36 2128692279951703712_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Treasure: 👉 Wall painting from Room H of the Villa of P. Fannius Synistor at Boscoreale / 50-40 BC Civilization: 🦅 Ancient Rome Where:📍#NewYork - Metropolitan MuseumPhoto: 📸 @metmuseum Family:👉 @europe_treasures👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @tesori_italiani✤ ✤ ✤This fresco painting (186.7 x 186.7cm) of a seated woman playing a kithara is from Room H, either a dining room (triclinium) or a room for social gatherings (oecus), in the villa at Boscoreale.Each of the paintings that originally adorned this room derives from the Greek tradition of megalographia, or large-scale painting, about which so much was written in antiquity; Apollinaris of Sidonius, Petronius in the Satyricon, and Vitruvius all shed light on the use of megalographia in Roman villas.In this fresco, the kithara player is depicted as a plump young woman clothed in a purple chiton and white himation. She is adorned with a bracelet, earrings, and headband with a central medallion, all of gold.A small figure of Atlas supports the arm of her elaborately carved chair that originally was lacquered a deep lustrous red. The instrument she plays is not a simple lyre, but a gilded kithara, a large concert instrument played by Apollo and professional musicians.Behind the seated woman stands a small girl wearing a sleeveless purple chiton. She, too, is adorned with a gold headband, bracelet, and loop earrings. Like portrait figures, the woman and the girl gaze directly at the spectator.Most recently it has been suggested that the pair may represent a Macedonian queen, or princess, and her daughter or younger sister. The gilded kithara and richly adorned, thronelike chair, as well as the carefully rendered gold jewelry and headbands, give the impression of royal personage. Whatever the exact subject, this painting and others in the villa were admired as excellent copies of Hellenistic art that emphasized the erudition and worldliness of the villa's owner.✤ ✤ ✤#italy #italia #archaeology #archeologia #arqueologia #arqueología #roman #roma #imperio #romanhistory #history #metropolitanmuseumofart #historia #archeologie #emperor #romanart #metmuseum #ancientrome #im

text: It’s been fun living on the Upper East Side and exploring all it has to offer. I can’t believe it’s almost been a year since we moved to NYC. Time flies!💫 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀The Met is probably my favorite thing about where we live. There is so much to see there that another trip is always a good idea. Even just playing in the fountains out front brings Jimmy so much entertainment. 🤣Of course he got drenched and I didn’t pack extra clothes...but that’s nothing that running through Central Park won’t fix! What did you do this weekend? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#uppereastside #nyc #newyorkcity #manhattan #ues #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #nycmuseums #nycmuseum #nyclife #nycliving #newyorkers #uppereastsiders #uppereastsidenyc #nyckids #citykids #momlife #lifewithkids #motherhood #nycblogger #fountain #happyweekend #bigmove #nycfamily #nycmom #sunday #travelkids #kidstravel #travelingwithkids #travelwithkids

name: 2019-09-09 08.45.02 2128745845315811804_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: To, że 21go odbędzie się uroczysta premiera mojej książki „Wyssane z palca”... chyba wiecie. 😉 To, że będzie ona debiutem w dłuższej formie literackiej - również kojarzycie! A ja lubię być dobrze przygotowana więc stwierdziłam, że muszę się dowiedzieć, jak wygląda taki event. Dedykacje i te sprawy. A kto mógłby mi udzielić lepszej lekcji niż Anna Wintour, legendarna redaktor naczelna magazynu Vogue? 😁I teraz już wiem! Gruby pisak, wielkie litery... i przeciwsłoneczne okulary. Kochani @studiooptyczne_44, poratujecie? 😁A tak na serio - zobaczcie fotki z rewelacyjnej wystawy CAMP: Notes on fashion. Warto było odstać godzinę w kolejce. Od dziś będę inaczej patrzeć na @vogue.polska. 🙃#metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #travelgirl #usalover #camp #notesonfashion #museum #metmuseumnyc #nowyjork #fashionismypassion #fashionlover #dimora #karinabulawa #metcamp #vogue #voguecamp #annawintour

name: 2019-09-09 09.42.23 2128774713703725453_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Some brief glimpses of the Met’s rich offerings. Some are famous, some much less so. More than anything I was glad to see the first painting shown, which is Pieter Bruegel the Elder’s ‘The Harvesters’. Painted in 1565, it was one of a series of six showing different times of the year. The depiction of normal life instead of a religious topic was a watershed for Western art. I still skip most art before the 16th century because I tire of seeing a series of paintings that often show little more than a crucifixion, Madonna and Child, crucifixion, Madonna and Child... etc etc. #metropolitanmuseumofart #pieterbruegeltheelder #theharvesters #caravaggio #thedenialofsaintpeter #vilhelmhammershøi #moonlightstrandgade30 #xaviermellery #thedoors #maximilienluce #morninginterior #guataveperrot #vincentvangogh #wheatfieldwithcypresses #markrothko #no13whiteredonyellow

text: Paul Cézanne, The gulf of Marseille Seen from L’Estaque, 1885 #19thcentury #frenchart #painting #metropolitanmuseumofart #impressionism #postimpressionism - - -Just come back from #marseille and already missing the colors of the city and the fierce light.Cézanne was born in #provence and depicted it in many paintings.He seeked to simplify the representation of nature to geometric forms and colors, abandoning the use of black outlines and perspective.Over the white hill on the left it’s possible to see the shape of the beloved church of Notre Dame de la Garde.#historyofart #arthistory #dailyart #publicdomain #artlovers #artoftheday #artofinstagram #artdailydose #paulcezanne

text: 🔸“On the Beach, Dieppe” 1864, by French artist, Eugène Boudin (French, Honfleur 1824–1898 Deauville) 🔸 @metmuseum 🔸🔸🔸 “The changing skies of France's Channel coast and the fashionable crowds on the resort beaches were Eugèn Boudin's lifelong subjects. 🔸These pictures were avidly collected, ensuring the artist's success. 🔸In 1863 he commented: "They love my little ladies on the beach, and some people say that there's a thread of gold to exploit there."~MET🔸🔸🔸 #eugeneboudin #frenchartists #kingofskies #metropolitanmuseumofart #nycmuseum #artoftheday #arthistory #artoflooking #artblogging #beachscene #blackclouds #changingskies #beachesresorts #loveart #arttalks 🔸🔸🔸

name: 2019-09-09 22.37.01 2129164598889116527_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Play It Loud - The Instruments of Rock & Roll is an exhibit at @metropolitanmuseum highlighting instruments that not only created iconic recordings and performances but serve as some of the most important cultural touchstones in recent history. They certainly feel that way to me. I can’t begin to say how in awe I was to be so close to these works of art that touched my life so powerfully. Shown here are (in order of the pictures) are instruments from the Beatles, Prince, Eric Clapton, Led Zeppelin, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Joan Jett (with a hint of Steve Miller), KISS (with a glimpse of Ronnie Wood and Heart), The Eagles, and Prince (again). So many to see that it needs one more post to show. Coming soon....The exhibit runs through Oct. 1. It is more than worth checking out!..... #adventuresindogsandrealestate #petfriendlyrealtor #petfriendly #realestateagent #realtorlife #nycphotographer #nycphotography #playitloud #photoview #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #nyc #themet #thebeatles #prince #ericclapton #ledzeppelin #cityphotography #stevierayvaughan #igphoto #joanjett #kiss #photography #theeagles #ig_nyc #photographer #realtorlife #midtownmanhattan #midtown #museum

name: 2019-09-10 00.00.06 2129206423700114828_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: „Portrait of a Woman, said to be Madame Charles Simon Favart (Marie Justine Benoîte Duronceray, 1727–1772) by François Hubert Drouais French, 1757In 1745 Mademoiselle Duronceray, a singer, dancer, and comedienne, married Charles Simon Favart (1710–1792) , the father of French comic opera. Among her best known roles was that of the heroine in The Loves of Bastien and Bastienne, 1753, in which she inspired a revolution in theatrical costume by wearing authentic peasant dress. Drouais's elegant secular portrait recalls traditional representations of Saint Cecilia, patron saint of music.Medium: Oil on canvasDimensions: 80 x 64.8 cmCredit Line: Mr. and Mrs. Isaac D. Fletcher Collection, Bequest of Isaac D. Fletcher, 1917Accession Number: 17.120.210https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/436213#metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #museum #francoishubertdrouais #françoishubertdrouais #drouais #operasinger #comedians #comicopera #hautecouture #dior #chanel #gucci #bastienandbastienne #french #neyyorkcity #lace #musician #bluedress #instruments @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-10 02.22.58 2129278323338020874_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: E is for... Earrings. These elegant drop earrings date to c. 1850. Gold filigree and fine seed pearls surround the elegant oval shaped garnets. Of American origin, these ornaments would have been expensive and are thus likely to have been owned by a woman of some note. Earrings housed at The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Pen, ink and crayon drawing, 2019. #earrings #earring #garnet #atoz #artofinstagram #artist #artistsofinstagram #artistoninstagram #gold #pearls #seedpearls #filigree #golden #1850 #metropolitanmuseumofart #history #dresshistory #preciousstones #jewellery #jewels #victorian

text: "My daily turpentine / 09.09.19..."14" diameter2019Archival inkjetEdition of five.."These images are a documented diary of the accumulation of oil colours cleansed from brushes. These are the final tints of turpentine from the daily painting in his studio. Eaach photograph showcases the often overlooked processes of an artist. In each image one is allowed to see beauty in the incidental."~Nathaniel Galka..📸 @myloveishugeCopyright 2019..#americanartist #photography #chinoiserie #flowers #nathanielgalkaart #nathanielgalka #nycgallery #magicalrealism #kunst #artstudio #art #gaynyc #newyorkartist #nyc #newyorkcity #fineart #interiordesign #painting #losangelesartist #gallery #artphotography#landscape #paintedflowers #instagay #metropolitanmuseumofart #contemporaryartist #instagramartist #dutchmasters #contemporaryphotography

text: From September 12, Goa-based performance artist Nikhil Chopra will present a 9-day performance at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. For nine consecutive days, Chopra will live within the Museum as he presents his performance titled, Lands, Waters, Skies.Chopra, who is the 2019-20 Artist in Residence at the Met, is the first artist in the Museum’s 150 year history to actually live within the museum for any duration of time.#nikhilchopra #indianartist #performingarts #prrformingartist #metropolitanmuseumofart #india #newyork

name: 2019-09-10 11.36.26 2129556893373421917_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Opening of The Facade Commission by @wangechimutu entitled “The New Ones, will free US”, kicking off the sesquicentennial celebration of the founding of The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Mutu is both a brilliant scholar and artist. Hearing her speak recalled fond memories of the best art history lectures one ever had in college. When the current Fifth Avenue facade was completed in 1905, the economy was such that money did not exist to complete the planned sculpture for the facade. The niches remained empty until now, and the uncarved blocks of stone still remain above the columns. Mutu completed her four sculptures in a remarkably short nine months. #thenewoneswillfreeus #wangechimutu  #metropolitanmuseumofart #richardmorrishunt

text: “The beautiful shawls of Kashmir...adorned the proudest beauties at the court of Caesar...”‘Shawl Making’ by the editors of Lalla Rookh Publications. The Kashmiri shawl is renowned for its fine texture, colour, and design, and the tradition of artistic designs and woven patterns is synonymous with Kashmir’s verdant ecology. 'Shawl-Making' focuses on the living tradition of shawl-making and the socio-economic challenges faced by the weaver’s community in Kashmir. Visit the CC website to read the full essay as part of CC's Art History project......Images:(Left): Shawl makers in Kashmir, Chromolithograph, 1867.(Right): Detail from Motif from Kashmiri shawl: Pheerozee, gouache on paper, circa 1822-23...#criticalcollective #cc #ccarthistory #cconkashmir #williamsimpson #kashmirishawls #weaving #britishlibrary #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #chromolithograph #print #lallarookh #thomasmoore #poem #indianart #kashmiriart #weaverscommunity #tangibleculturalheritage #artandcrafts #pashmina #design #handicrafts #museumcollections @metmuseum @britishmuseum @britishlibrary @nmnewdelhi

name: 2019-09-10 14.56.56 2129657810995363479_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: W/ @conciergeq & URHere @metmuseum | Isn’t this such a powerful sculpture?! I’m absolutely in love.The Facade Commission: Wangechi Mutu, The NewOnes, will free UsKenyan-American artist Wangechi Mutu has been selected to create sculptures for The Met's Fifth Avenue facade niches—the first-ever such installation on the Museum's historic exterior—inaugurating a new annual artist commission series.Born in Nairobi in 1972 and trained in sculpture at Yale, from which she received her MFA in 2000, Wangechi Mutu is one of the most distinguished artists of her generation. She has achieved critical acclaim for her haunting, otherworldly collage—paintings, art-films, live performances, and sculptures. Comprised of either bronze or organic materials, Mutu's three-dimensional work depicts formidable figures referencing modern and classical mythologies that conflate histories and sculptural traditions of Africa and Europe. Like her collage-paintings, Mutu's sculptures reflect critically on social and ecological injustices and inequalities. Female transformation and empowerment are at the core of all her ideas and evidence in the completed work.Where:	The Met Fifth Avenue, Facadelocated outside at 82nd Street and Fifth AvenuePhotographed by @charlie_portraits#metmuseum #wangechimutu #art #bronze #sculpture #museum #ny #nyny #nyc #newyorkcity #fineart #artist #sculptor #beautiful #woman #african #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #love #gorgeous #breathtaking #elegant

text: Greek marble head of a youth from a relief, late 4th century B.C.⠀Said to have been found at Ialysos, Rhodes - Metropoliatan Museum of Art⠀@metmuseum⠀This head probably was part of a large, elaborate grave monument. The strongly projecting forehead and deep-set eyes, which give an intense expression to the face, are similar in style to works that have been associated with Skopas, a famous sculptor of the fourth century B.C. On view at The Met Fifth Avenue in Gallery 153⠀⠀#stomouseio #Skopas #archaeologyart #history #ancient #archaeology #archeologia #arte #archaeological #art #arthistory #travel #historic #تركيا #トルコ #旅行 #archéologie #写真撮影 #arqueología #ancientcivilization #ancienthistory #marble #greek #head #MET #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

name: 2019-09-10 20.07.41 2129814221760207191_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 3 year old pic this is. I tried to wear this dress today after around 2 years and it decided to NOT fit into me 🤔 I had mixed feelings. I was happy, I gained a few kilos but sad as I will have to give away one of my fav dresses 😆 I have had my share of body shamming experiences. You are so thin, are you not well? Do you eat properly? You have grown thinner Blah blah Even though I have always been a self confident person, when I was younger, it used to affect me. Especially, during my teenage and early twenties. I blamed it on my premature birth (I am 7 month born). I gave excuses. Now, as I am growing older, I laugh at those comments. Pity their ignorance. My focus is on leading a healthy life. Though I try to gain a few kilos, I concentrate more on my health than my physical shapes and size. It comes as a surprise to many that I am a hardcore foodie and my diet is absolutely normal. In fact I eat anything and everything, and off course way more than you think. So be careful when you invite me to your home next 😋 My humble request: Kindly don't say " Why are you fat or why are you thin!" Especially, when you have no other good things to say. I mean think about the question, you might be asking in the most innocent tone but is this even a logical question! #randommusing#randommusings#againstbodyshamming#bodyshamming#metropolitanmuseumofart#throwback😍#nyc#newyork#photooftheday #blogger #writersofinsta #ilovetowrite #storyteller#travelblogger #aspiringwriter #amazonkdp #writersofinstagram

text: The sculptures of the seated women are part of the first ever commissioned work for the #metropolitanmuseumofart facade, entitled, The New Ones will Free Us, by #wangechimutu Amazing work. The piece on the top left, Ndoro Na Miti (guardians of female identity) was part of Mutu’s show at the Gladstone gallery in 2017. Mutu’s discussion of her work last night was so inspiring and her art, simply stunning. Thank you Met Museum for bringing her work to us on such a grand scale. #artislife #thenewoneswillfreeus #artoninstagram

text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. One of the most inspirational places for art and fashion hosted an exhibition called CAMP. It explores the origins of Camp’s exuberant aesthetic and how the sensibility evolved from a place of marginality to become an important influence on mainstream culture. In the exhibit there were legendary designers such as Andy Warhol, Vivienne Westwood, Mary Katrantzou, Elsa Schiaparelli, Yves Saint Laurent, Paul Poiret, House Of Moschino, Balenciaga and several other designers evolving in their fashion journey and inculcating structures and colours into their designs.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀#DelnaPoonawallaDesigns #InspirationalNYC #NYC #NewYork #NewYorkCity #NYCInspired #MET #MetropolitanMuseumOfArt #Camp #CampExhibition #FashionInspo #AndyWarhol #Balenciaga #HouseOfMoschino #VivienneWestwood #MaryKatrantzou #InternationalDesigners #DelnaPoonawalla  #HolidayDiaries #HolidayInspiration #DesignInspo #Designer

name: 2019-09-10 23.35.27 2129918785742101925_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A proud  and wonderful moment last night attending the inauguration of Wangechi Mutu’s sculptures on the facade of the Metropolitan Museum - the first ever commission of its kind for the museum to adorn the four empty pedestals flanking the Met”s imposing entrance. The Met’s director Max Hollein and Head of Contemporary art  Sheena Wagstaff gave opening speeches followed by a great talk between Wangechi and the curators and a party in the great hall of the museum. I’ll post more images from all of the above in my insta story later today. #wangechimutu #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitan #themet #met #sculpture #publicsculpture #contemporarysculpture #contemporaryart #manhattan #newyork @wangechistudio @wangechimutu @metmuseum @victoriamirogallery @gladstone.gallery @vielmetter

name: 2019-09-11 00.31.23 2129946941124176911_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Jean-Pierre de Bougainville,1760Louis de Carmontelle FrenchBorn Louis Carrogis, the son of a cobbler, Carmontelle used his wit and talent to elevate his social position, eventually becoming employed in the d’Orléans court, where his duties included tutoring the duke’s son, designing gardens, and staging plays. As a draftsman, he left a legacy of 750 watercolor portraits, representing a broad swath of enlightenment society. The sitter, the scholar Jean-Pierre de Bougainville, was named to the Académie des Inscriptions and then, with the backing of Madame de Pompadour, elected to the Académie Française in 1754. De Bougainville would die at age forty, "a real loss for the world of letters," according to a manuscript penned near the end of Carmontelle’s life by his friend Richard de Lédans.Perrin Stein, March 2015Artist: Louis de Carmontelle (French, Paris 1717–1806 Paris)Date: 1760Medium: Watercolor over graphite and black and red chalkDimensions: sheet: 30 x 19 cmClassification: DrawingsCredit Line: Gift of Mrs. Charles Wrightsman, 2004Accession Number: 2004.475.6#louisdecarmontelle #carmontelle #rococo #french #paris #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #museum #redsuit #18thcenturyinterior #interior #genrepainting #18thcentury #menwithstyle #instgay #allabout18thcentury #instagay @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-11 00.50.12 2129956412061700692_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: For the first time in 100 years, the #MetropolitanMuseumofArt is filling the exterior niches lining its Fifth Avenue entrance! The Museum tapped Kenyan-born artist #WangechiMutu to inaugurate its new artist facade series commission with four sculptures, which will be on view this week through January 12th. To adorn the entrance, Mutu constructed four bronze statues of seated women, all of whom are crowned, blinded and gagged by highly polished discs. "Born of traditions both European and African, these graceful, commanding figures will change the face of the museum, literally and figuratively," the @nytimes writes. "It is testament to Mutu's belief that, like street theater or religious rituals, art can nudge viewers toward congregation." 📸: @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-11 03.10.15 2130026900471761299_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Marble Statue Group of the Three Graces,2nd century A.D.Roman copy of a Greek work of the 2nd century B.C.These young girls, linked in a dance-like pose, represent The Three Graces: Aglaia (Beauty), Euphrosyne (Mirth), and Thalia (Abundance). They bestow what is most pleasurable and beneficent in nature and society: fertility and growth, beauty in the arts, harmonious reciprocity between men. They enjoyed venerable cults in Greece and Asia Minor. In mythology, they play an attendant role, gracing festivals and organizing dances. Their closest connection is with Aphrodite, whom they serve as handmaidens.This carefully calculated, frieze-like composition is typical of classicizing art of the second and first centuries B.C. Instantly recognizable, it soon became the canonic formula for representing the Graces, who appeared in every medium and on every kind of object, from mirrors to sarcophagi. On view at The Met Fifth Avenue in Gallery 162 #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #met #gallery162 #virtualartgallery #groupofthethreegraces #marble #marblesculptures #aglaia #euphrosyne #thalia @metmuseum @museumholic @museum @sculpture_gallery

name: 2019-09-11 06.52.42 2130138866072882227_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The advent of the microscope in the early seventeenth century revolutionized the manner in which people saw insects. In about 1600, ants, bees, and butterflies garnered most scholarly attention, owing to their significance in biblical and classical sources. By the eighteenth century, the range of insects that were subjects of study had expanded in tandem with a new interest in understanding insects’ anatomies. The two smaller, less familiar insects depicted in this drawing operate as a framing device for the large blue beetle at its center. Come see this drawing along with a selection of insect imagery on view in The Met's Robert Wood Johnson, Jr. Gallery (Gallery 690) through November 13!Anonymous, Dutch, 17th century ?, Studies of a Blue Beetle and Insects. Gouache and watercolor. Bequest of Catherine G. Curran, 2008 (2008.427)#naturestudy #bug #beetle #coprophanaeusensifer #17thcentury #gouache #watercolor #insect #currentlyonview #noneedtoguess #metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #themet

text: Extraordinary hand-engraving on these small antique silver whatzits.  They have gilt highlights in certain parts, and everything is hand cut and pierced.  They are basically completely flat (a few shallow repoussé contours), nearly all of the depth in the images comes from the engraved details and oxidized shadows.  There are no pins or stems or holes to indicate they were ever attached to anything.  No signs of having been removed from something else.  I'm just not sure.  They appear to have quite a bit of age, probably late 19C.  All of that detail on pieces that are just 4 1/2" and 3 3/4" long.  Ideas?#antiquesilver #vintagesilver #handengraving #sawpiercing #chasing#antiquejewelry #antiquejewellery #victorianjewelry #antiques #antiquedealersofinstagram#engraving #masterpiece #art #victorianart #sterlingsilver #masterengraver #detail #tinythings #miniatures #workofart#metalwork #silversmith #coolstuff #museumquality #metropolitanmuseumofart#victorianstyle #handmade #antiquebrooch #vintagejewelry #vintagejewellery

name: 2019-09-11 16.01.08 2130414901399425051_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Terracotta kernos (vase for multiple offerings),ca. 2300–2200 B.C. Early Cycladic III–Middle Cycladic I - The Metropolitan Museum of Art @metmuseumAlthough the kernos was used in widely disparate regions during the prehistoric period, particularly impressive examples have come to light in the Cyclades, and this is one of the grandest preserved. The receptacles probably contained foodstuffs of various kinds or perhaps of flowers. On view at The Met Fifth Avenue in Gallery 151#stomouseio #kernos #archaeologyart #history #ancient #archaeology #archeologia #arte #archaeological #art #arthistory #travel #historic #تركيا #トルコ #旅行 #archéologie #写真撮影 #arqueología #ancientcivilization #ancienthistory #terracotta #cycladic #cyclades #met #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-11 16.13.49 2130421286765862601_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: According to her legend, St Juliana of Nicomedia was cruelly tortured and eventually beheaded for refusing to marry a pagan lord. She was widely venerated later in the Middle Ages, not least in Perugia where a convent was dedicated to her honour. In 1376, Abbess Gabriella of Santa Guiliana convinced the neighbouring monastery of San Domenico to hand over their relic of St Juliana's head, thus acquiring for her convent a powerful relic of their patron saint. Gabriella had this head reliquary commissioned from an artist working in the circle of celebrated sculptor Giovanni di Bartolo to house the relic, and furthermore had an elaborate gilded tabernacle constructed to display it. Some time after the Convent of Santa Guiliana was suppressed in 1862, this reliquary bust fell into private hands. It was bought by the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York in 1961.⁠⠀•⁠⠀•⁠⠀•⁠⠀#legend #hagiography #saints #saint #catholicsaint #stjuliana #martyr #martyrdom #middleages #moyenage #mittelalter #medioevo #edadmedia #perugia #santaguiliana #patronsaint #head #relic #reliquary #fourteenthcentury #latemedieval #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #nycart #medievalart #medieval #medievalsculpture #medievalhistory #medievalitaly

name: 2019-09-11 16.16.38 2130422698492668030_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Posted @withrepost • @glennscottwright Wangechi in the studio with one of her sculptures before their inauguration on the facade of the Merropolitan Museum - the first ever commission of its kind for the museum to adorn the four empty pedestals flanking the Met’s imposing entrance. The Met’s director Max Hollein and Head of Contemporary art  Sheena Wagstaff gave opening speeches followed by a great talk between Wangechi and the curators and a party in the great hall of the museum. More images from all of the above in my insta story. #wangechimutu #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseum #metropolitan #themet #met #sculpture #publicsculpture #contemporarysculpture #contemporaryart #manhattan #newyork @wangechistudio @wangechimutu @metmuseum @victoriamirogallery @gladstone.gallery @vielmetter

name: 2019-09-11 21.02.11 2130566425604132196_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Maria Sol painting for Jacques Kaplan (1924-2008), an absurdist furrier and art gallery owner , who invited artists to paint on his coats. The artists had absolute freedom to do whatever they wanted and Maria Sol  painted in 1963 a then rather risqué female nude torso on a coat, now part of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Collection. “My aim in life is to be as happy as possible, and make as happy as possible the people I like,” Kaplan once said. “That is the only kind of social mission.” Well, his attitude to art, artists and coats is still a delight. (obviously we have learned since the 60ies and all say NO to fur now though). AV for bbookproject.com#bbookproject #curiositycures # breast cancer awareness #letstalkbreast #jacqueskaplan #coats #mariasol #marisol #metropolitanmuseumofart #femalenude #breasts

text: Missing New York. It is the most beautifully imperfect city. I still remember hearing news of what happened today and the chaos that surrounded me. Through all the tragedy, this beautiful city rebuilt itself through camaraderie. I’m thankful to have experienced the city I love and admire with the best of friends. 👯‍♀️👯‍♀️ #ny #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #akdphi #uhakdphi #sisters #bestfriends

name: 2019-09-12 00.16.48 2130664381679621597_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Ok last one from “Jewelry for America”: Necklace in platinum, diamond & natural pearl. Made by NYC firm Dreicer & Co c.1905 and a perfect example of the type of jewelry favored by America’s Gilded Age elite. Dreicer is not well-known today but they were one of the most important jewelers in the US through the 1920s. Their flagship building, by architects Warren & Wetmore (who designed the current Grand Central Station), still stands on the corner of 5th Ave & 46th Street, but now it is a store for Oakley sunglasses :(. #jewelry #jewellery #gildedage #edwardianjewelry #antiquejewelry #antiquejewellery #vintagejewelry #platinum #pearl #naturalpearls #diamond #dreicer #dreicerandco #metropolitanmuseumofart #necklace #museumjewelry #belleepoque #warrenandwetmore

To catch a fish when you are hungry, cut the boughs of a tree, make a fire to roast it, and eat it in the open air, is the greatest of all luxuries. name: 2019-09-12 12.04.17 2131020469892506861_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: #MetCamp: Salvatore Ferragamo's 1938 "Rainbow" platform sandals were custom-made for Judy Garland, and re-popularized platform shoes in Western culture. Gucci's 2017 rainbow platform sneakers were inspired by Club Kids and Gilbert Baker's pride flag. I love the almost 80 years of gay culture on display here.🌈👠🌈👠🌈👠#metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #metcostumeinstitute #fashion #notesoncamp #salvatoreferragamo #ferragamoshoes #judygarland #overtherainbow #gucci #guccisneakers #gucciresort2017 #rainbowshoes #rainbowplatforms #gilbertbaker #rainbowflag #campculture #gayculture #campfashion #1930sfashion #vintagefashion #vintage #2010sfashion #themorethingschangethemoretheystaythesame

name: 2019-09-12 12.32.42 2131034763789034111_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The shopfront from 3, quai de Bourbon, Ile Saint-Louis, Paris, between 1775-77 (with later replacements) is displayed in the Wrightsman Galleries of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, NYC, as a gift from J. Pierpont Morgan, 1920.  As seen in the Chester Price rendering from House & Garden magazine, 1927, it had been added to a seventeenth century building, a rare survivor of retail architecture of the Louis XVI period.  By the time it was dismantled during World War I, the paint had worn away to expose the bare oak so the natural finish was retained in the restoration for the museum in keeping with the tastes of the time.•#metropolitanmuseumofart #wrightsmangalleries #chesterbprice #architecturalrendering #houseandgarden #louisxvi ##periodroomsofthemet #retailarchitecture #shopfront #jpmorgan

It is crazy what I got to see. ...I think it's really really interesting what the art of a time period says about the artists, and especially the time it was created in.
