name: 2019-09-13 00.27.28 2131394518511930552_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Art 💫💔!..NY даёт возможность развиваться многогранно. Сотни выставок, показов, школ, мастерклассов, музеев, галерей, шоу, клубов, кухня всех стран мира.. здесь есть всё! Было бы желание! Лайфхак вам по посещениям некоторых музеев. У кого есть карта резидента/студенческий, могут заплатить за тикет в музей хоть 1$ вместо 20-40$. Всё сделано для того, чтобы каждый мог себе позволить посмотреть. Не беда если у вас нет этой карты, главное, чтобы у кого-то из друзей была. Они смогут вам взять билет по минимальной цене, которую вы себе сами устанавливаете. Ну круто же придумали!!.The Metropolitan Museum of Art - один из самых крупных и 4й по посещаемости художественный музей мира. Больше всего мне понравилось римское и греческое искусство. Коллекция около 17 000 экспонатов, эпохи от Неолита до принятия Римской империей христианство в 312 году нашей эры. Многим экспозициям искусству Азии около 4000 лет. А ещё Египет, Океания, Африка, Америка...17 отделений, посвящённых искусству разных частей света..Оригинальные экспонаты тысячелетней давности, вызвали нереальные эмоции..Бал Met Gala проходит именно в этом музее..#nyc #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #metgala #photography #art #usa #vogue

name: 2019-09-13 02.08.35 2131445411248191540_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: #RichardMorrisHunt (1827–1895), a leading #architect of the #GildedAge, designed the facade of the #MetropolitanMuseumofArt, the pedestal of the #StatueofLiberty, and many other public and private projects. For his Administration Building at the World's Columbian Exhibition in Chicago in 1893, Hunt received the Gold Medal of the Royal Institute of British Architects. After Hunt's death, #DanielChesterFrench (1850-1931) was commissioned to create a #memorial consisting of a pair of standing figures representing the arts of #Painting & #Sculpture on one side and of #Architecture (holding a model of Hunt's Administration building in Chicago) on the other, both flanking French's portrait of Hunt. The memorial is located on Fifth Avenue and 70th Street in #NewYork, across the street from the Frick Museum. Here is French’s maquette for the figure of Architecture. 12.5 inches high, #bronze. #ADAAGalleries #AmericanSculpture

name: 2019-09-13 10.20.02 2131692767734086275_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🇺🇲 Essa é a mistura do Brasil com o Egito... Quem completar a letra corretamente ganha um joinha!Hoje foi dia de conhecer o  Metropolitan Museum of Art, que tem um monte de peças originais do Egito Antigo. É um dos mais completos do mundo sobre a História do Egito. Mas lá não tem só coisa sobre o Egito não, o museu é gigante, e tem quadros, esculturas e exposições sobre muitos temas. Vale muito a pena e está incluso no City Pass de Nova York.Também conhecemos o monumento "hope", caminhamos pela 5th Avenue, lanchamos no The Plaza Food Hall, fomos num pedacinho do Central Park, e comemos uma ótima pizza na Serafina Fabulous Pizza.Veja detalhes do nosso roteiro no linkhttps://www.ariquezadeviajar.com/2019/08/roteiro-de-viagem-canada-e-eua-lado.html#viagem #viajar #mochilao #mochileiros #blogdeviagem #viagens #turismo #travel #backpacker #backpacking #traveler #missãovt  #worldtravelpics #world_besthdr #revistaviajar #beautifuldestinations #skyscannerbrasil #viajenaviagem #trip #mochileirosgrupofechado #wanderlust #canadá #canada #estadosunidos #eua #usa #novayork #newyork #ny #metropolitanmuseumofart

text: #MetCamp: If I ever get married, it probably won't be in this @thombrowneny suit (as much as I love Thom Browne, good lord), but I really appreciate how beautiful and fun this androgynous wedding ensemble is. I mean, look at those shoes! And the mismatched socks! I can't wait to see what the future of wedding fashion brings for those of us who fall outside the suit/gown dichotomy.🔔👰🏾🤵🏻🔔#metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #metcostumeinstitute #fashion #notesoncamp #thombrowne #thombrowness18 #thombrownesuit #weddingsuit #weddinggown #weddingshoes #weddingfashion #bridalcouture #alternativewedding #alternativebride #nonbinary #androgynous #gendernonconforming #genderqueer #genderqueerfashion #nonbinaryfashion #nonbinarywedding #queerwedding #lgbtq #campculture #gayculture #campfashion #2010sfashion

name: 2019-09-13 12.48.04 2131767277767182926_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Moving away from the renaissance, we back into the middle ages. Specifically some arms and armor, from different places around the world. ...Europe, Japan, a dash of the middle East. (We'll get to that later, I could gush about the Islamic empire for five hours)....I'm not a fan of war, or death. However military history, strategy, and technology are fascinating to me. It's like watching a tactical game more fascinating than many fantasy stories, and scientific advancements that were only thought of due to the pressures and hardships of war. ....Despite many of the... Rough, elements of the time period. There's a lot that fascinates me about it, and that I enjoy hearing about/studying.......#middleages #medival #armor #armsandarmor #weapons #medivalwar #knight #knights #samurai #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitain #met #museum #strategy

text: Marble female figure, 2600–2400 B.C. Early Cycladic IIAttributed to the Bastis Master - The Metropolitan Museum of Art @metmuseumThe recognition of distinct artistic personalities in Cycladic sculpture is based upon recurring systems of proportion and details of execution. The stylization of the human body that is elegant almost to the point of mannerism is characteristic of the Bastis Master. name: 2019-09-13 18.25.27 2131937090387819799_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 📌 Caravaggio, The musicians, 1595, Oil on canvas, 92 cm × 118.5 cm, Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York City. 🇮🇹~The picture shows four boys in quasi-Classical costume, three playing various musical instruments or singing, the fourth dressed as Cupid and reaching towards a bunch of grapes. The picture is an allegory relating music to the sustenance of love in the same way that food is the sustenance of life.~Do you like Caravaggio?

name: 2019-09-13 19.56.01 2131982676375244607_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Nueva York es como una caja de sorpresas. En esta ciudad puedes encontrar de todo. En Fort Tryon Park se encuentra The Cloisters, un museo subsede del Metropolitan Museu of Art (Met) en el que podemos encontrar elementos arquitectónicos de varias abadías medievales o iglesias europeas, edificios europeos que fueron desmontados piedra a piedra y luego enviados a Nueva York para montarlos de nuevo.Si quieres ver más fotografías en blanco y negro de este lugar te invito a pasar por @javierbwlife donde comparto habitualmente imágenes en blanco y negro. Serás bienvenido 😉#NuevaYork #NewYork #travel #instatravel #travelgram #thecloisters #met #arquitectura #architecture #arquitecture #nyc #metropolitan #metropolitanmuseumofart #travelphoto #travelphotography #newyorklife #iloveny #museum #streetphoto #forttryonpark # #building #landscape #tripics #travelpic #traveling #travelling #Manhattan #citythatneversleeps #

name: 2019-09-13 23.00.23 2132075468766414442_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The Horse Fair by Rosa Bonheur, 1850s...The Horse Fair depicts dealers selling horses at the horse market held on the Boulevard de l’Hôpital, Paris. The notorious hospital of Salpêtrière can be seen in the left background. Bonheur submitted it to the Salon of 1853. This work led to Bonheur's international fame and recognition. Rosalia Shriver writes: "When it was finally finished and exhibited at the Salon of 1853, its creator was only 31 years old. Yet no other woman had ever achieved a work of such force and brilliance; and no other animal painter had produced a work of such size."..Bonheur painted The Horse Fair from a series of sketches of Percherons, and other draft horses, which she had made at the Paris horse market on the Boulevard de l'Hôpital. She attended the market twice weekly for a year and a half from summer of 1850 to the end of 1851. She sought a permission de travestissement from the Paris police to dress as a man, to avoid drawing attention to herself. In 1835, she had studied at a Paris slaughterhouse, a typical activity for an animal painter, and experienced harassment as a visible woman.In addition to studies at the Paris horse market, she also modeled her animals on those from the Paris Omnibus Company.It has been suggested that one of the human figures is a self-portrait..The first engraving of the work was made by Jules Jacques Veyrassat during the Paris Salon of 1853, while the often-reproduced engraving by Thomas Landseer helped it achieve a wide popularity.Painter Molly Luce claimed that The Horse Fair was the first work which influenced her in her decision to become an artist, and the work also inspired a young Wayne Thiebaud.Boneur's brother, Isidore Bonheur, cast a bronze relief plaque based on the painting for her monument at Fontainebleau. In the literary world, The Horse Fair inspired a 2000 anthology by poet Robin Becker...The painting was bought by art dealer, Ernest Gambart, then William Parkinson Wright, then A. T. Stewart, and then Cornelius Vanderbilt II who later donated it to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York in 1887. #art -- wikipedia.org

name: 2019-09-14 03.05.35 2132198877410234136_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Hey guys! Long time no talk/posts/anything at all. Here are a couple of my Friday thoughts. ⭐️This is a painting that stopped me at @metmuseum this summer. I am a girl just like her, I stare out of windows. Sometimes because I’m longing. Sometimes because I’m lost. Sometimes because the sunlight just drenches me with joy. Sometimes because rain makes me giddy. Sometimes because watching people is really funny. Sometimes because it’s not. Sometimes because I’m actually just staring out the window steadying my gaze, while I wander around a memory in my mind’s eye. ✨Everythinggggggg feels so poignant and temporal and nostalgic right now. And its brilliant and it hurts at the same time? I just binge watched the first season of Fleabag last night and ate two huge pieces of cake. Glean from that what you will.... 😂👏🏼I am anchored by this right now: “Joy is not made to be a crumb.” Which is from a Mary Oliver poem, aRe We ShOcKeD?! (If you know me, you know that I read her poetry almost every day.) 💛I am so thankful for my life and every little ordinary thing in it that I could just cry. 🎈I decided I would keep this account for little moments like this and see if makes anyone feel a little less lonely and a little more inspired. Because the truth is, I just don’t love social media enough to keep it up consistently. But she will be here for these little windows that you are more than welcome to sit and look out of. 💫 It’s a harvest moon tonight, don’t miss it! Much love, y’all. 🌚🌝•••••#balthus #ordinarythings #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #maryoliverpoetry #autumnalthoughts #harvestmoon #manisagiddything

name: 2019-09-14 03.25.21 2132208832607358536_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 🐥b o o k • r e v i e w🐥.When I heard that The Goldfinch was being made into a movie I immediately set a goal that I had to read it before the movie came out (today sept 13). I had previously read Donna Tartt’s The Secret History and loved it so I figured I would enjoy The Goldfinch as well. In case you don’t know, The Goldfinch centers around a NYC boy, Theo, in the aftermath of a life changing explosion at the Met. Tragically, Theo lost his mother in the explosion, but he walked out with a world-famous painting, The Goldfinch, that would take him on a journey that would last a decade..Overall, I enjoyed this book and once you finish reading my thoughts on it you’ll probably be confused as to why I rated it so high, but like I said I did like it as a whole. First off, I find this book to be kind of like watching the bachelor or pretty little liars; I don’t really like it or any of the people but I can’t stop watching cause I want to know what happens. For a large chunk of this book I literally had no idea what the plot was. It read kind of like Napoleon Dynamite where it’s soooo long but literally nothing happens. The rising action is so drawn out only for the climax, falling action, and resolution to take place within the last 50-100 pages of this 771 page novel. How annoying?? Also because I have a short attention span, with books like this that I kind of find boring I’ll skim until I get to a part that interests me so I completely missed the racist comments that come out of Boris’ mouth and when I heard about them I obviously saw the book in kind of a new light. I do totally agree that Tartt’s work lacks diversity but I also think she’s obsessed with WASPs cause the same type of characters filled The Secret History so it didn’t necessarily shock me. Will I ever read this again? No. Will I see the movie? Probably even though critics also said that basically nothing happens in this movie until the end. .Now for the big shock lol 🥁🥁🥁Alison’s rating: 🌟🌟🌟🌟 honestly if this book was anything under a 4 for me I would’ve just stopped reading it’s too long to commit to if I didn’t like it..Please share your thoughts on the book with me in the comments!!

text: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is my favorite museum of all times. It's just an incredible collection! I've spent well over 100 hours inside these museum walls and I still haven't seen all of it! I don't mean to get sappy but when I'm surounded by so much art I sometimes feel amazed and overwhelmed with gratitude that not only so many briliant  and beautiful works for art have been created but that they have survived history to this present moment and are available to me to enjoy. ❤️#metropolitanmuseumofart #themet

text: Andromeda’s mother , Queen Cassiopeia,  claimed that she was the most beautiful woman in the world. This made Poseidon, God of the Sea, very angry and in revenge for what queen said he sent a hideous sea monster to ruin their kingdom.  Poseidon told King Cepheus that the only way he would call off the monster was if Andromeda was sacrificed . King Cepheus sacrificed Andromeda to the monster; he chained her onto a rock off the coast of his kingdom. - Andromeda and Sea Monster ...#greek #romanart #met #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #sculpture #marvel #greek #history #art #instagram #instaart #pictureoftheday #female #naked #physique #femme #white #black #beauty #sadness #power #iphone #royality #greece🇬🇷

name: 2019-09-14 09.00.17 2132377400821413088_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: SITAR HUNT! This is a moment of pride for EVERY Indian artist/musician. 🙏🏻So a while ago I got to know through a friend that there is a Sitar made by my Grand father at the MET museum, and I had been longing to go since a looong time and I finally went there. Turns out it was made by my dad for my Guru: Pandit Ravi Shankar in 1999. I cannot explain how much pride I take in this instrument as it signifies not only my culture and music but also a homage to my Guru, my great grandpa, my grandpa and my father @sanjayrikhiram Sanjay Rikhiram. It’s LITERALLY my Guru and my Family in an instrument five miles from where I live!! For those of you living in the tristate area haven’t been to this exhibition, please pay a visit and tell them Rishab sent you. The sitar is only there for a couple more weeks 😭। Here a selection of pictures of me being me captured by @closeknit_design .🤟🏻🤟🏻.......#sitar #indianclassical #metropolitanmuseumofart #artistsoninstagram #newyorkcity #newyork #indianclassicalmusic #rikhiram #thebeatles #sanjayrikhiram #ravishankar #georgeharrison #woodstock #montereypopfestival #luthier #themet #art #musicartist #artist #musicalinstrument #indian #rocknroll #halloffame #proudindian #🇮🇳 #indianculture @metmuseum @rockhall @rikhiramofficialstore @britishmuseum

name: 2019-09-14 10.14.49 2132414922931569694_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: For Favorite Book Friday I’m sharing The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt because the movie just came out and I can’t wait to see it! When a terrorist attack strikes the Met, Theo’s mother is killed. Theo takes a small painting that a dying man seems to be pointing to. As Theo adjusts to life with a wealthy school friend, and then to living with his alcoholic father in Las Vegas, the painting remains with him. When Theo returns to New York, he eventually enters the underground art dealing world, selling fake reproductions of the painting, and fears what will happen if he is found out. This book was very polarizing, some loved it and some hated it, but I strongly feel that it’s worth it, especially because of the unexpected plot twist towards the end!

name: 2019-09-14 18.47.59 2132673205530311221_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Treasure: 👉 Virgin and Child - 1672 Artist: 🇪🇸 Bartolomé Estebán Murillo Where:📍#NewYork - Metropolitan Museum Foto: 📸@metmuseumTag: 🔑#europe_treasures Family:👉 @tesori_italiani👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @archaeology.treasures 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 Like Zurbarán and Velázquez, Murillo was trained in Seville, where he spent his whole career. Often referred to as the "Santiago Madonna," this painting once belonged to the Marqués de Santiago, whose collection contained many outstanding works by the artist. The popularity of Murillo’s paintings of the Virgin and Child derives from his ability to endow a timeworn theme with a quality of intimacy and sweetness. In this picture, the infant’s attention has been momentarily diverted from nursing by the presence of the viewer. 🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹 ⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀🏛 Share our Wonderful Heritage 🏛🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹🔸🔹#art #europeanart #prado #artwork🎨 #prado #spanishart #pintura #pintor #spanishartist #museo #artista #murillo #spain #metmuseum #espanol #española #historiadelarte #historia #españa #espana #spanish #europeart #spaniard #artgallery #metropolitanmuseumofart #español #arteespañol

name: 2019-09-14 21.58.59 2132769343021291307_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ Treasure: 👉 Emperor #Caracalla / 212-217 AD Civilization: 🦅 Ancient Rome Where:📍#NewYork - Metropolitan MuseumPhoto: 📸 @metmuseum Family:👉 @europe_treasures👉 @contemporary_treasures👉 @tesori_italiani✤ ✤ ✤Caracalla took the official name of M. Aurelius Antoninus Pius as part of the Severan dynasty’s attempt to appear as the legitimate and worthy successors of the secondcentury Antonine emperors. Despite this, in his official portraiture, he abandoned the luxuriant hair and beard of his predecessors for a military style characterized by closely cropped curls and a stubble beard. An ancient source records that on his deathbed, his father Septimius Severus advised Caracalla to “enrich the soldiers and despise everyone else.” This finely carved head is a powerful rendering of the official portrait and was probably produced at an imperial workshop, since the statue fragments are said to have been found in Rome.✤ ✤ ✤#italy #italia #archaeology #archeologia #arqueologia #arqueología #roman #roma #imperio #romanhistory #history #metropolitanmuseumofart #historia #archeologie #emperor #romanart #metmuseum #ancientrome #imperoromano #metmuseum

name: 2019-09-14 23.05.09 2132802645174117441_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Gooood morning friends! The world is ready for us! It's been waiting for us to follow our truth. Follow all that means most to you. Take the leap in honoring your creativity..As creations ourselves it's in our greatest potential to create. Think big and you can do anything! This morning we are at the Museum of Natural History till 3pm. Afterwards we can enjoy the grandeur of Central park and we'll be at the Met by 6 to have a strong finish to the day..If you're here today or inspiring others elsewhere, the ancient power of community will alway be with you. So let's have a great time! 🌠🙌🌠...#AOTM #artistsofthemet #artcollective #metropolitanmuseumofart #museumsketch #artstudy #artteam #centralpark #AOTMatAMONH

name: 2019-09-15 04.00.16 2132951178380475631_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Have you been to the rooftop at the MET? Not only does it boast some stunning views of central park and the city skyline, but each year an artist is commissioned to create something for the unique space. This year, the rooftop exhibit was created by Berlin-based artist Alicja Kwade. Called "ParaPivot", the piece brings together art and scince with a sculptural constellation. Check it out before it's gone! The installation will be on display until Oct. 27 💫 #mysecretnyc📷: @katwapsnap

name: 2019-09-15 11.14.10 2133169564228600374_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: In #newyork one can consume art like a Starbucks coffee. It is just everywhere: some of them is cheap, to the level that you wonder, why is there even a need to buy one? In #timesquare one can buy a framed picture for $1, while you can't buy anything with the same price in a nearby McDonalds. But some of them are exceptional, so much so that are hailed at one of the most exquisite museums in the world, such as #metropolitanmuseumofart, #guggenheimmuseum, #rubinmuseum (I mean I can't keep up with the list of museums that #ny offer). Why is that? We consider ourselves smart, educated and progressive, yet sometimes we fail to appreciate the high art and buy the "worthless" one. But who's counting, really. In this day and age we only buy art we can afford to appreciate and that freedom is ours.#newyorkcity #newyorkart #artscene #posesforpictures #sohonyc #beartsy #whatisart #travelholic #travelmania #thoughtoftheday #inspiration #loveyourself #thebigapple🍎 #cityoflove #becreative #crazytimes

name: 2019-09-15 11.24.41 2133174858464660760_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Co autor miał na myśli, czyli wizyta w muzeum sztuki. Jak podaje Wikipedia The Metropolitan Museum of Art  jest najstarszym i największym muzeum amerykańskim. Posiada unikatową kolekcję malarstwa, rzeźby, dzieł sztuki zdobniczej ze wszystkich epok z całego świata.Zbiory podzielone są na działy tematyczne, obejmujące m.in. dzieje sztuki światowej: malarstwa, sztuki użytkowej, militariów, instrumentów muzycznych, ubiorów, fotografii. Cos od nas: to kolejne muzeum na które trzeba było by poświęcić  przynajmniej kilka dni, aby zapoznać się z każdym opisem, zadumać nad rzeźbą czy obrazem. Po obejrzeniu zbiorów pochodzących ze starożytnego Egiptu i po części Grecji mieliśmy już zbyt mało czasu aby poświęcić drugie tyle czasu na kolejną 3/4 muzeum, dlatego w połowie oglądania doszliśmy do wniosku, że to wszystko mija się z celem,  i trzeba to zakończyć tym bardziej że kręgosłup zaczął znowu doskwierać. Żal, oczywiście, że żal. Ale też osobiście wolę sztuce poświęcić więcej uwagi, niż tylko popatrzeć. Najważniejsze - Egipt - jednak przejrzałam skrupulatnie. Uwielbiam! #takaola  #sparrowteam #tripteam #zwiedzamyamerykę  #podróżemałeiduże  #polkazwiedza  #swiat #anapewno#usa  #trip #newyork #nowyjork #nowyork #muzeum #muzeumsztuki #artmuseum #museum #MetropolitanMuseumofArt

name: 2019-09-15 11.27.11 2133176116739058362_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Na górze muzeum znajduje się punkt widokowy z kawiarnią. Co prawda mieliśmy wejść tam tylko na lampkę wina, przy której mieliśmy podziwiać piękne widoki na miasto i central park. Ostatecznie zostaliśmy na dłużej, bo zagadaliśmy się z przemiłymi ludzi, którzy oczywiście zaprosili nas do siebie, gdybyśmy znowu zwiedzali Kanadę 😂  #takaola  #sparrowteam #tripteam #zwiedzamyamerykę  #podróżemałeiduże  #polkazwiedza  #swiat #anapewno#usa  #trip #newyork #nowyjork #nowyork #muzeum #muzeumsztuki #artmuseum #museum #MetropolitanMuseumofArt #balcony #balconyview #ny

name: 2019-09-15 11.34.39 2133179880799828900_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Reminiscing tonight about my life (and friends) in #NYC. This is a #drawing of a #sculpture in the #MetropolitanMuseumofArt.I took a classical #figure drawing class at #HunterCollege with Anthony Panzera some years ago, which changed and expanded my #art life in ways I never imagined. Every week, I spent time in the #MetMuseum drawing a #classical sculpture, and discovered that new techniques I was learning not only improved my #drawings, but also opened my attentiveness to the world around me in surprising ways. I'm very thankful for that, and for these drawings which are artifacts of that learning...#pencil #graphite #graphitedrawing #classicalfigure #classicalfiguredrawing  #renaissancedrawing #figuredrawing #pencilart

name: 2019-09-15 16.44.48 2133335978291711915_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⭐️N E X T  S A L E⭐️ Auguste RODIN (1840-1917)Le baiser (esquisse pour le piédroit de droite de la Porte de l’Enfer)Plaster low-relief signed A. Rodin on the upper right corner.Conceived around 1885, smaller version around 1902-1903, this proof made between 1903 and 1917.11,20 x 5,30 cmProvenance: - Charles Masson, curator of the Musée du Luxembourg, probably donated by the artist between 1903 and 1917 - Current owner by legacyThis work will be included in the archives of the Comité Auguste Rodin in order to be published in the Catalogue Critique de l’Oeuvre Sculptée d’Auguste Rodin currently in preparation by the Brame & Lorenceau gallery under the direction of Jérôme Le Blay with the reference number 2018-5770B.Bibliography:- “Le baiser” Antoinette Lenormand-Romain, RMN, 1995, two plaster sculptures, “le baiser, esquisse pour le piédroit de droite de la Porte de l’Enfer” are reproduced page 66 : n° 8. Ref. M.R S 4041, donation to the Musée Rodin in 1916 ; H : 11,4 ; L 5,7 ; P 1,7 cm (missing left arm of the man) n° 9. Ref. M.R S 4038, donation to the Musée Rodin in 1916 ; H : 11,1 ; L 7,1 ; P 1,5 cm (with the man’s left arm under the woman’s elbow)#auctioneers #rodin #augusterodin #laportedesenfers #museerodin #paris #sculpture #deburauxduplessis #artcollector #auction #drouot #camilleclaudel #museedorsay #muséeduluxembourg #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-15 16.53.57 2133340584493086875_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ⭐️N E X T  S A L E⭐️🧐 D E T A I L 🧐Auguste RODIN (1840-1917)Le baiser (esquisse pour le piédroit de droite de la Porte de l’Enfer)Bas-relief en plâtre signé A. Rodin en haut à droite.Conçu circa 1885, cette version réduite circa 1902-1903, cette épreuve exécutée entre 1903 et 191711,20 x 5,30 cmProvenance :- Charles Masson, conservateur du Musée du Luxembourg, probablement un don de l'artiste entre 1903 et 1917- Actuel propriétaire par descendanceCette oeuvre sera incluse dans les archives du Comité Auguste Rodin en vue de la publication du Catalogue Critique de l'OEuvre Sculpté d'Auguste Rodin actuellement en préparation à la galerie Brame & Lorenceau sous la direction de Jérôme Le Blay sous le numéro 2018-5770B.Bibliographie : - « Le baiser » Antoinette Lenormand-Romain, RMN, 1995, deux plâtres, « le baiser, esquisse pour le piédroit de droite de la Porte de l’Enfer » sont reproduits page 66 :n° 8. Réf. M.R S 4041, donation au musée Rodin en 1916 ; H : 11,4 ; L 5,7 ; P 1,7 cm (avec bras gauche de l‘homme manquant) n° 9. Réf. M.R S 4038, donation au musée Rodin en 1916 ; H : 11,1 ; L 7,1 ; P 1,5 cm (avec bras gauche de l‘homme positionné en dessous du coude de la femme) #auctioneers #rodin #augusterodin #laportedesenfers #museerodin #paris #sculpture #deburauxduplessis #artcollector #auction #drouot #camilleclaudel #museedorsay #muséeduluxembourg #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-15 17.34.35 2133361036967894352_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 1653Aristotle with a Bust of Homer — RembrandtMetropolitan Museum of Art (Met), New York City, NY, USThis picture was painted in 1653 for the Sicilian nobleman Don Antonio Ruffo and sent from Amsterdam to his palace in Messina during the summer of 1654. Later Ruffo also ordered companion paintings from Rembrandt. They are the Alexander the Great of 1661 (now lost) and the fragmentary Homer (Mauritshuis, The Hague), dated 1663.Style: BaroqueGenre: portrait, history painting@artsastr#ART #Aristotle #Bust #Homer #Rembrandt #MetropolitanMuseumofArt #Met #NewYorkCity #NY #US #painting

name: 2019-09-15 19.25.37 2133416923971200734_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 〽️“Water of the Flowery Mill is part of a group of landscape-inspired works that Gorky produced during the last six years of his life. 〽️Based on his study of an old mill and bridge on the Housatonic River in Connecticut, it also evokes the artist’s nostalgia for Armenia, from which he and his family had fled some twenty years earlier. 〽️Influenced by Surrealism, Gorky’s fluid, biomorphic abstraction translates the landscape into flat, overlapping fields of colour and seems to anticipate the gestural brushwork of Abstract Expressionism, a movement that emerged in the 1950s.”~MET〽️〽️〽️ “Water of the Flowery Mill” 1944, by Armenian born, American artist, Arshile Gorky (1904–1948) 〽️ @metmuseum 〽️〽️〽️ #arshilegorky #americanartists #biomorphicabstraction #armenianroots #landscapepaintings  #myphoto #myphotography #personalreflections #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorkgalleries #artoftheday #arthistory #artoflooking #artobserved #artblogging #loveart #arttalks #artbites #brilliantcolours #whatdoyousee 〽️〽️〽️

text: È arrivato il momento di “ripartire”! A volte è necessario staccare dalla routine, evadere e prendersi un po’ di tempo per se. Questo diventa essenziale quando si vuole sollecitare la creatività e l’immaginazione... ed è proprio quello che abbiamo deciso di fare quest’anno. Prenderci un po’ di tempo per viaggiare, conoscere, condividere e divertirci, e ora... eccoci qui! Pronte a ripartire con tante nuove idee e tanta energia, pronte a ricominciare con tante novità e progetti, ma sempre con tanta voglia di continuare a divertirci... perché spesso il cambiamento non è poi così male! . . . #buonadomenica #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #creativitàartistiche #creativitaartistiche #nyc #ny #startagain #bepositive #becreative #culture #exploretocreate #explore #travel #creazioniartigianali #handmade

name: 2019-09-16 03.42.35 2133667048388391554_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 這次在大都會博物館待滿久的一個館是「埃及館」，一方面是我沒去過遙遠的埃及，一方面是深受從小看的一本漫畫的影響，對埃及的神秘力量有種崇畏⋯⋯ MET內展示大量法老王時期的文物，看約西元前3150年的時代，棺材和墓碑、陪葬藝術品等，手工藝術竟然可以這麼精細，會讓你看著棺材感到的不是害怕，而是驚訝和佩服，太不可思議了傑克！隨便一個黃金製的文物感覺都價值幾百萬吧，裡面竟然收藏了幾百個🤩🤩 「尼羅河女兒」日文名「王家の紋章」是日本超長青的人氣漫畫，以前我小學租一本回家3塊，在漫畫店現場看2塊，我現在嫁去東京的大姐是少女漫畫迷，她會租回家，我就半夜趁她睡時躲在棉被裡偷偷看😂 「王家的紋章」是由日本漫畫家組合細川智榮子與芙〜みん的少女漫畫作品。1976年於月刊Princess上首度連載，歷經43年尚未完結⋯😅😅 #細川智榮子  #尼羅河女兒#王家の紋章#lika的世界小旅行  #nyc  #埃及#Egypt #art  #artist  #met #大都會博物館  #museum  #metropolitanmuseumofart#博物館巡り

name: 2019-09-16 04.00.46 2133676209997239278_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 👗Esta exhibición del MET en Nueva York me encantó tanto que fui dos veces. Tuve la suerte de verla antes que se terminara. Comparto mis recuerdos con Uds. Pueden ver más en el story. ⁠"Camp: Notes on Fashion" es la exposición de arte de alta moda del 2019 del Centro de Disfraces Anna Wintour, en el Met de Nueva York. Su curador es Andrew Bolton.⁠A través de más de 250 objetos que, datan desde el siglo XVII hasta el presente, la exposición de primavera del 2019 del Instituto del Traje explora los orígenes de la estética exuberante del campamento. El ensayo de 1964 de Susan Sontag "Notes on 'Camp'" proporciona el marco para la exposición, que examina cómo los elementos de ironía, humor, parodia, pastiche, artificio, teatralidad y exageración se expresan en la moda.⁠👠I was so lucky to be able to visit the "Camp: Notes on Fashion" exhibition at the Met. I love it so much that I went twice. It's a shame its already over. ⁠“Camp: Notes on Fashion” is the 2019 high fashion art exhibition of the Anna Wintour Costume Center, at the Met in New York. Its curator is Andrew Bolton.⁠Through more than 250 objects dating from the seventeenth century to the present, The Costume Institute's spring 2019 exhibition explores the origins of camp's exuberant aesthetic. Susan Sontag's 1964 essay "Notes on 'Camp'" provides the framework for the exhibition, which examines how the elements of irony, humor, parody, pastiche, artifice, theatricality, and exaggeration are expressed in fashion.⁠You can see more of the exhibit on the story.⁠.⁠.⁠.⁠.⁠.⁠⁠ #style #ootd #love #instagood #instafashion #fashionblogger #fashionista #campnotesonfashion #metcamp #notesoncamp #susansontag #fashionexhibition #exhibitiondesign #fashion #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #campy #Costumeinstitute

name: 2019-09-16 09.40.56 2133847414657020761_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Untitled (Studio)” by Kerry James Marshall, 2014From the Met: “Marshall often recounts an episode from his summer course at the Otis Art Institute after seventh grade, when he visited the studio of his childhood idol Charles White (1918–1979). It was the first time Marshall had seen an artist’s workspace in person and also the moment he realized that making pictures was something he, too, could do. In part about that discovery of a black artist’s workshop—a place of labor where an allegorical catalogue of all modes of art making is on display—Untitled (Studio) is a majestic ode to the job of the artist, the history of the medium, and the multiple possibilities that still pump through the heart of painting.”...#kerryjamesmarshall #metropolitanmuseumofart #contemporaryart #contemporarypainting #acryliconpvc #acryliconpvcpanel #davidzwirner #davidzwirnergallery #shareblackstories #africanamericanart #africanamericanartist

name: 2019-09-16 11.38.05 2133906377723555898_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: #PEER SMED# As a gold carver, a silversmith, As a designer of iron grilles(1878-1943)Peer Smed was born inCopenhagen, he became an expert metalcraft and produced objects somewhat in the Jensen style but with characteristic touches that clearly marked them as his.His obituary spoke of his honors “as a gold carver, a silversmith and as a designer of iron grilles.” He was also proficient in copper and bronze. he exhibited his work at the Brooklyn Museum of Art, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and galleries in New York and San Francisco.Smed produced the elaborate doors designed by William Zorach for the entrance to the Schwarzenbach Building in New York City and created silver designs for Tiffany and Company. His work is currently held in the Brooklyn Museum of Art, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Dallas Museum of Art, and the Art Institute of Chicago as well as several private galleries and collections around the country.Gallery 925 is offering a collection of Peer Smed silver collection athttps://www.gallery925.com/search?q=peer+smed#persmed #georgjensen #silversmith #925silver #brooklynmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumofart #copenhagendesign #tiffany #contemporaryjewelry #當代藝術 #銀飾 #當代珠寶#丹麥設計

text: EN: Engraving of St. John on Patmos by German painter and engraver Martin Schongauer. It shows the saint in the lower right-hand corner looking up at the vision of the Virgin and Child of the Apocalypse in the sky. Copper engraving is made around 1475-80 and located in The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York today.————————————————TR: Alman ressam ve gravür yapımcısı Martin Schongauer tarafından yapılan Aziz Yuhanna’yı Patmos'ta gösteren gravür. Sağ alt köşedeki azizi, gökyüzündeki Meryem ve Çocuk tahayyülüne bakarken gösterir. Bakır gravür 1475-80 civarında yapılmıştır ve bugün New York’taki The Metropolitan Museum of Art’tadır.#art #arthistory #historyofart #kunst #kunstgeschichte #sanat #sanattarihi #martinschongauer #stjohnonpatmos #saintjohntheevangelist #stjohntheevangelist #northernrenaissance #kuzeyrönesansı #engraving #gravure #copperengraving #gravür #christianart #renaissance #rinascimento #virginandchild #metmuseum #themetropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #tarih #history #geschichte

name: 2019-09-17 04.17.29 2134409395935811094_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Not a breath, not a sound—except at intervals the muffled crackling of stones that the cold was reducing to sand—disturbed the solitude and silence surrounding Janine. [...] Before her the stars were falling one by one and being snuffed out among the stones of the desert, and each time Janine opened a little more to the night. Breathing deeply, she forgot the cold, the dead weight of others, the craziness or stuffiness of life, the long anguish of living and dying. After so many years of mad, aimless fleeing from fear, she had come to a stop at last. [...] The next moment, the whole sky stretched out over her, fallen on her back on the cold earth.”A. Camus, 𝘌𝘹𝘪𝘭𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘥𝘰𝘮.✶Basically uni starts again in a week and I am excited – I’m studying German this year – but also I’d appreciate a couple decades of unconsciousness if you know what I mean. ____________#darkacademia #darkacademiaaesthetic #museum #baroquedesign I guess #clock #metropolitanmuseumofart #metnyc #metmuseum #darkaesthetic #darkaesthetictheme #aesthetic

text: New York - giorno 1 appena atterrati subito a #timesquare per foto di rito e per calcolare cosa spende il comune di bollette. Mattina seguente, dopo un primo approccio con le mappe, ci dirigiamo verso il vicino #topoftherock dove, nonostante tutto, sono riuscito a mantenere i nervi saldi contro la fobia dell’altezza. Nel pomeriggio noleggiamo delle ‘ottime’ bici per una boccata d’aria a @centralparknyc con tanto di giri nei musei di #metropolitanmuseumofart e #museumofnaturalhistory e ottimo rinforzo proteico da #shakeshack . Esausti, ma contenti 🏙💵🍔🇱🇷

Like in woods, when they jostle their hooded shapes, Their heads congealed together, having murdered each other, There are moon-beings, sound-beings, such as deer and half-deer Passing through there, whose eyes can pierce through things......#ilonapachler #moonphases #zeitgenössichekunst #poems #art #studio #gallery #poetry #clay #austria #vienna #whowerethekings #iliad #ashurnasirpal #museum #metropolitanmuseumofart #relief #text #standard text #cuneiform #conquest #women #echo #moon

name: 2019-09-18 04.20.09 2135135515381255873_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: 💡GLENN LIGON 💡▪️America | 2008 | @rubellcollection▪️This semester I’m taking a class about the groundbreaking exhibition “30 Americans,” which presents work by many of the world’s most influential black artists. I am so excited about this class because we will help curate the show when it moves to the Barnes Foundation in late October. I have to write about a few artworks each week, so I’ve decided to pare down my responses and share them with you guys too.▪️Glenn Ligon is known for using language to explore themes of race, sexuality, and identity. Ligon employs text from important authors like James Baldwin and Zora Neale Hurston, repeating famous lines in neon and writing out entire passages in charcoal. So it is interesting that his most recognizable — and perhaps most compelling — work consists of a single word: America. What makes this artwork special is its immediacy and accessibly (two things that are not always the case with Ligon). The most effective aspect of this artwork, though, is its ambiguity. Anyone can approach the work and draw their own unique conclusions about its meaning. Some may see the work and feel a sense of national pride, while others may read it as a symbol of oppression. Hence, Ligon is exposing the dichotomies embedded in our American system, with a particular focus on race and class. The work makes me question how and why my reaction might differ from that of a black woman, or an undocumented immigrant. How does my experience — my privilege as a white male — define my understanding of America? As I think about this work, I can’t help but liken it to Jasper Johns’s Flag paintings form the mid-1950s. Johns similarly explored America’s social differences in the midst of the Civil Rights Movement and the Cold War. Perhaps fittingly, Ligon’s work revisited these important questions as we entered a new period of social and economic turmoil in 2008.▪️(If some of this looks familiar, thats because I recycled some thoughts from the very similar Jasper Johns painting I posted last week)

name: 2019-09-18 06.51.53 2135211880276700274_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Questi renderings sono parte del mio progetto di ricerca qui al Metropolitan Museum of Art. Riassumono quasi i miei ultimi 12 mesi di lavoro sullo studio e la documentazione tecnica di strutture tessili complesse quali sciamiti, taquetè e Jin-Silks cinesi. Le decine di tessuti che ho analizzato provengono da diversi luoghi ubicati sulla antica via della seta...dalla Syria al Caucaso, dalla Persia alla Cina. Non sarei mai riuscita a realizzare uno studio così approfondito senza le risorse enormi che questo Museo incredibile mi ha messo a disposizione: tecnologie digitali, attrezzature per analisi multispettrali e multibanda, microscopia ottica all'avanguardia con sistemi di messa a fuoco automatici integrati, libri e pubblicazioni in tutte le lingue del mondo, uno staff incredibile e una collezione tessile da sogno.#metropolitanmuseumofart #weavestructure #weavestructures #cad #digitaldocumentation #textiles #ancienttextiles #textileconservation #samit #taquete #jin #silk #silkfabric #compoundweave #computeraideddesign #autocad #restaurotessuti #restauro

name: 2019-09-18 11.12.48 2135343206519043357_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I close out this second annual International Rapier Day with this special second post, an utterly astounding piece made for Prince-Elector Christian II of Saxony..The Swept-hilt is steel covered in bronze and delicately gilt with ornate floral patterns, accented by pearls, enamel, and precious gems. It was crafted by Israel Schuech in Dresden, Germany..The blade is a wonderfully deadly piece of art in its own right, elegantly pierced and attributed to Juan Martinez of Toledo, Spain..OaL: 48 in/121.9 cmBlade Length: 41.25 in/104.8 cmWidth: 6.75 in/17.2 cmWeight: 3.25 lbs/1474 g.The whole was made in 1606, and is housed at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, @metarmsandarmor

name: 2019-09-18 12.06.52 2135370414650538635_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Do something new day 2993.  A Visit to the Metropolitan Museum to see old favorites and discover new ones.  Anne and I focused intently on getting to the Lehman Wing to see Botticelli’s extraordinary Annunciation which we studied in art History class at Sweet Briar College. The carefully composed painting with strong architectural elements focuses us on the divine interaction between Mary and Gabriel  we discussed it and reveled in its beauty. A mindful looking meditation.  The El Greco room was newly installed and looked glorious.  Paused to examine Leonardo da Vinci’s St Jerome, a single unfinished painting from the Vatican in a room to itself. Uplifting and thoughtful interpretation provided new insights to the craft of painting.  #metropolitanmuseumofart #friendsforever #friendship #elgreco #botticelli #africanart #hawaiianfeatherwork #leonardodavincipainting #explore #discover #learning #observing #awe #chronicpain #chronicillness #spoonie #dosomething #dosomethingnew #bonniepitmandosomethingnew #newexperience #newart #newideas #somethingnew #happymoments #happyday #artmuseum

name: 2019-09-18 21.06.59 2135642269177847854_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Have you seen the bust of the Voldemort look-alike at the Met? Discover connections like this in an interactive ‘wizarding’ tour in the magical Metropolitan Museum with @fableandlark inspired by #harrypotter. We had so much fun with our Potterhead neighbor (she's read the whole series 8 times) and now we're so exited to get through the rest of the books (currently in the middle of #2).See spaces, places and objects similar to those in the books, from part of an actual castle to depictions of mythical creatures like griffins and dragons. Includes scavenger hunts, creative activities, fun items to take home and some spell casting. Halloween tours coming soon. Costumes are always encouraged, but my daughter just wanted Hermione hair that day.*@metmuseum #themet @metamericanwing #americanwing

name: 2019-09-18 21.29.53 2135653793354558392_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Day 4 - 메트로폴리탄 뮤지엄3시간 정도 열심히 봤지만 당연히 전체의 아주 일부만 봤다. 처음에 들어간 근현대관 탐험이 가장 좋았고 아는 만큼 보인다고 서울에서 처음 전시로 알게 되었던 자코메티 조각들이 참 좋았다. 사진을 많이 찍진 않았지만 정말 좋았던 작품만 남겨본다. 뭐랄까 내셔널 갤러리가 자꾸 생각이 났는데 아트숍도 아주 비슷한 느낌이었고 그래서인지 딱히 산 것이 없다🤓 토요일에 다시 봅시다-In this huge museum I spent tough time over 3hrs but only finished a few sections. You can see the beautiful nature’s lighting into each room and It makes you less tired to keep walking forward. In Sackler Wing, there’s Egyptian temple which was given as form of appreciation to the US. And the art shop was not that impressive so I could save my dollars😂 See you this weekend, Met.#newyork #nyc #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #vacation #MetKoreanArt #metamodernart

name: 2019-09-18 22.17.50 2135677928972712028_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: More from the Met! Louis Comfort Tiffany’s Garden Landscape is one of my favorite Met moments.. Tiffany’s work in mosaic, inspired by Byzantine examples he had seen abroad, dates to as early as the 1880s, when he began experimenting with iridescent glass and transparent tesserae backed with metal leaf. Mosaic decoration graced countless interiors by him, from churches to department stores. The culmination of his interest was the vast Dream Garden mosaic, created in 1915, after designs by Maxfield Parrish, for Edward Bok at the Curtis Publishing Company in Philadelphia. Tiffany may have made this shimmering garden landscape as a preliminary study for the Curtis commission. It was among the decorations that graced the Tiffany showrooms until their contents were auctioned in 1938.......#metropolitanmuseumofart #louiscomforttiffany #theamericanwing #mosaic

name: 2019-09-18 22.31.57 2135685032589475197_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Beautiful lunch with my colleagues @livingcafesg . My first at a raw and plant-based cuisine restaurant (although they do serve limited options of fish and poultry)! And the food is really delicious! Seen in picture... raw roasted broccoli and mushroom pizza, Pad Thai (noodles are made from raw zucchini), raw Mexican chips with dips and my selection of main course, Wild Barramundi served with Mexican and and pesto sauce! The raw pizza is my favourite - super tasty and flavourful! Birthday cake is a slice of raw carrot cake - yummy! It’s an early birthday celebration and I’m wearing my new birthday gift from Met Museum... a replica from a piece worn by the Venus, Goddess of Love, in a painting by Peter Paul Rubens.  Thank you to my leadership team for this special and memorable treat! #rawcuisine #birthdaycelebrations #metropolitanmuseumofart #artnfashion #peterpaulrubens #whatatreat #thankyou

text: How bout this #boccioni X #lewitt mashup @metmuseum yesterday? Italian Futurism has always fascinated me, progressive, powerful, a little frightening. Here we have Boccioni’s “Development of a Bottle in Space”, 1913, a form that was forged into existence over 100 years ago and it still excites the mind. The backdrop of Sol LeWitt’s wall drawing offers a wonderful contrast and contemporary contextualization. ...#umbertoboccioni #futurism #italianfuturism #sollewitt #walldrawing #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyorknewyork #modernart #minimalism #artadvisor #artdealer

text: So this may seems kinda weird and out of place next to all the Greek stuff. However it's worth noting that this was literally in the middle of the Greek section, in a side door. So that's why I'm putting it here. ...This was really different from everything else I saw, but it was still pretty incredible. The broken guitars of Kurt Cobain and Jimi Hendrix, two acoustic and electric responsible for Zeppelin's best. So many more, it was amazing to see such a massive piece of music history, that means so much to me personally. ......#music #musichistory #rockandroll #rockandrollhistory #art #ledzeppelin #jimihendrix #thebeatles #nirvana #prince #metropolitanmuseumofart #metropolitain #met

name: 2019-09-19 03.57.12 2135848739739081533_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Spent the morning at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Saw an incredible exhibit that will only be there till Sunday, Apollo’s Muse, The moon in the age of photography. It chronicles mans fascination with our celestial neighbor, primarily through photographic means. There are Daguerreotypes, glass plate transparencies, stereo cards, art and ephemera all related to the moon. The first thing that caught my eye was this Hasselblad training camera for the Apollo 11 crew and camera back that went to the moon. Kodak made a special thin based film for this back that when loaded would take 200 images!! Parallel - cross eyed

name: 2019-09-19 07.22.54 2135952273766089771_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Last April I decided to move to New York. It happened in the San Francisco Bart train, between Embarcadero and West Oakland. By Lake Meritt I already had everything planned out. It was my stop. Shortly alter I bought ticket to New York for September 11th (because of good prices), and puffy coat (because of cold winters). I gave myself over 4 month to wrap everything up, go to Burning Man and then happily move to NYC. But ... God works in mysterious ways. Instead I moved to LA in August. Ticket to NYC didn’t go to waste, as you can see. #newyorkmoments #laadventure #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #puffycoat #coldwinters #cheaptickets #bigmove #sanfranciscobart #barttrain #embarcadero #lakemeritt

text: Каждый год в Институте Костюма музея искусств Метрополитен проходит тематическая выставка моды. Тема 2019-го года - «Кэмп» (Camp), что можно перевести как чрезмерность, излишество, нарядность, вычурность, карнавальность, яркость. Подробнее о том, что послужило вдохновением выставки, можно прочесть в эссе Сьюзан Зонтаг || #мода #стиль #кэмп #тщеславие #денди #вычурность #излишество #одежда #костюм #наряд #выставка #музей #витрина #искусство #музейметрополитан #культодром #ньюйорк #culturedrome #metcamp #exhibition #fashion #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork

text: Look at that jewellery in this early 16th century sculpture by Jan II Borman (the Great), who worked in Brussels for the Burgundian court, nobility and clergy. In his days he was considered to be the greatest sculptor.If jewellery really was observed as trifles, why would the sculptor of this buste have bothered to cut these jewels so precisely.#janborman#sculpture #collection #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork

name: 2019-09-19 22.52.05 2136419942186931332_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A few more guitars from the Play It Loud - Instruments of Rock and Roll exhibit at @metropolitanmuseum.  Telecasters from Keith Richards and Bruce Springsteen (seeing those two were stunning), plus guitars from Muddy Waters (the mother instrument of rock ‘n’ roll), Bo Diddley, The Everly Brothers, John Lennon, Jimi Hendrix, (the guitar he played at Woodstock), Pete Townsend, and Eddie Van Halen‘s famous handmade “Frankenstein“ guitar. So close that I could almost touch them. Or at least get arrested for trying. I’m such a nerd! 🤣..The exhibit runs through October 1. You still have a chance to check it out for yourself. Trust me, you won’t be disappointed!..... #adventuresindogsandrealestate #petfriendlyrealtor #petfriendly #realestateagent #realtorlife #nycphotographer #nycphotography #playitloud #guitars #metropolitanmuseumofart #newyork #nyc #themet #thebeatles #johnlennon #keithrichards #rollingstones #cityphotography #brucespringsteen #igphoto #jimihendrix #thewho #photography #vanhalen #ig_nyc #photographer #midtownmanhattan #midtown #museum

text: 18th and 19th century inscriptions dominate my brain these days, and I’m actually ok with that.... #phdlife..Illustrated single work (ink and gold on paper) of a calligraphic galleon (sailing ship) by calligrapher 'Abd al-Qadir Hisari. Turkey, Ottoman period. Dated 1767. Collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

name: 2019-09-19 23.09.12 2136428558377448985_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The fantastic drawings for the pioneering short film, "A Trip to the Moon" by Georges Melies in 1902 are now in the show "Apolo's Muse- The moon in the Age of Photography" at Metropolitan Museum. It's an excellent show, and I was so excited to see the original drawings!! The moon has been such a meaningful metaphor and symbol. My exhibition "A Trip to the Moon" is now on view at Shirley Fiterman Art Center until November 2nd. 1. Drawings "A Trip to the Moon" Georges Melies 19022. Excerpt from "A Trip to the Moon" Georges Melies 19023. Excerpt from "Beautiful Sky Golf Course" Gaku Tsutaja 20194. Video installation "Beautiful Sky Golf Course" Gaku Tsutaja 20195. Painting “Stone Fever” Gaku Tsutaja 20196. Drawings “Kingdom of Kitai” Gaku Tsutaja 20177. Video Painting “Study with the Moon” Gaku Tsutaja 20198. Entrance view@shirley_fiterman_art_center #atriptothemoon #georgesmelies #gakutsutaja #1902 #2019 #metropolitanmuseumofart #shirleyfitermanartcenter #moon #metaphor #satire #drawing #film #history #wwii #japaneseinternmentcamp #aliendetentioncenter #60s #civilengineer #nucleardisaster #nuclearweapons #1945 #atomicbomb #animalprotagonists

name: 2019-09-20 01.14.19 2136491533141108107_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: A book is often so much better than Its film spin off. The case of ‘The Goldfinch’ is no exception. Donna Tartt’s rollercoaster adventure is a treasured novel in the Den’s Dozen (our favourite book club reads), so any excuse to bring this to your attention is a delight. Definitely perfect time to spread the word in your book club and enjoy Donna Tartt whether you pick this one or her famed ‘The Secret History’. Although the film has already been panned by critics even before it’s released - ouch!! we know you will love the novel. Released in cinemas from 27 September. ...#thegoldfinch #donnatartt #2019reads #bookclub #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #booksbooksandmorebooks #newyork #metropolitanmuseumofart #lovebooks #denreading #bookofthemonth

name: 2019-09-20 05.49.14 2136629904832399667_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I’m a sucker for performance art.⁣⁣“My body, like yours, is a museum that holds a collection of memories...As an artist, I try to hold a mirror up to the world and capture what is being reflected. I am not a historian. My eyes, ears, nose, mouth, stomach, legs and hands are the filters through which I experience the history embedded in the objects and spaces in the physical world and the narratives around them. Memory is ultimately of the body, for me and for you.” Nikhil Chopra, Artist in Residence for the @metmuseum

text: Armored #knights are ready for #battle on exhibit at the #MET in #NYC. The #armor on the #knight in the middle of the #fisheye photo weighs over 55 pounds; the armor on the #horse is an additional 65 pounds. The man’s armor dates from between 1535 to 1540. It was made in Germany by #Wolfgang #Grosschedel. The exhibit is at the #metropolitanmuseumofart on 5th Avenue on #Manhattan. #battle #middleages #jousting #warhorse #museum #arms #armament #etchedsteel #war #nikon #nikonz7

name: 2019-09-20 12.18.37 2136825884676977941_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Today I explored Manhattan on foot. I started from home in the #UpperWestSide, walked through #CentralPark with Taylor and dropped him off at the hospital. Then I headed #downtown from the #UpperEastSide and made my way through some amazing streets and spots like #MadisonAvenue #5thavenue #parkavenue and saw the #guggenheim, #metropolitanmuseumofart #themet and window shopped at places I couldn’t afford like #gucci #versace #fendi #prada #louisvuitton and #givenchy. Then I made my way through #timessquare and saw the #empirestatebuilding, the #flatironbuilding and so much more. I walked through #soho and #nolita, which may be my favorite place in the city because it reminded me so much of the #bywater in #NewOrleans. I made it past #chinatown and up to a killer rooftop view in the #50boweryhotel. I kept going to the #brooklynbridge, through the financial district, down #wallstreet and all the way to #batterypark for an amazing #sunset. And on the 7th mile, I rested.

text: Pompeo BATONI (1708-1787), Diana e Cupido (1761), olio su tela, cm 124,5x172,7 cm (dettaglio), The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.Batoni in this painting adopted the general pose of the statue, with the torso at a right angle to the crossed legs and with the drapery covering the right breast and leaving the left breast exposed, and rearranged the arms in accordance with the action of the figures.#pompeobatoni#metropolitanmuseumofart#met#metnewyork#newyork#diana#cupid#statue#classicmodel#classicbeauty

name: 2019-09-20 23.19.17 2137158412579200184_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Last Monday night we kicked off our 2019–20 Friends of Drawings and Prints season with an inspiring conversation between celebrated writer Frederic Tuten and Associate Curator Jennifer Farrell! Tuten shared stories of his life and work and his love of van Gogh alongside other works in The Met's collection. This haunting view of the asylum of Saint-Paul-de-Mausole in St. Rémy is where van Gogh spent twelve months near the end of his life. The artist sent this unusually large and colorful drawing to his brother Theo, to give a picture of his surroundings.Vincent van Gogh (Dutch,1853–1890), Corridor in the Asylum, September 1889. Oil color and essence over black chalk on pink laid ("Ingres") paper. Bequest of Abby Aldrich Rockefeller, 1948 (48.190.2)#fbf #belatedtbt #FredericTuten #vangoghsbadcafe @vangoghmuseum #VincentvanGogh #vanGogh #oilcolor #drawing #metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #themet

name: 2019-09-21 02.02.45 2137240688207746107_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Chez les Gaillard, l’Art Nouveau était devenu une affaire de famille. Tandis que son frère, Eugène, réalisait des meubles de ce style d’avant-garde, Lucien Gaillard entreprit de moderniser l’entreprise de joaillerie familiale, dès 1892. Avec ce papillon de nuit, il dévoile sa passion pour le travail de la corne et son inspiration venue du Japon !_____________________________________With the Gaillards, Art Nouveau had become a family business. While his brother, Eugène, made furniture of this avant-garde style, Lucien Gaillard undertook to modernize the family jewelry workshop, in 1892. With this moth, he reveals his passion for the work of horn and his inspiration from Japan!#bijou #jewelry #bijouterie #PapillonDeNuit #moth #ArtNouveau #ModernStyle #Gaillard #EugeneGaillard #LucienGaillard #1892 #1900 #ArtPiece #MuseumPiece #corne #horn #artisanat #craftsmanship #Japon #Japan #Japonisme #Japonism  #MET #MetropolitanMuseum #MetropolitanMuseumOfArt #NewYork #NewYorkCity

text: Leonardo da Vinci’s Saint Jerome is now on view at the Met Fifth Avenue. On loan from the Vatican it was brought to the US to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the artist’s death.  The unfinished painting offers the viewer a look at Leonardo’s creative process. On view until October 6, 2019.  #leonardodavinci #metropolitanmuseumofart #artnyc #nycart  #renaissanceart #museumsnyc

name: 2019-09-21 10.37.23 2137499704229182650_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: The end of Nikhil Chopra’s nine day residency living inside the Metropolitan Museum of Art. A strange, moving, nomadic trip through one of the world’s most famous institutions. It was unsettling to make eye contact with him as he moved through the galleries before collapsing on the door of the Great Hall. “That’s where the performance is. It’s where the invisible becomes visible,” said curator Sheen Wagstaff following the work’s conclusion. #nomad #nomadic #museum #metlivearts #nikhilchopra #landwaterandskies #met #metmuseum #artist #uppereastside #performance #metropolitanmuseumofart #performanceart #artmuseum #artresidency #artwork #artistinresidence #indianart #indianartist #residency #costume #nightatthemuseum #culture #residentartist #fridaynight #weekend #newyork #ny #newyorkcity #performanceartist @nikhilchopra74 @metmuseum

name: 2019-09-21 22.25.50 2137856284762982236_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: I'll spare you the lame Gossip Girl References but sitting on the Met Steps is an NYC tradition that has withstood the test of time!. The Metropolitan Museum of Art of New York City, known colloquially as 'the Met' is the largest art museum in the United States 🇺🇸 The Metropolitan Museum of Art was founded in 1870 for the purposes of opening a museum to bring art and art education to the American people. The museum was reported as having 7 million visitors during the past year. Did you know the Met is home to the world’s oldest surviving piano? The antique instrument dates back to 1720, and was created by Bartolomeo Cristofori—the Italian man who is credited with inventing the piano.. Interestingly enough, the official mascot for the Metropolitan museum is an ancient Egyptian hippopotamus. Wether you're snacking on the steps or exploring inside the museum, it's well worth a visit---------------------#themet #metsteps #gossipgirl #xoxogossipgirl #MetropolitanMuseumofArt #manhattan #streetsofnewyork #nyc #streetphotography #newyork #newyorkcity #explorenyc #nyctravel #usa #nomadiclife #paddington #paddingtonbear #abearcalledpaddington #worldtraveler #travelplushie #travelplush #plushiesofinstagram #travelbear #kawaii #plush #plushie #plushies #plushtoy #plushielife #plushiefriends

name: 2019-09-21 22.45.15 2137866052011523969_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: ...it’s like Sex and the City! 🖤..Это ж прям как сериал «Секс в большом городе» сказала мама, посещая очередную достопримечательность города Нью-Йорка. А вот здесь главная героиня проходила, а тут они все вместе сидели...Я посмотрела на маму, и подумала, что много я не знала об этом человеке. Люди и интересы меняются со временем, это точно. Когда видишь человека раз в год, следующий раз может оказаться очередным сюрпризом в смене характера и взглядов на жизнь.Так и со мной, то ли это Америка, то ли Нью-Йорк сам по себе, но с переездом сюда я очень сильно изменилась. «Американизировалась» говорят все. А что это значит то? 🤨..#newyork #newyorkcity #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #sojossunglasses #metrooftop #centralpark #русскиевньюйорке #русскиевамерике #русскиезарубежом #жизньвньюйорке #жизньзаграницей #жизньвамерике #нашивамерике #fashionista #fashionblogger #фотографвньюйорке #ньюйоркер #русскийфотографвньюйорке #photographerinnewyork #instyle #cityscape #art #myamericanlife #дневникиммигранта

text: Team! I hope you're excited for the day to come. Its here! The chance to learn, to pay attention to the small details in the world around us. These details are where inspiration hides. It's there, waiting for us.Showing up to the day with with an open heart reveals the hidden gems in art, friends and yourself. We're at the Met all day today, working with others and ourselves. Always learning. We're on our journey and it's magic for our paths to cross here. Wherever you find yourself today, may great love and energy surround you! 🙌...#AOTM #artistsofthemet #met #artteam #artists #artcollective #peaceandlove #metmuseum #metropolitanmuseumofart #drawinggroup #drawing #artcommunity #museum #energy #love

name: 2019-09-22 01.50.50 2137959467929407549_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Frederick Wellington Ruckstull (American, (born France) Breitenbach, 1853–1942 New York)Ruckstull intended “Evening” to portray an ideal, rather than a specific being. It illustrates his observation that “[e]verything in nature folds at evening.” The voluptuous figure in a contrapposto stance tucks her face under her raised, bent right arm, and her drowsy, distant expression suggests the approach of sleep. ...#newyork #art #metropolitanmuseumofart #museum #history #traveling #trip #vacation

name: 2019-09-22 02.04.15 2137966212840136640_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: One year ago today was one of the best days of my life. I walked into TheMetropolitan Museum of Art in New York and saw my products in the gift shop representing the exhibit dedicated to my motherland, Armenia. The long journey leading up to that opening day taught me the greatest lesson of my life. When you want something bad enough, there is a specific purpose why THAT yearning has been placed in YOUR heart. It’s your duty and responsibility to yourself and everyone else in your world, to seek it out, work towards it, to not give up when things get difficult, and when you accomplish it, share it. We were each put on this earth for uniquely designed reasons and every single one of our contributions matter, whether they are local or global. To fear is human, do it anyway.#followyourdreams #itsnevertoolate #artistatthemet---#arpikrikorian #themet #metarmenia #womenartists #armenianartist  #metropolitanmuseumofart #armenia #yerevan #proudarmenian#doitanyway

name: 2019-09-22 02.28.16 2137978304473141732_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Took a trip down to the Met yesterday and saw some pieces of wood, wire, and metal that inspired me so much. To see this guitar in person for me was absolutely amazing. Eric Clapton’s “The Fool” SG is the guitar that inspired me to play guitar. It’s literally the machine that started it all for me. I remember watching the Cream Farewell Concert as a teen, on VHS, lol, with my buddy and his Dad back in the 90s, before I even played guitar. I remember seeing that guitar and thinking it was just the coolest thing I’d ever seen. I loved the way Clapton played it, and just everything about his swagger and that guitar in the interviews on that tape. The guitar just looked and sounded so cool. A few days later I heard Santana’s “Samba Pa Ti” at a late afternoon, almost summer, party when I was stoned out of my mind, lol. That song changed me forever. The Fool SG, the Cream, and that Santana song are the sole reasons I started playing guitar. They started it all. ....#TheFool #EricClapton #Cream #Gibson #SG #BluesRock #TheMet #PlayItLoud #Inspiring #MyReason #psychedelic #GuitarPhotography #ToneChaser #ToneKillers #ToneHeaven #GuitarSpotter #GuitarsDaily #MonumentalGuitars #GibsonSGLovers #GearTalk #GearNerds #Geartopia #Gearphoria #GuitarNerd #MetropolitanMuseumOfArt #NYC #Gibsunday on a #Straturday #gibsonsofinstagram #gibsongtrjunkie @gibsonguitar @gibsongtrjunkie @gibsonsofinstagram @gibsondaily @gibsonoftheday @gibsonsg.lovers @monumentalguitars @metmuseum @gibsoncustom @ericclapton @cream_blues_

name: 2019-09-22 20.33.44 2138524634169943406_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Oh the beautiful things you see when you look up. There are four statues by Kenyan Artist #WangechiMutu on the façade of the #MetropolitanMuseumofArt. The installation opened on September 9th and will run until January 12, 2020. Unfortunately absolutely no one at the information desk in the lobby of the #museum was aware it was outside. It’s a shame because the sculptures are so striking. The bronze figures of Black women against the Beaux-Arts arts facade of The Met are a beautiful contrast. It’s interesting to see this 19th century western style building with modern day African sculptures positioned among the colossal columns. A placement that I suspect helps with the issue of visitor #diversity and #Blackartists on view. Wangechi Mutu, “The Seated I, II, III, IV”– Bronze, 2019 Artist Statement (excerpt)… “The Poised, stately figures I have created for The Met façade derive inspiration from my interest in ancient and modern practices that reflect on the relationship between women and power across various traditions, including the weighty symbols and adornments worn within certain African traditions as well as the cumbersome burdens of ornately clad caryatids. I look at the contradictory aspects of such human expressions, in which women are respected for their strength, resilience, and wisdom and yet suffer for it, too..." -Wangechi Mutu #womeninthearts #sculpture #blackartist #africanart #kenyanart #artnyc #publicarts #artinstallation #themet #contemporaryart #soloexhibition #sole #blackexhibition #art

name: 2019-09-22 22.10.53 2138573533923908330_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Congratulation to Louisiana Museum of Modern Art (Denmark) on MARSDEN HARTLEY: THE EARTH IS ALL I KNOW OF WONDER - the first retrospective of Hartley’s work outside the United States in more than sixty years.  A true triumph - including more than 130 paintings and drawings, with major works from museums across the country.  A spectacular show - and in a most gorgeous setting on the Baltic Sea, much like Hartley’s own rugged North Atlantic.  Thank you to curator Mathias Ussing Seeberg and director Poul Erik Tojner for your vision and courage.  On view through January.  Roberta Smith and Jerry Saltz to speak on Hartley in November - check out the Louisiana website for details and a link to a film on Hartley featuring contemporary artists responding to Hartley’s art.  #marsdenhartley #hartley #americanmodernism #americanart #americanartist #alfredstieglitz #stieglitzgroup #georgiaokeeffe #louisianamuseum #louisianamuseumofmodernart #maineart #maineartist #robertasmith #jerrysaltz #metropolitanmuseumofart #whitneymuseum @alexandregallery

name: 2019-09-23 01.18.27 2138667938663005154_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Did you know Forestbathing dates back to the 1800’s?  Ok it’s a stretch. But the Romantic painters were fascinated by nature. Pictured here is the painting “Two Men Gazing at the Moon” by Caspar David Freidrich. It’s currently on view at the Met as part of the exhibition “Apollo's Muse: The Moon in the Age of Photography”. Notice the uprooted oak, fir tree and boulder. If you can’t always be in nature so you can “Art Bathe” to get that fix. #forestbathing #shinrinyoku #waldbaden #baindeforet #metsäkylpy #bosbaden #artbathing #romanticart #moongazing #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #nature #naturefix #culturedforest #naturelover #natureart #treestagram #caspardavidfriedrich #tothetrees #natureescape #artescape #artfix #vitaminn #intothewoods

name: 2019-09-23 04.34.45 2138766743370503725_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “The Rocky Mountains, Lander's Peak” 1863 by Albert Bierstadt in “The Metropolitan Museum of Art”, New York. This painting is the major work that resulted from the artist's first trip to the West. His intention to create panoramic views of the American frontier was apparent by December 1858, just before he embarked on the trip. In early 1859 he accompanied a government survey expedition, headed by Frederick W. Lander, to the Nebraska Territory. By summer, the party had reached the Wind River Range of the Rocky Mountains in what is now Wyoming. Bierstadt dubbed the central mountain in the picture Lander's Peak following the colonel's death in the Civil War. This was one of a number of large works painted after Bierstadt's return from these travels. It was completed in 1863, exhibited to great acclaim, and purchased in 1865 for the then-astounding sum of $25,000 by James McHenry, an American living in London. Bierstadt later bought it back and gave or sold it to his brother Edward. #tbt #therockymountainslanderspeak #albertbierstadt #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #painting #greatpaintings #masterpiece #nofilter #newyork #newyorkcity #travel #vacation #wanderlust #travelgram #instatravel #beautifuldestinations #aroundtheworld #solotravel

name: 2019-09-23 04.50.45 2138774790595647025_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: urban dwelling..From Williamsburg Bridge, #EdwardHopper, 1928."Here #Hopper depicts the austere façades of four apartment buildings and reduced the steel suspension #bridge that gives the #painting its name to the margins. Completed in 1903 and connecting #Brooklyn with #Manhattan, the structure is indicated only by the unobtrusive railing rising at the slight diagonal along the bottom of the #canvas. As opposed to focusing on the bridge that facilitates movement in and out of the city, Hopper creates an image absent of noise or motion. He emphasizes the #alienation and #anonymity of #urbanlife by including a single figure: a woman sitting alone in a top-story window."..@metmuseum #museum #artmuseum #art #modernArt #americanpainter #arthistory #americanmodernism #oiloncanvas #williamsburg #williamsburgbridge #newyorkcity #newyork #nyc #latergram #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-23 05.22.04 2138790552890869504_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: “Thérèse” 1938 by Balthus (Balthasar Klossowski) in “The Metropolitan Museum of Art”, New York. This painting is one of the most controversial works in art history. Thérèse Blanchard (1925-50) poses in Balthus’s studio at 3 Cour de Rohan in Paris. Between 1936 and 1939, he painted ten portraits of this young neighbor, alone as here, with her cast, or with her brother. Thérèse inaugurated the leitmotif of the artist’s oeuvre, of a girl poised between childhood and adolescence. #tbt #therese #balthus #balthasarklossowski #metropolitanmuseumofart #art #painting #greatpaintings #masterpiece #nofilter #art #painting #greatpaintings #masterpiece #nofilter #travel #vacation #wanderlust #travelgram #instatravel #beautifuldestinations #aroundtheworld #solotravel

name: 2019-09-23 07.18.16 2138849036327856229_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: • HEY THERE • I didn’t bring my camera out of my bag when we got into Manhattan, until we went to the @metmuseum. When I’m on vacation I don’t want to feel like I’m working. Even though taking photos is something I love to do, I enjoy taking photos of my couples but not myself. Still, it’s something that I’m trying to get better at, so here are a few photos of me at the MET. My couples tell me that they’re awkward in front of cameras, but they’ll never be as awkward as me, lol.

text: This is “Tiger”, Jerry Garcia’s custom guitar presented to him by Doug Irwin in 1979 after 3,000 hours and nearly 6 years of work. The craftsmanship is beautiful and Jerry played this guitar exclusively in live shows until 1989. He continued to tour with it and played it at his last show in 1995. #jerrygarcia #gratefuldead #tigerguitar #guitar #deadshows #deadheads #livedead #rockandroll #metropolitanmuseumofart #playitloud

text: #LeMillLoves Artist in Residence Nikhil Chopra's durational performance and installation at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Over the course of 9 consecutive days, he made his way through the Met to create enormous landscape drawings using elements of the sky, water and land. Chopra is also the first artist in The Met’s history to live within the Museum for any duration of time.•Nikhil Chopra, 2019–20 Artist in Residence, Lands, Waters, Skies at The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Photo by Stephanie Berger

text: "it is a playground to us..." (detail).48"x43"Oil on marble plastered panel,  polished wax surface and gold leaf2019.nathanielgalka.com."My work... is recently about the environment and the displacement of plants and animals for the vanity of humans. My focus now is about how we are placing non-indigenous plants in locations and disrupting nature. I highlight our need for conservation of domestic flora and fauna through historical and aesthetic references in my paintings.".📸 @myloveishugeCopyright 2019..#americanartist #photography #chinoiserie #flowers #nathanielgalkaart #nathanielgalka #nycgallery #magicalrealism #kunst #artstudio #art #gaynyc #newyorkartist #nyc #newyorkcity #fineart #interiordesign #painting #losangelesartist #gallery #chelseagalleries#landscape #paintedflowers #instagay #metropolitanmuseumofart #contemporaryartist #instagramartist #dutchmasters #contemporarypainting

name: 2019-09-24 00.16.47 2139361674581654729_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Celebrate the autumnal equinox with the preliminary drawing and print from the series of seasons Goltzius published around 1594! The strong pen and ink outlines and the tonal values indicated with wash were meant to guide the engraver, who was expected to translate the washes into patterns of burin lines. Jan Saenredam, who worked for Goltzius from around 1589 to 1601, was most likely the engraver of the print.Hendrick Goltzius (Netherlandish, 1558–1617), Autumn; Study for an Engraving, n.d. Pen and brown ink, red-brown wash, over black chalk, heightened with a little white gouache. Rogers Fund, 1961 (61.25.2)Jan (Pietersz.) Saenredam (Netherlandish, 1565–1607). Autumn, from the series The Seasons,n.d. Engraving. The Elisha Whittelsey Collection, The Elisha Whittelsey Fund, 1949 (49.97.638)#fallingforfall #autumn #autumnalequinox #HendrickGoltzius #Goltzius #JanSaenredam #drawingsforprints #preliminarydrawing #penandink #almostinktober #noneedtoguess #metonpaper100 #metonpaper #metdrawingsandprints #metropolitanmuseumofart #metmuseum #themet

text: Paul Cézanne, Seated Peasant, 1892, oil on canvas, 55 х 45 cm, Metropolitan Museum, New York. Paul Cézanne’s art grew out of Impressionism and challenged the conventional values of painting in the 19th century. He insisted on personal expression and the integrity of the painting itself, regardless of subject matter. Cézanne tried to reveal the inner geometry of nature in his work, or as he expressed: "to make of Impressionism something solid and durable". Cézanne’s intellectual approach to formal issues, particularly his spatial explorations, laid the foundation for Picasso and other artists’ subsequent explorations with Cubism, while his investigations of color and brushstroke influenced Matisse and other Fauve artists in the first decade of the century. Although misunderstood and discredited during most of his life, over the years the public and critics embraced his work. Picasso offered perhaps the most truthful description of Cézanne’s role for subsequent generations of artists, declaring that he was “the father of us all”. Seated Peasant is one of several  paintings by Cézanne of peasants who worked on the Cézanne family estate known as Le Jas de Bouffan. The tone and color is similar to his famous series of paintings showing men playing cards. The unknown peasant probably sits in the kitchen of Jas de Bouffan. His hat is pushed back on his head and his suit has been painted in grey and brown tones. Cezanne gives him a calm, solid pose, devoid of any gesture or expression, which lends him a certain solemnity.Check out my other accounts:@art_questions_and_debates & @my_favorite_work_of_art#paulcezanne #paulcézanne #cezanne #cézanne #thecardplayers #cardplayers #metropolitanmuseum #montsaintevictoire #postimpressionism #impressionism #provence #frenchart #frenchartist #seatedpeasant #metropolitanmuseumofart

name: 2019-09-24 10.52.28 2139681626216921038_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Couldn’t be more excited to share with you all the centerpiece of @metmuseum 150th anniversary (and my life) “Making The Met, 1870-2020,” opening exactly six months from today! One thing that never gets old about working here is the privilege of lifting ropes to go behind the scenes of this storied institution. These views date back to our original building on 5th Avenue, designed in the Victorian Gothic style by Calvert Vaux and Jacob Wrey Mould (1880), and the names are those who shaped our so-called “first half century of struggle and growth.” We’ll take a look at the art, architecture, and people who transformed the Museum during these early formative years up through the present day. Come visit between March 23 and August 2, 2020!...#metmondays #metmuseum #makingthemet #met150 #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #methistory #victoriangothic #founders

name: 2019-09-24 10.57.27 2139684137540561043_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: Today I visited the Antonio Ratti Textile Center at the Met! I had an appointment to view some 19th-century coverlets for an upcoming project in my History of Textiles class. This was my first time viewing textiles in a museum collection and it was very cool to have a one on one experience with these objects. I can’t share the photographs I took (including one at 21x magnification!), but here are some pics from the Met’s website. One of the coverlets I saw was this 1839 double weave coverlet woven by Henry Tyler, who lived and worked in Jefferson County, NY. I love those little lions in the corner blocks! #weaving #textiles #textilehistory #handweaving #themet #metropolitanmuseumofart #nyc #gradschool #fashionhistory #coverlet #doubleweave #antoniorattitextilecenter

name: 2019-09-24 11.42.32 2139706828865643490_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: In the King Arthur stories, errant knights often fail to recognize one another, when they encounter each other out of context. I could totally sympathize if they were just bad with faces, but it turns out, the reason they don't recognize each other in the stories is because their helmets covered their faces entirely. It could be anybody in there! That said, this particular suit of armor is pretty distinctive. #met #metropolitanmuseumofart #medieval #armor #knight

name: 2019-09-24 12.15.02 2139723186434775426_metropolitanmuseumofart.jpg
text: NYC: MetMuseum.  Tonight The Met welcomed members after hours.  I was asked to be part of the Met Educator team and was assigned the  gallery hung with early work by Picasso, seen here, as well as Matisse and other 20th c  artists whose careers began in the 19th c. I decided to concentrate on the rapid development of Picasso’s career in 4 important works.  I loved researching these works and working on my presentations which were well received.  And as always it was a great learning experience for me. I have  an even greater admiration forPicasso’s great talent and his artistic daring and creativity. #picasso #pablopicasso #metropolitanmuseumofart #modernart
